name: Stylish Sunny Apartment with Designer Finishes
summary: Discover a relaxed atmosphere in this sleek designer apartment. Wake up to a sunshine-filled space featuring views overlooking the city and the neighbouring park, contemporary furnishings, a balcony walkout, and pops of colour throughout.
space: Epitomising inner-city styling with its quality finishes and thoughtful detailing, this open plan first floor apartment comprises a large living area which opens to a private decked balcony with barbecue. Sleek kitchen with s/steel appliances, European style laundry with washer & dryer, study nook, bathroom off entrance hall with shower over bath.  Other features include, video security entrance as well as remote under cover garaging, lift access, secure entrance, dishwasher, air-con and more! Wifi internet and Foxtel pay TV included free of charge.
description: Discover a relaxed atmosphere in this sleek designer apartment. Wake up to a sunshine-filled space featuring views overlooking the city and the neighbouring park, contemporary furnishings, a balcony walkout, and pops of colour throughout.
neighborhood_overview: With Chapel Street a stone's throw from the front door, guests will enjoy a wonderful range of bars, restaurants, and great coffee spots. The apartment also has easy access to downtown and the rest of the city with Melbourne's public transport.
notes: Discounted rates are offered for 7+ & 28+ nights. Complimentary tea, coffee, milk and guest amenities are offered on all properties managed by THE CONCIERGE (Aust).
transit: If you want to get to the centre of town, transport from here is plentiful with Windsor station just opposite the entrance to the building. You can take the train direct into Flinders St station (approx. 10mins) or catch a tram from Dandenong Rd (approx. 30mins).
access: Entry to the property is via a personal meet & greet with The Concierge (Aust).  Arrivals between 9:30am-6:00pm will incur no additional charge. Arrivals between 6am-9:30am & 6:00pm-10:30pm will be charged an additional $20.00. Arrivals between 10:30pm-6am will be charged an additional $50.00. Additional charges are to be paid in cash on arrival. An email will be sent to the guests personal email within 48 hours of arrival with specific instructions. We do require the guest to contact us when 30 minutes away so we can meet them at the property on time.  A valid credit card with photo ID in the card holders name is required on arrival to cover any incidental charges.
interaction: Someone who’s offsite will be available as needed
house_rules: To maintain a good standard for our guests we require certain conditions to be complied with. We appreciate most will respect our property but the occasional abuse requires that we state the following conditions: •Damage, Breakages, Theft and Loss are the tenants responsibility during their stay. •Number of Guests should not exceed the number stated on the Confirmation Notice or subsequently agreed in writing or email. Fees will apply for excess guests not agreed with the owners in advance. •Parties and Functions are strictly prohibited. The price charged is for domestic use only and not commercial. Accordingly this rate does not allow for the extra wear associated with functions in terms of cleaning, garbage removal, wear and tear, repairs etc. Use contrary to this may result in loss of your bond and/or additional payments.  •Departure - the property should be left in a similar state to its condition on arrival. Check-out time is 10.00am. Dishes should be cleaned and rubbish removed.
host_about: My name is Ben and I have been an Airbnb host since 2011. I love welcoming guests to my apartment and I’m very happy to assist in making your stay most enjoyable.

name: Unique, Intimately Styled South Yarra Sanctuary
summary: Kick back on the balcony at a dramatic, contemporary home filled with candles, plants, books, and artwork. Dark and modern with brooding charcoal-grey walls and clean lines, the space has been used for photoshoots and filming.
space: @__littlejourney__ Situated on Claremont Street, above South Yarra's most bustling cafe, Two Birds One Stone (type into web browser "broadsheet two birds one stone"). I guarantee you'll enjoy this perfectly positioned residence -  The apartment is new and elegantly styled (OLY, Mezai, Coco Republic). It is a 1 bedroom with high ceilings on the 15th floor (there are 16 floors). It comes fully furnished with Sheridan linen (amazing flax linen is to die for) and fluffy Sheridan towels. An east facing corner apartment with Chapel Street and mountain views - no expense has been spared for you to enjoy this perfectly positioned residence.  The apartment is just minutes walk away from an abundant mix of cafés and restaurants (see my guidebook for a comprehensive listing, otherwise I'll be sure to message you with a selection of cafes once your reservation is confirmed). I also adore the convenience of every single service (e.g. yoga, vegan cafe, supermarket (Western + Asian), dry cleaner, hai
description: Kick back on the balcony at a dramatic, contemporary home filled with candles, plants, books, and artwork. Dark and modern with brooding charcoal-grey walls and clean lines, the space has been used for photoshoots and filming.
neighborhood_overview: South Yarra is a blend of fast and slow. The standard of living is high, the area is safe, and the food is excellent. Close to the CBD, the bay, and major shopping districts, it's perfect for living in true Melbourne style.
notes: preference for young couples from overseas / mature couples / business owners / professionals relocating or on long term contracts. I also provide myki cards to all my guests so you can get around on the trains, trams and buses hassle free. After that just leave the card behind before you leave! ***security deposit is paid only through Airbnb resolution process if you break / lose something in the apartment - it is not paid when you book***
transit: 5 minute walk to South Yarra train station or tram on Toorak Rd, taking you direct into CBD. Car space available (free).
access: as a guest, you're welcome to the fridge and a fully stocked pantry.
interaction: I love interacting with all my guests however much or little - don't hesitate to text, call or send me a message via Airbnb. I'm usually always very close by if you need me in the event of an (unlikely) emergency!
house_rules: please water the lavender / herb garden / olive tree (especially in summer)! no uninvited guests / no excessive noise / no wild parties (small gatherings are fine) please respect my lovely neighbours Jen and David :) smoking only the balcony (not in the bedroom or anywhere in the apartment) guests who smoke in the apartment will be charged the penalty of room fee for one day and deodorisation cost  any lost keys or swipes will incur a flat $100 replacement fee
host_about:
My name is Mia.

Airbnb and I have been together since 2011 :) 

I'm in my final year of psychology at The University of Melbourne so my dear friend Tatyana is helping to manage your stay. We will always be thinking of you! 

Tatyana is Russian but learning Spanish. She's teaching me Spanish but I'm nowhere as good as her :)

We love it when the apartments look perfect and have mild ocd for details and cleaning - your stay is in perfectly good hands ;)

 Send us a message and say hello!

We hope to see you soon :)

Mia & Tatyana

name: Angelus Retreat @ Mount Dandenong
summary: Our homely 2 bedroom cottage is in the heart of Sherbrooke Forrest yet with views to the distant bay and cafes and shops nearby.  Enjoy our pet alpacas, meditate to the sounds of the 2 cascading ponds or take the wombat walk on our 23 acre property.
space: Welcome to ANGELUS for your R & R, your private cottage is so comfortable you will not want to leave! Though only less than 1.25 hrs from Melbourne CBD, it feels like you are in the country side, away from noise, busyness and clutter. The accommodation is a recently converted self contained 2 bedroom cottage on a 23 acre hillside Retreat property on Mount Dandenong, with 3 pet alpacas in paddock and open meditation path looking out to Port Phillip Bay in the distance. Peaceful, serene amidst kookaburras, wallabys, parrots and Sherbrooke forrest walks with cafes and restaurants nearby. We have our very own "wombat walk"on the property where their homes along the walk is clearly visible. Both bedrooms have own ensuite with private spa, full kitchen, laundry, TV, DVD player and BBQ facilities. Linen provided. You will need to have a car as your means for getting around and car parking is just next to your cottage. Welcome to use the indoor 15 metre lap pool in the main home and we can hel

house_rules: No smoking in the cottage No pets. Stays more than 1 week  - cleaning fee $150  Stays more than 2 week  - cleaning fee $200 plus professional steam cleaning fee of $200.  Portion of total cleaning fee can be refunded if extra cleaning is not required at the discretion of hosts.
host_about:
I have very special interests in Life and Life matters. I love to cook, travel, hear your life experiences & stories and connect with people from our hearts. I love being the helper for people's shining. Recently I've come back from a near death experience riding the rapids of the mighty Zambezi at Victoria Falls - with a renewed sense of purpose and feeling inspired.

Having had conventional medical and alternative, complementary medicine practice of 30 +yrs and more than 35,000 hours consultation experience, I am putting my message in a book and a program called "What our Bodies Ache For - uncovering repressed longings hidden in body symptoms, anxiety, depression and chronic illness"
I would like to dispel the myths of current medical thinking and inspire our systems to work on the cause rather than just the symptoms. Preventative medicine is not just about screening physical bodies but need to address underlying dis-ease ( lack of ease) in our emotions, mind and spirit).

I have a  luscious Retreat set up called ANGELUS in Mount Dandenong Melbourne, a 23 acre property for stress management and residential workshops from where you can have transformative experiences, make new friends, embrace new ways of being and return home with more of your Essence.

Therapies for a more focussed physical rejuvenation, revitailisation utilising the best practices in wholistic, complementary and functional medicine are accessed from the clinic in Burwood Melbourne. Details can be got from (Website hidden by Airbnb) 
My message? - "Live, Learn, Love, Grow"

neighborhood_overview: Elwood is located just 8 kilometers from Melbourne City Centre, right next to vibrant St Kilda and upmarket Brighton. Down a private laneway, in a quiet position you’ll find the townhouse. This opens out onto Brighton Road Village with cafes, restaurants, pubs and convenience store. Here you’ll find a tram stop that links to Melbourne City Centre in a matter of minutes! Carlisle Street shopping Village is also just a 10 minute walk away. With everything at your doorstep, this is the perfect place to stay in Elwood!
notes: Ground floor double storey townhouse with internal stairs to second level. Not suitable for children. THANK YOU! Thanks for taking the time to read our Listing. We really appreciate it! Let us know you have by mentioning 'Read the Listing!' in your first message to us. Cheers, Frank and Vince
transit: Our townhouse is located right in the heart of Brighton Road Elwood Village, with everything literally at your doorstep. For travelling further afield, the Brighton Road tram stop is located only meters away, so getting around is a breeze!
access: Guests have exclusive and private access to the entire property. Check-in details provided once booking is confirmed.
interaction: We don't always get to meet all our guests in person, however we're available if you need us! Simply get in touch and we'll be happy to help out with any questions or assistance you may need before or during your stay.
house_rules: Please take a moment now to read our House Rules. COMMUNICATION All communication is via airbnb messaging only. Ensure you have AIRBNB APP and mobile connectivity, so we can easily communicate. GUEST BOOKING, GUEST NUMBER, GUESTS STAYING AND BEDDING For personal travel, you as guest booking must be one of guests staying for entire stay. Number of guests staying limited to maximum number allowed in property and as confirmed and paid for in airbnb. Where bedding options offered, such as king beds or king single beds, you must request your preference at time of booking. Where extra bedding offered, no extra bedding provided if number of guests staying is property standard occupancy, unless extra bedding is requested and paid for by you in airbnb at time of booking. Bedding preferences / extra bedding can not be guaranteed. SELF CHECK IN FROM 3PM / SELF CHECK-OUT TO 10AM Following information in AIRBNB APP: - DIRECTIONS TO PROPERTY - SELF CHECK-IN/OUT PROCEDURE - WIFI DETAILS - HOUSE MANUA
host_about:
Hi, we’re Frank and Vince.

Thanks for reading our profile.

We love hosting, and when time permits, travelling!

As guests, we understand and appreciate the guest/host relationship, so will always be respectful of both you and your home, and look forward to sharing the experience.

As hosts, we thank you for considering us for your Melbourne stay. You can view all our airbnb apartments and homes here: https://www.airbnb.com.au/users/50121/listings

We've been welcoming guests to our homes since 2009, when we established 'a2c urban stays Melbourne', a collection of unique, hand-selected inner Melbourne properties, specifically designed for welcoming, memorable short stays.

Featuring stylish contemporary interiors, in the best lifestyle locations, our properties are situated in the very heart of Melbourne’s hippest inner-city areas. All our apartments and homes are within a short stroll of cafes, restaurants, shopping, night life and public transport. Cultural and sporting facilities including MCG/Hisense/Etihad Stadiums, Melbourne waterfront, Melbourne City Centre and some of Melbourne’s best beaches are easily accessible.

Our guests enjoy free wifi, superior comfort beds, high quality bed linens and towels, entertainment systems offering large flat screen TVs, sound systems, books, magazines, air-conditioning*, heating, full size fully equipped kitchens with Euro appliances, laundry facilities*, parking*, complimentary starter provisions and housekeeping service for longer stays*.
*Please enquire before booking.

Exceeding guest expectations is what we’re about.

If you’re looking for a truly special and authentic Melbourne experience, in a warm, stylish inviting space that is close to the many wonderful attractions our city is famous for, then we’re the perfect choice. Feel free to contact us and we’ll be happy to assist you plan your perfect stay.

As hosts, we look forward to welcoming you. As guests, we look forward to discovering your home and surrounds.

Warm regards,

Frank and Vince

name: sunlit studio down a quiet laneway
summary: You enter from a quiet heritage laneway, with bluestone stables and architectural remnants from the mid 1800's  through our workshop to the studio. It is three storeys and includes two bathrooms,  three bedrooms, living/kitchen, laundry, verandah and views over the rooftops. Two or three minutes walk to Brunswick, Smith or Gertrude streets. Close to all Fitzroy has to offer, yet peaceful at night.
space: Our studio is down a quiet back lane in Fitzroy. we have 1 x Double, 1 x Queen plus 1 x Single beds. We can provide a cot suitable for 0 to about 3, or an extra single bed if you are a family of six. *You enter on the ground level through our workshop. When you enter through your doorway you will find a laundry with washing machine and a separate bathroom with shower and toilet. Also a small bedroom with a single bed. *On the middle level there is a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, fan-forced oven, and all you need to cook...that's if you can resist the many fabulous cafes in the surrounding streets!The living area has comfy couch and opens onto a verandah to take the air and dry the washing. Still on this level a bedroom with queen size bed. We can put a child's cot or a small bed in this common space. *On the top level there's another queen size bed and en-suite bathroom with bath and views over the rooftops. It's well stocked with basic toiletries and basic kitchen
description: You enter from a quiet heritage laneway, with bluestone stables and architectural remnants from the mid 1800's  through our workshop to the studio. It is three storeys and includes two bathrooms,  three bedrooms, living/kitchen, laundry, verandah and views over the rooftops. Two or three minutes walk to Brunswick, Smith or Gertrude streets. Close to all Fitzroy has to offer, yet peaceful at night. Our studio is down a quiet back lane in Fitzroy. we have 1 x Double, 1 x Queen plus 1 x Single beds. We can provide a cot suitable for 0 to about 3, or an extra single bed if you are a family of six. *You enter on the ground level through our workshop. When you enter through your doorway you will find a laundry with washing machine and a separate bathroom with shower and toilet. Also a small bedroom with a single bed. *On the middle level there is a fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, fan-forced oven, and all you need to cook...that's if you can resist the many fabulous cafes i
neighborhood_overview: Fitzroy has been called "the centre of the universe" for good reasons! An exciting area with a focus on the visual and performing arts, food, fashion and independant retail. It takes about five/ten minutes to walk to the city and is close to the major hospitals and universities, Melbourne Museum and the Exhibition Building. Twenty minute walk to the Victoria Market, or a tram ride. Thirty minutes to Collingwood Children's Farm and artist's/farmer's markets. Much has been said of Brunswick St, running down the middle of Fitzroy and it's unique atmosphere and galleries, venues, bars and cafes. Gertrude St was the first block outside the city to be sub-divided and has many bluestone buildings from the 1860's that now house quirky be-spoke designer makers and "stand alone" retailers ...from men's hats at SMART, Alec to organic bread at Fatto a Mano. Gertrude St Projection Festival transforms the street in winter annually. Smith St epitomizes the incredible blend of cultures that call Fitzr
notes: You should be aware the house is over three levels, open plan and there are stairs. It is made of bluestone and recycled materials, was once an old stable, so quirky and atmospheric...not your average dwelling!
transit: A tram on every corner! The Smith/Gertrude Sts tram, the number 86 takes you down Bourke St into town. The Brunswick St tram, number 11, takes you down Collins St into town and to Docklands. The Nicholson St tram, number 96 takes you all the way to St. Kilda. Two minutes walk to Victoria Parade trams and buses.  Five minute walk to Johnston St buses. If you are driving we have on street parking,so it is sometimes difficult to find a spot. Better to use the many forms of public transport around us. A cab to the airport takes between 30 minutes to an hour, depending on the traffic. Or catch a tram into the city and the airport bus from there. To get to Southern Cross Station (Spencer st station) take the Smith/Gertrude St tram number 86.
access: You will have the whole house to yourselves and your entrance is separate from ours. The backyard has a table and chairs so you can enjoy the garden. We can arrange car off street from time to time, by arrangement. This car space is not always available so feel free to ask.
interaction: We are close by and available to answer any questions you may have. It is a private self contained space and we will probably not see each other unless we meet in the garden....great spot to chat under the grapevine as the sun goes down.
house_rules: *Happy to work out special prices for kids under 12 *We have school age residents so the backyard is only for daytime use as we go to bed early. *Likewise this is not a place for parties, sorry. *Smoking outside or on the verandah. *rubbish and recycling needs to be in the relevant bins on tuesday nights. *you must wash your own dishes and keep the space clean.
host_about: We both design and make things,objects and wearable and have lived in Fitzroy for a long time and have seen it blossom and grow. We are surrounded by galleries, performance spaces, providores of food, markets and interesting stand alone makers. Wouldn't live anywhere else!

name: Fitzroyalty - luscious living in the heart of it
summary: In the heart of Fitzroy, immerse yourself in the Melbournian lifestyle. A stone's throw from everything that Melbourne has to offer.
space: This top floor apartment is in a brilliant location 100m to Brunswick Street and the Carlton Gardens and everything on your doorstep (pubs, bars, shops, cafés, supermarket, gardens – you name it). This light and modern, fully renovated apartment has city views, and a stylish living area to relax in.  Although you will be in the heart of it all, my place is a warm, comfy and quiet refuge. It is not unusual to spot rainbow lorikeets on my balcony, while sitting on the sofa!
description: In the heart of Fitzroy, immerse yourself in the Melbournian lifestyle. A stone's throw from everything that Melbourne has to offer. This top floor apartment is in a brilliant location 100m to Brunswick Street and the Carlton Gardens and everything on your doorstep (pubs, bars, shops, cafés, supermarket, gardens – you name it). This light and modern, fully renovated apartment has city views, and a stylish living area to relax in.  Although you will be in the heart of it all, my place is a warm, comfy and quiet refuge. It is not unusual to spot rainbow lorikeets on my balcony, while sitting on the sofa! You will have access to the whole apartment including: Large bedroom  - city view - new queen size bed with luxury sheets and quilts - waffle robe and slippers - build in robe with coat hangers and drawers - iron and board  - tissues - soft lighting and good light blocking curtains Fully equipped kitchen  - Nespresso coffee provided - tea and milk provided - cooking basics such as oil, s
neighborhood_overview: I love Fitzroy because is is walking distance to the city, and is the best place to dwell when you are in Melbourne. Amazing brunch/lunch and dinner options are all on your doorstep. As are galleries, fashion boutiques, music venues, bars and local Aussie pubs.  Plenty of parks and public transport too. My place is a short walk to: - Brunswick Street (100m) - Gertrude Street (500m) - Smith Street (850m) - Royal Exhibition Buildings (250m) - Melbourne Museum (250m) - Carlton Gardens (150m) - St Vincent's Hospital (700m) - Melbourne City (950m) - Lygon Street Restaurants (950m)  - Theatres (Princess Theatre & Her Magesty's Theatre) (1km) - Melbourne Cricket Ground: MCG (1km)   There is also a small supermarket and bottle shop at the end of my street (approx 100m).
transit: Everything is quick and easy to get to from my place! You can WALK to the city in about ten minutes (through the Carlton Gardens).  Alternatively you can jump on #86  and #112 TRAMS at the end of my street (approx 1 minute walk). If you need the TRAIN, Parliament Station is a quick 10 minute walk from my place. I have maps to give you to make this easy, it is all very simple and convenient.
access: You will have access to the whole apartment including: Large bedroom  - city view - new queen size bed with luxury sheets and quilts - waffle robe and slippers - build in robe with coat hangers and drawers - iron and board  - tissues - soft lighting and good light blocking curtains Fully equipped kitchen  - Nespresso coffee provided - tea and milk provided - cooking basics such as oil, salt and pepper, and some sauces - breakfast cereal also provided Living area - city view - Smart TV with Netflix and Stan (and DVD player) - WIFI  - stereo with connection for iPod. - large comfy sofa Balcony - city view - luscious green balcony  - two comfy rattan cane chairs to enjoy a glass of wine at sunset - hammock available Bathroom - thick and soft towels  - soap, shampoo and conditioner provided - hairdryer - lovely hot shower Parking - parking available (please advise in advance)
interaction: My phone is always on for any questions that you may have.  If you need an early check in or late check out I may be able to accommodate this, please let me know.
house_rules: - please be respectful of my neighbours. - no smoking please. - please respect and care for my things.
host_about:
I'm a professional consultant in my mid-thirties. My boyfriend and I love living in Fitzroy. I am native to Melbourne and I love my city!

I love travelling and try to go on at least one big adventure a year.  When I do I love staying with Airbnb and meeting new people along the way.

name: Great Room in Fabulous Caulfield S
space: Welcome to Melbourne and fabulous Caulfield South!! Your room is a double bedroom with a large wardrobe and plenty of storage space.  There is a newly renovated modern bathroom to share. The kitchen facilities include a dishwasher and a Nespresso machine for your morning caffeine hit!  There is a full kitchen available for all your culinary needs! There is a rear courtyard for entertaining, or just to enjoy the fresh air. Feel free to make use of the laundry facilities, washer and dryer.  There is unlimited wireless internet available! Please note the minimum stay is 14 nights and the place is available from 10 September 2012. My place is in a great location with a tram stop just outside the door, and it's a 20 minute ride into the city There is a  24hr convenience store at 1min walk. We are located close to the beach and supermarkets.  Enjoy the best of Melbourne from fabulous Caulfield South, just near Brighton beach!

name: The Suite @ Angelus Retreat
space: Welcome to ANGELUS Retreat Suite @ Mount Dandenong for your R & R. Though only less than 1.25 hrs from Melbourne CBD, it feels like you are in the country side, away from noise, busyness and clutter. A place for healing, reflection or just visiting. The self contained 2 bedroom accomodatrion is a recent addition to the ANGELUS RETREAT  on a 23 acre hillside Retreat property on Mount Dandenong, with 3 pet alpacas in paddock and open meditation path looking out to Port Phillip Bay in the distance. Peaceful, serene amidst kookaburras, wallabys, parrots and Sherbrooke forrest walks with cafes and restaurants nearby. We have our very own "wombat walk"on the property where their homes along the walk is clearly visible. Both bedrooms have own ensuite with private spa, wifi, TV, DVD player. Adjoining  open plan guest living room has kitchenette, dining area, TV area and fire place.Linen provided. Public transport ( bus and train) is nearby . To visit the tourist sites and sanctuaries around, i

To visit the tourist sites and sanctuaries around, i
house_rules: No pets Normal respect as if this is your home
host_about:
I have very special interests in Life and Life matters. I love to cook, travel, hear your life experiences & stories and connect with people from our hearts. I love being the helper for people's shining. Recently I've come back from a near death experience riding the rapids of the mighty Zambezi at Victoria Falls - with a renewed sense of purpose and feeling inspired.

Having had conventional medical and alternative, complementary medicine practice of 30 +yrs and more than 35,000 hours consultation experience, I am putting my message in a book and a program called "What our Bodies Ache For - uncovering repressed longings hidden in body symptoms, anxiety, depression and chronic illness"
I would like to dispel the myths of current medical thinking and inspire our systems to work on the cause rather than just the symptoms. Preventative medicine is not just about screening physical bodies but need to address underlying dis-ease ( lack of ease) in our emotions, mind and spirit).

I have a  luscious Retreat set up called ANGELUS in Mount Dandenong Melbourne, a 23 acre property for stress management and residential workshops from where you can have transformative experiences, make new friends, embrace new ways of being and return home with more of your Essence.

Therapies for a more focussed physical rejuvenation, revitailisation utilising the best practices in wholistic, complementary and functional medicine are accessed from the clinic in Burwood Melbourne. Details can be got from (Website hidden by Airbnb) 
My message? - "Live, Learn, Love, Grow"

name: Best, west of Melbourne-Wifi & Spa1
summary: Ask for availability if you want to book multiple rooms. We offer up to 4 private rooms in a brand new house with custom made furniture. The house has 4 living rooms/sitting areas. We have a fully stocked bar, outdoor spa and a gym at your disposal. Free WiFi, BBQ area, Playstation, 4 bicycles and hundreds of dvd's are available to all guests as is our huge kitchen for those who wish to cook up a feast.
space: If you wish to make a booking for more than one room (2 people), contact us FIRST before using instant booking and for pricing. And ESPECIALLY for bookings over Christmas,  for that time ALL reservations need to be confirmed with us first. If we are booked for the time you are requesting, please still get in touch as we  have 3 bedrooms and a 4th extra room available and can accommodate up to 10 people as we have 5 double beds available across the 4 rooms.  Rooms will be allocated according to guest needs, so if guest require a certain room as a condition of their booking, make sure to ask first. We would like to invite you to our brand new, purpose built house for guests, we have 3 private rooms with double beds and a 4th etxre room with a sofa bed overlooking a beautiful park. Each room features your own tv, air condition/heater, your own desk, built in wardrobes, private tenant bathroom and a separate guest living room. The house is over 330sqm and has tons of space, counting 3 livi

Rooms will be allocated according to guest needs, so if guest require a certain room as a condition of their booking, make sure to
neighborhood_overview: Boredom should not be an issue as there is a 18 hole golf course, several gyms and an aquatic center within 2 km from the house, not to mention a scenic bike track.
notes: The house is in a safe and secure neighborhood, but for added ease of mind we have security cameras covering the front of the house and the side. All rooms have lockable doors and guests get a set of keys peer room.
transit: The bus leaves out the front of our house and the local train station in down the road, we also provide bikes free of charge so guests can take them to the station or even into the city. If arriving or leaving by plane, train or any other method of transport, we also offer a pick up/drop off service for $40 AUD whenever possible, a taxi from the airport could be close to double.
access: Guests have access to everything in the house and as seen in our pictures except our bedroom and our cars :-) So Kitchen, BBQ, Spa, Gym etc. is at at your disposal.
interaction: We live at the property and love to socialize, but as the house is huge all guests will have an option of privacy if they wish. There is a living room for each bedroom so space is never a problem. We have lots of suggestions for things to do and places to see, we have even made several tours for you to follow, all collected in our house information book, this also includes the most price competitive options for travel and car rentals etc. With experience of working in hotels Ryan and Rhiannon also have prepared a welcome pack you will find in your room with lots of information and maps that will be useful during your stay. We even have self serve room menu with drinks and snacks if you run out of you own!
house_rules: We would appreciate it if people booking, please make sure your profile has a picture of you  :-)  As the house is full of artwork and custom made furniture we only accept young children if full accountability is taken for any damages, we hope you can understand. We do not allow pets unless specifically requested and agreed to beforehand.  We do not allow smoking inside the house, but do have an area for you outside. If you loose the house keys we may charge for replacement of locks. We offer pick up and drop offs to airport or city if available for only $40 AUD, but please plan ahead. If you damage or break something you have to compensate or replace it if possible. We do not want you to feel as a guest staying with us, but as a friend that lives with us, make yourself at home. Only thing you can do wrong is not ask a question if you have one. We look forward to meeting you and sharing our home and city with you. Kind regards Ryan & Rhiannon
host_about:
Ryan and Rhiannon are your hosts
Ryan is a fashion designer and trained tailor, working from home.
Rhiannon also works in fashion as an account manager.
We both love movies, socializing with friends and enjoying everything Melbourne and life has to offer.
We recently completed out dream home and a large part of out dream was to be able to share it with others, keeping a fresh perspective on you surroundings is important, so you never forget to keep discovering. There is no better way of doing that than with friends from all over the world.
Ryan has lived 17 years in Norway and only came back to Australia when he was going to University.
Since then he has gained experience as a concierge, bartender etc. so between Ryan and Rhiannon you could not wish for better hosts.

name: Comfy room in Oakleigh South Melbourne
summary: A first floor room in a family home, with private bathroom, toilet and sitting room. 1 minute walk to local bus routes 631 and 824. 3k walk (or 10 minute bus) to train station. Bus direct to Monash university Clayton campus. Approx 40 minute public transport to Melbourne city centre. 5 min walk to supermarket, pharmacy and take away food outlets.
space: A separate bedroom with double bed and private bathroom. Guests are welcome to use the kitchen. There is a bus 50 metres from my home, that connects with the train line. Approximately 40 minutes travel on public transport to the city. 10 minutes by bus to the beach. 10 minutes by bus to large shopping complexes. WiFi available. There is a lovely space/garden outside the house to relax or read.  There is a large park with a lake only 10 minutes walk away. A supermarket and shops 5 minutes walk. This is a 4 bedroom family home with only one occupant. There are 2 separate living areas and 2 bathrooms, so guests can have some privacy, or some company if they would like. The room is upstairs. The sitting room, bathroom and separate toilet are also upstairs. I have a small parrot, but no other pets. I have a large collection of maps and tourist information, and can usually  pick up people from the train station or airport shuttle bus. This room has been used by backpackers, older tourists, p

neighborhood_overview: Oakleigh South is in the south-eastern suburbs of Melbourne. You can drive to Ferntree Gully and the Dandenongs in 1 hour (or train), or 15 min to the beach. The area is very multi-cultural, and the local shops have Indian, Vietnamese, Chinese specialty shops and restaurants.
transit: Public transport or your own car. No problem parking in the quiet street.
access: Guests will have a key, and can come and go as they please. I am a nurse and work varying shifts, so I appreciate guests being respectful of my sleep times. I leave quietly in the mornings, so guests are not disturbed.
house_rules: If you use the kitchen I expect you to clean up after yourself, but I am happy for guests to use the kitchen and some pantry items such as cooking oils and spices if they buy their own basic ingredients.  I work shift work as a nurse, so I don't like noise after I have gone to bed. No smoking inside the house, but outside is fine. I will provide the guest a key to the house in return for some form of identification or valuable, for example a drivers licence, home key.
host_about:
I am a nurse in a large city trauma centre. I work in the operating theatre. I enjoy cooking, gardening, going to galleries, movies and live theatre.

I love traveling and meeting new people. Melbourne is a lovely city with a lot to see and do. If I have time I help guests with transport, and working out how to get around Melbourne.

name: Exclusive Brighton by the beach
summary: Set in the middle of a vibrant bayside precinct. Turn left you will be spoilt for choice of cafes, shopping and the station (18 mins to cbd). Turn right and you will be at the beach - when you get to the beach at the end of Bay Street - left or right - either will delight you. Room is light and large.
space: I love to travel and love meeting people from all over the world, so I hope you will come and have a taste of the lovely area where I live and beyond. Brighton is an exclusive beachside area only 11Km from the heart of Melbourne - the most stylish and sophisticated city in Australia. Your Room Your room is very large and comfortable with two single beds. It faces east so the room is bathed in sunshine in the mornings. The room has a flatscreen TV and wifi, so you can stay connected with the world. You will have your very own large bathroom with large fluffy towels and guest toiletries, plus your own separate toilet. Breakfast A delicious continental breakfast can be provided for $5 per person, which includes gourmet breads, homemade jams, local honey, fresh Nespresso coffee or a selection of teas. Alternatively, the cafe scene is robust and you have a huge selection of cafés in the immediate neighbourhood. The Area The beaches, Royal Brighton Yacht Club, sea bat

transit: Train and buses are within easy walking distance. Train is the Sandringham Line (18 minutes to CBD)
access: Own bedroom, bathroom and toilet. Limited fridge space. Cooking ok within reason (please no cooking odours). Limited washing machine. Owner to be present. $2 per load. No dryer.
interaction: Host is available to answer any queries.
house_rules: This is a non-smoking property As I travel quite frequently, I may not be able to confirm a request outside of one month. No children.
host_about:
I love to travel and immerse myself in new cultures and cities. 
Though I learned French throughout my secondary education, I would not consider myself fluent, however, a new language is on my (bucket) list. 
Meeting new people is the best way to learn and expand horizons. So I look forward to meeting many new overseas visitors and I will be delighted to share my knowledge and  love of Australia and more specifically, Melbourne and Victoria.

name: Queen BR + Private Bathroom in Huge CBD Apartment
summary: Truly unique inner-city oasis only one block from Swanston Street, with a comfortable, friendly, older-style  household environment. This is a queen-bed room with a private bathroom in a large 1980s warehouse conversion, with a private garden courtyard and direct street access.   Specialising in medium and longer stays for academics,  students and relocations: we can help you find your find your feet in Melbourne, including assistance and references for finding longer term rental accommodation.
space: This is a queen bedroom in a 240 sq.m two-storey warehouse conversion that even has it's own backyard.  This room, which also has a large private bathroom, is well sized and fully furnished, including a study desk and built in wardrobe.    Guests have access to the whole house and all facilities - including a full kitchen, separate laundry, large rear courtyard, large living and dining areas.  WiFi is included although not unlimited.  There are  hundreds of books to read and DVDs to watch - but you'll be far too busy - as the house is only minutes walk from Melbourne's best restaurants, bars, galleries, gardens and shopping; including China Town, Victoria Market, Emporium and Melbourne Central. Please note that this is a 30 year old conversion in a 150+ year old building so not everything is 'shiny and new'; it is however very large and comfortable and very friendly.  Cheaper rates for weekly and monthly rental are available, and should apply automatically through the booking form. Rig
description: Truly unique inner-city oasis only one block from Swanston Street, with a comfortable, friendly, older-style  household environment. This is a queen-bed room with a private bathroom in a large 1980s warehouse conversion, with a private garden courtyard and direct street access.   Specialising in medium and longer stays for academics,  students and relocations: we can help you find your find your feet in Melbourne, including assistance and references for finding longer term rental accommodation. This is a queen bedroom in a 240 sq.m two-storey warehouse conversion that even has it's own backyard. There are  hundreds of books to read and DVDs to watch - but
neighborhood_overview: The East or "Paris" End of the City is the sophisticated side of the inner city, home to some of Melbourne's best shopping, great bars and restaurants, as well as jazz clubs, theatres, parks and gardens - and some hidden city-living gems - like my house.  We are walking distance to RMIT and Melbourne Universities and one block from Melbourne Central underground station.  The neighbourhood itself is a bit of a hidden gem, with large townhouses converted from historic warehouses and factories, tucked down every laneway.
notes: I work in the CBD and can arrange checkin during much of the day, however checkin must be arranged in advance, as I am not automatically available. Like many Australian houses, we have off-peak storage hot water - this means hot water is generous - but not unlimited.   Please remember: whilst this is a comparatively quiet and peaceful neighbourhood,  Melbourne is a 24hr city, which means people, vehicles and bustle, particularly on the weekends.
transit: Trams, trains and buses are all within a block, including the free tourist City Circle Tram.  The house is within the CBD "Free Tram Zone" and Mykis are also available for guests use.  On street and garage parking is available at a number of nearby locations.  Airport bus shuttle drops offs and pickups can be made to a number of nearby hotels. Walking distance or short tram ride to all major inner-city attractions, including: RMIT, Melbourne Uni, MCG, Rod Laver (Tennis Centre),  Etihad Stadium, Southbank and Casino, Aquarium, Flinders St Station, Southern Cross Station, Botanic Gardens, Fitzroy and Carlton Gardens (Museum and Exhibition Building), NGV, Brunswick & Gertrude Streets Fitzroy, Lygon Street, China Town.
access: Guests have access to the whole house and all facilities.
interaction: I am usually home at night and am always contactable if you need me.
house_rules: Room is a maximum of two people by booking - no unbooked guests or overnight visitors are allowed.  ALWAYS lock the front door, including when you are in the house. Please turn off the lights and heating when you leave the house. Please respect the neighbours when you are coming and going. There is no smoking in the house, but you are welcome to smoke out on the back terrace. I have a dog - he likes everybody and will happily take you for a walk around the park if that takes your fancy - otherwise you may comfortably ignore him, other than not leaving the front door open. No meals are provided however you have full use of the kitchen and all appliances etc. There is a supermarket across the street if you wish to buy groceries.  All linen and towels are provided, there is a hairdryer in the bathroom. I won't cry if plates and glasses get broken - however replacement costs apply for broken appliances and furniture and any replacement keys required.
host_about:
Busy, laid back, shopaholic and very social.  I holiday whenever I can afford to and travel internationally at least once a year.   I spend a fair bit of time walking my dog and pretending to get fit.  I am an IT consultant, so I work from home much of the time.

Must have:  Good wine, coffee, music, books (and ear plugs for sleeping)

Can totally do without: reality tv, talkback radio, backpacking and bad food.

Next holiday: Bali (again)
My motto: Does it come in red?
My other motto: Life is short, buy the shoes!

summary: Truly unique inner-city oasis only one block from Swanston Street, with a comfortable, friendly household environment. This is a queen-bed room in a 3 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom warehouse conversion, with a private garden courtyard and direct street access.  This corner of the CBD is mainly residential and has a unique neighbourhood atmosphere, while being right in the middle of everything the city has to offer.
space: It doesn't get much more inner city than this! This is one of two queen bedrooms available in this 240 sq.m two-storey warehouse conversion that even has it's own backyard.  These rooms, which share one large bathroom, are well sized and fully furnished, including BIRs.    (Bedroom #1 can be booked via  http://www.airbnb.com/rooms/307615?preview=true) Guests have access to the whole house and all facilities - including a full kitchen, separate laundry, large rear courtyard, large living and dining areas. There are  hundreds of books to read and DVDs to watch - but you'll be far too busy - as the house is only minutes walk from Melbourne's best restaurants, bars, galleries, gardens and shopping; including the Victoria Market. The house is occupied by myself and one very laid back dog called Roger, as well as any other guests.   Please note that this is a 30 year old conversion in a 150+ year old building so not everything
description: Truly unique inner-city oasis only one block from Swanston Street, with a comfortable, friendly household environment. This is a queen-bed room in a 3 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom warehouse conversion, with a private garden courtyard and direct street access.  This corner of the CBD is mainly residential and has a unique neighbourhood atmosphere, while being right in the middle of everything the city has to offer. It doesn't get much more inner city than this! This is one of two queen bedrooms available in this 240 sq.m two-storey warehouse conversion that even has it's own backyard.  These rooms, which share one large bathroom, are well sized and fully furnished, including BIRs.    (Bedroom #1 can be booked via  http://www.airbnb.com/rooms/307615?preview=true) Guests have access to the whole house and all facilities - including a full kitchen, separate laundry, large rear courtyard, large living and dining areas.  WiFi is available and a laptop PC is also available if needed.  There are  hun
neighborhood_overview: The East or "Paris" End of the City is the sophisticated side of the inner city, home to some of Melbourne's best shopping, great bars and restaurants, as well as jazz clubs, theatres, parks and gardens - and some hidden city-living gems - like my house.  The neighbourhood itself is a bit of a hidden gem, with large townhouses converted from historic warehouses and factories, tucked down every laneway.
transit: Trams, trains and buses are all within a block, including the free tourist City Circle Tram.  Mykis are available for guests use.  On street and garage parking is available at a number of nearby locations.  Airport bus shuttle drops offs and pickups can be made to a number of nearby hotels. Walking distance or short tram ride to all major inner-city attractions, including: RMIT, Melbourne Uni, MCG, Rod Laver (Tennis Centre),  Etihad Stadium, Southbank and Casino, Aquarium, Flinders St Station, Southern Cross Station, Botanic Gardens, Fitzroy and Carlton Gardens (Museum and Exhibition Building), NGV, Brunswick & Gertrude Streets Fitzroy, Lygon Street, China Town.
access: Guests have access to the whole house and all facilities.
interaction: I work from home and am in the house during the day, as well as after hours.
house_rules: Rooms are a maximum of two people - no additional guests or overnight visitors are allowed.  Please exercise a reasonable level of discretion when coming and going - always ALWAYS lock the front door (even if you are just popping in and out). There is no smoking in the house, but you are welcome to smoke out on the back terrace. I have a dog - he likes everybody and will happily take you for a walk around the park if that takes your fancy - otherwise you may comfortably ignore him other than not leaving the front door open. No meals are provided however you have full use of the kitchen and all appliances etc.  There is a supermarket across the street if you wish to buy groceries and there is space for you to store your own food.  You are welcome to use the tea, coffee etc and condiments which are in the kitchen and also the laundry facilities and supplies.   All linen and towels are provided, there is a hairdryer in the bathroom.  Please note that the bathroom is shared between two bed
host_about:
Busy, laid back, shopaholic and very social.  I holiday whenever I can afford to and travel internationally at least once a year.   I spend a fair bit of time walking my dog and pretending to get fit.  I am an IT consultant, so I work from home much of the time.

Must have:  Good wine, coffee, music, books (and ear plugs for sleeping)

Can totally do without: reality tv, talkback radio, backpacking and bad food.

Next holiday: Bali (again)
My motto: Does it come in red?
My other motto: Life is short, buy the shoes!

name: 3 Level Loft with Views close to City
summary: With 6 metre floor to ceiling windows you always feel part of nature. It feels like you are half inside and half outside. The views of the Dandenong Ranges from the top floor provide such peace and tranquility the apartment feels like it is part of an oasis however the location is a 2 minute walk to all the cafes, restaurants and shops you could need and it is a 10min tram ride into the city!
space: Architecturally designed 3 level, 3 bedroom (one currently 2nd lounging and office area loft with 180 degree views of the Dandenong Ranges and Melbourne City. The property grounds have a separate barbeque area for entertaining and one secure undercover carpark with remote access. The apartment is set on Richmond Hill very close to Bridge Road and Swan Street shopping and cafes. Walking distance to the Tennis Centre, the MCG and a quick tram ride into the heart of the City. Two entertainment areas with flat screen TVs and great sound.  Private balcony with breakfast bar and barbeque. Plenty of storage, European style laundry with washer dryer.  The six metre high windows in the main living area include an automatic blind for shade in the mornings and an amazing view in the afternoon and evenings. We love this apartment and are sure it would help make your stay in Melbourne perfect!

neighborhood_overview: Richmond is an inner Melbourne suburb.  It is 3km south-east of Melbourne's Central Business District.  The diverse suburb has been the subject of gentrification since the early 1990s and now contains an eclectic mix of expensively converted warehouse residences, public housing high-rise flats and terrace houses from the Victorian-era.  The suburb is well known for its popular factory outlets along Bridge Road and nearby sporting arenas.
transit: Tram access on both Church Street and Bridge Road - 10 minutes to get into the city. Major sports grounds a 10 minute walk away.
house_rules: Smoking allowed only on balcony and outside communal area.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about: I am from Melbourne. Love Australia and it will always be home but I have been an expat for the last 10 years working and living in Dubai, Prague and New York. Currently based in NY but get back home for a few months every year.

name: Cosy nest in vibrant eclectic area
summary: This is a space to enjoy, a place to come and read a little, dream a little, reflect a little. It is light, quirky, and quiet, only a stones through of the Yarra  river/bush, the Abbotsford Convent Arts Precinct, markets, galleries, music,  bars, restaurants and shops. It has all the convenience of being in the middle of things, but at the same time you can go home and shut the door on it all. This is my home with the trappings of home;  books, space to draw, paint, play and cook.
space: Designed by its architect owner, a property as restorative as this is rare, in Melbourne’s densifying inner city. This one-of-a-kind residence regenerates and nourishes with its design, while enjoying the neighbouring vitality of Little Vietnam and the bourgeoning Johnston and Hoddle strip.    With Gertrude and Smith streets a wander away, guests can experience some of Melbourne’s most celebrated bar’s and eateries. The Everleigh, Culter & Co, Saint Crispin, Huxtaburger, Po Boy Quarter, Forester’s Pub & Dining, Anada and the Builders Arms, to name but a few.   The proximity to the Yarra River, with its many biking & walking trials, the Abbotsford Convent precinct and Studley Park Boat House - Abbotsford has become one of Melbourne’s most highly sort after suburbs to reside in.  Over three levels, this unique property boasts a ground floor studio, opening onto a lushgarden; first floor deck, living and dining and a mezzanine second floor, hanger bedroom. With underfloor heating and all

The Everleigh, Culter & Co, Saint Crispin, Huxtaburger, Po Boy Quarter, Forester’s Pub & Dinin
neighborhood_overview: I love Abbotsford for its mix of local characters. There is no describable demographic but a wide range of ages, ethnicities and socio economic backgrounds. You can walk to all kinds of different places be it Asian supermarkets or craftsmen making furniture. There is also a great range of eateries from Asian to boutique beer and designer icecream all within walking distance. Then you can  go home and relax in your own little nest, in this quiet backstreet/lane.
transit: Train, tram, and bus are all within walking distance. This is a very bike friendly area with both off road and on road bike tracks at the front door. There is a bike shop around the corner who has been known to hire out a bike or two. Parking is not available in Little Charles street but off street parking can be arranged if needed.
access: Guests have the run of this 2.5 story house and garden. There is a gas kiln outside which can be used by arrangement.
interaction: Guests have full privacy. I like to meet guests on arrival where possible so they can ask any questions and then you are on your own.
house_rules: Please look after the house and it will look after you. Water the garden occassionally, put the rubbish out once a week on Monday night and you need to bring the bin (garbage cans) in off the street or the council will fine me. The house only caters for two people who share a bed!
host_about: An observer I love both wild natural places and fast cities. I love to travel and am currently working quite often in country areas, which allows me to make my house available to others. I read alot and there are lots of books, novels, art books, magazines etc... I also like to cook so the kitchen is reasonably well equipped. I live close to the city near the river and there are lots of places to walk both along the river (bush) or different urbanscapes ( Collingwood, Fitzroy and the city).

summary: This freshly renovated, stylish one bedroom apartment is in the heart of East Melbourne on Hotham Street.  It's a short walk to Melbourne's CBD and major attractions, and surrounded by cafes, restaurants, parks and public transport.

neighborhood_overview: So what's within walking distance:  * Parks and Fitzroy Gardens - 1 to 5 minutes  * Nearest restaurants and shops - 2 minutes   * Nearest childcare centre - 2 minutes  * Melbourne Cricket Ground - 5 minutes  * Richmond and Bridge Road shopping - 5 minutes   * Freemason's & Epworth Hospitals - 5 minutes   * Peter Mac Centre & St Vincent's Hospital - 10 minutes   * Collins & Bourke Streets in the city - 15 to 20 minutes   * Yarra River and Royal Botanic Gardens - 15 to 20 minutes  * Exhibition gardens and Melb Museum - 20 to 30 mins  What's East Melbourne like?  It's a stunning suburb.  Separated from the city by two beautiful public gardens, you can relax as you walk the wide tree-lined streets, admiring the Victorian and Federation buildings.  Relax in the Powlett Reserve or on Darling Square.    Smile a friendly greeting at the people you pass, grab a morning coffee from the George Street cafe, enjoy an afternoon vino in the Fitzroy Gardens.  Shopping at the discount designer outlets
notes: (1) We try to avoid gaps in our calendar.  This means we can't always accept short bookings more than a few weeks in advance unless they follow-on from an existing booking or fill an otherwise vacant block.  Check the calendar, and feel free to reach out with your requirements.  We'll advise the best rate possible.  (2) Electricity, gas, water and internet broadband are included in the rate BUT SUBJECT TO FAIR USE by the guest. Electricity usage in excess of 14.5 kWh per day will incur an extra charge at the rate of AUD0.26 per kWh. Sufficient broadband is provided for normal usage (email, surfing, youtube, (Hidden by Airbnb) etc) but data-intensive use may result in the internet speed being shaped. Use of illegal peer-to-peer or torrent download services is specifically prohibited.
transit: Public transport is very close and very convenient.  Wellington Parade and Victoria Street both offer very regular tram services to the city and suburbs.  Tram stops and the Jolimont train station are less than 2 minutes walk!
access: The entire apartment is all yours.  Make yourself at home!
interaction: We'll check you in (although self check-in is also available).  We live nearby, so if issues arise we can usually drop around (unless we're off travelling).  You can reach us easily and quickly by email (best) or telephone.
house_rules: (1) Let us know if you have any questions.  We'll provide whatever extra information you need and will be happy to assist with your arrival arrangements if needed. ------------------------------------ (2) In the apartment you'll find a detailed property guide including helpful hints, location guide for shops/transport, and apartment inclusions.  We'll email this to you on confirmation of your booking. ------------------------------------ (3) The apartment is newly refurbished and looking great, so please take care of the property, fittings and furnishings.  The guest is responsible for any loss or damage to the apartment and inclusions (other than reasonable wear and tear). ------------------------------------ (4) The apartment and everything in it will be spotlessly clean when you move in.  As a courtesy to the next guest, we appreciate your assistance in keeping and leaving the apartment clean and tidy. ------------------------------------ (5) Please ensure all kitchen and laundry ap
host_about:
Born in Melbourne, grew up in Melbourne, and this great city is home.  My work in management consulting and executive education takes me around Australia, to Asia, the Middle East and Europe.  

I've been an airbnb host since beginning of 2012 (yup... since before airbnb was a global phenomenon) and have a range of properties on offer.  You'll find they're all fabulously located, spotlessly clean and super-comfortable and convenient.  I travel enough to know what makes for a great home-away-from-home... and that's what I promise to deliver for you.

Happy to answer your questions about Melbourne or my properties 

;-)

neighborhood_overview: Boredom should not be an issue as there is a 18 hole golf course, several gyms and an aquatic center within 2 km from the house, not to mention a scenic bike track.
notes: The house is in a safe and secure neighborhood, but for added ease of mind we have security cameras covering the front of the house and the side. All rooms have lockable doors and guests get a set of keys peer room.
transit: The bus leaves out the front of our house and the local train station in down the road, we also provide bikes free of charge so guests can take them to the station or even into the city. If arriving or leaving by plane, train or any other method of transport, we also offer a pick up/drop off service for $40 AUD whenever possible, a taxi from the airport could be close to double.
access: Guests have access to everything in the house and as seen in our pictures except our bedroom and our cars :-) So Kitchen, BBQ, Spa, Gym etc. is at at your disposal.
interaction: We live at the property and love to socialize, but as the house is huge all guests will have an option of privacy if they wish. There is a living room for each bedroom so space is never a problem. We have lots of suggestions for things to do and places to see, we have even made several tours for you to follow, all collected in our house information book, this also includes the most price competitive options for travel and car rentals etc. With experience of working in hotels Ryan and Rhiannon also have prepared a welcome pack you will find in your room with lots of information and maps that will be useful during your stay. We even have self serve room menu with drinks and snacks if you run out of you own!
house_rules: We would appreciate it if people booking, please make sure your profile has a picture of you  :-)  As the house is full of artwork and custom made furniture we only accept young children if full accountability is taken for any damages, we hope you can understand. We do not allow pets unless specifically requested and agreed to beforehand.  We do not allow smoking inside the house, but do have an area for you outside. If you loose the house keys we may charge for replacement of locks. We offer pick up and drop offs to airport or city if available for only $40 AUD, but please plan ahead. If you damage or break something you have to compensate or replace it if possible. We do not want you to feel as a guest staying with us, but as a friend that lives with us, make yourself at home. Only thing you can do wrong is not ask a question if you have one. We look forward to meeting you and sharing our home and city with you. Kind regards Ryan & Rhiannon
host_about:
Ryan and Rhiannon are your hosts
Ryan is a fashion designer and trained tailor, working from home.
Rhiannon also works in fashion as an account manager.
We both love movies, socializing with friends and enjoying everything Melbourne and life has to offer.
We recently completed out dream home and a large part of out dream was to be able to share it with others, keeping a fresh perspective on you surroundings is important, so you never forget to keep discovering. There is no better way of doing that than with friends from all over the world.
Ryan has lived 17 years in Norway and only came back to Australia when he was going to University.
Since then he has gained experience as a concierge, bartender etc. so between Ryan and Rhiannon you could not wish for better hosts.

name: Inner City Home-12 mins by train to Melbourne CBD
summary: A four bedroom luxury home. Large bedroom, queen size bed, built in robes. Bathroom with shower, bath and toilet. A light filled, clean, open plan, modern home.  Large lounge/living area - light filled and opens to a beautiful garden and deck setting. A modern kitchen, polished floor boards throughout. The nearest bus stop is 60 second walk - takes you to the Yarraville train station in 5 mins then 10 mins to city. Close to Melbourne CBD, Newport Lakes and the Williamstown beach.
space: A light filled, clean, open plan, modern home close to Melbourne CBD, Newport Lakes and the Williamstown beach. A peaceful and relaxing home where you will have a private, clean, carpeted and spacious bedroom that captures the morning sun and your own bathroom with toilet, shower and a bath. The entire back half of the house opens up onto the back deck and garden where you can sit and have a BBQ and capture the afternoon rays. Alternatively you can have breakfast on the front porch and relax and read the papers whilst soaking up the morning sun.  A modern kitchen, polished floor boards throughout, hydronic heating and indoor plants give my home a modern yet earthy feel. Truly a home away from home with easy to access by public transport (1 minute walk from my front door) or by car and only minutes from Melbourne CBD. It is an excellent location to base yourself to access all of the city's tourist and cultural attractions but also to be close to nature (the lakes and the beach). Travell

house_rules: Alcohol, drug and smoking free home (smoking outside is okay)
host_about:
I naturally gravitate towards people who are open-hearted, generous of spirit and self aware. Most of the people I am surrounded by are making a positive difference in the world or are on a spiritual or personal growth journey of some kind. 

I love my work and work for myself. I am a Film Producer, working on a global film collaboration project. We are producing a psycho-spiritual film to inspire the audience to discover what it takes to live your life everyday  in love and joy.

I value heart felt, emotionally intimate connections with friends and associates. I enjoy people. I love going out listening to music, theatre and dancing. I am fit, eat heathily, don't work too hard these days and appreciate being outdoors in nature.

On my bookshelves you will find mostly find books on psychology, spirituality, health, business & money.

The best holiday I had was being in Cuba for one month with a women from Calgary who I had met the year before in Thailand. Our trip to Cuba cemented a lifelong friendship. I love the music and dance in Cuba and the simplicity of life. I also love being in Paris. I will always remember my first day in Paris because I was awestruck by the beauty all around me plus I always feel romantic when I am in Paris. Needless to say, romantic comedy is one of my favourite film genres.

I used to be an adrenaline junkie but I am so pleased to say that gone are the days of busyness, gone are the days of being addicted to activity and stress and gone are the days of covering up feelings of not being good enough with over achievement. Phew!! That's a relief. 

Today, my life is peaceful, joyful and mostly serene and whilst there are some limits, I have managed to achieve a certain amount of freedom about how I spend each day. 

One of my philisophies on life is, "People do the best they can in any given moment. And whilst at times that best may not feel so great, it is that person's best in that moment."

I am also mindful that we only have 168 hours in each week and that doesn't seem like many hours to me so I make sure that I live my life in joy as much as I possibly can.

house_rules: To maintain a good standard for our guests we require certain conditions to be complied with. We appreciate most will respect our property but the occasional abuse requires that we state the following conditions.  A photo ID will need to be presented, which will be photographed. All our apartments are non-smoking apartments. For smoking please step outside and make sure you don't leave cigarette butts behind. No pets or animals are accepted. Number of Guests should not exceed the number stated on the Confirmation Notice or subsequently agreed in writing or email.  Fees will apply for excess guests not agreed with the owners in advance. Parties and Functions are strictly prohibited. The price charged is for domestic use only and not commercial. host_about:
I'm a primary school teacher with grown up children who are living away from home. 

I love the outdoors, movies and cooking and meeting new people. I am relaxed and easy going. I like to go for walks at one of the nearby leafy parks and go for coffee.

Armadale is a great neighborhood, close to to transport and amenities. Also full of trendy shops and gyms/tennis courts and a library.

I look forward to meeting you. Welcome to Melbourne, I hope you have a great stay.

Cheers
Fay

name: 3 Bedroom Apartment MT111
summary: Spacious 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment in Southbank high rise complex.  Fully equipped with kitchen, laundry and entertainment systems. The building has gym, pool and tennis court. Concierge service from 6am to 10pm and 24 hour security guard. Please note the apartment has flexible bedding, please request if you would like 2 king and 2 single beds or 1 king and 4 single beds upon booking confirmation.
space: Welcome to this Gorgeous Apartment in the Centre   The Apartment Beautifully lit apartment within Melbourne Tower Complex in the heart of Melbourne.  Right across from the Crown Casino, 5 minutes walk to Flinder St station, Business District, Victoria Arts Centre.    The apartment is located on the 11th floor with a nice city view to the north side and view of the West Gate bridge on the west side.  The master bedroom is furnished with a king size bed, comes wtih ensuite and walk in wardrobe.  The 2nd bedroom is furnished with 2 single beds and the 3rd room with another split king.  The main bathroom/laundry is located next the the 3rd bedroom. The living room is very spacious complete with 40inch digital tv. Complex Facilites The complex has a heated pool and gym located on the 6th floor (opening hours are 6am to 10pm) and tennis court (day light only). house_rules: No parties inside the apartment!! Linen, towels, shampoo, hair conditioner ans soap are all supplied. The building policy prohibits clothes horses on the balcony, so please keep the clothes rack inside the apartment. Absolutely no smoking in the apartment, smoking is permitted on the balconies only. Prior to check out, please kindly dispose normal rubbish down the rubbish chute located to the right of the elevators on each floor. Recycled rubbish bins are located next to the car park entrance on the ground floor. Please also clean the dishes, pots and cooking utensils either using the dishwasher or the detergent provided. If you have unpacked any extra bedding, please place them back. Upon check out, please return both sets of keys to the concierge in the envelope provided.   Loss of the set of keys with the car park remote will incur a replacement charge of $300 and the other set will incur a charge of $100
host_about: I am a melbourne girl with a finance professional background.  Due to passion for travelling, meeting  new people and property, i have, over the last few years, managed to combine my hobbies into owning a guesthouse and a number of apartments in and near the Melbourne city. I hope I can cater all types of groups with the range of accommodation options I offer. I also love the opportunity to show all my guests what a wonderful city Melbourne is. As an airbnb guest, I will look after your place like its my own.

host_about:
Hi ... I'm Veruschka, and I would love to meet fellow travellers, and have the world come to me!  I love travelling myself, and do so a few times a year.  I'm interested in the arts, reading, film, theatre, cooking, and generally enjoying life.  I love talking politics and current affairs, and have a good memory for anything geographical (I collect maps!)    Would love to see you in my home to swap travel tales!

Have travelled extensively to Europe, Middle East, South America, India & Sri Lanka, Asia and the Pacific, and still counting ....

name: St Kilda Gardens Executive Living
summary: This smart, modern apartment is stylish as well as functional and caters for both the business executive and today's modern family.
space: The furniture, beds, bedding and linen are of the highest quality. We provide free access to Netflix and high speed unlimited internet. The apartment comes with security parking with lift access and the building has a security entrance.  You will find yourself superbly located on leafy, picturesque and quiet Herbert St directly across the road from the St Kilda Botanical Gardens. However, you will also be a very short walk to the Barkly and Acland St cafe and shopping strips and some of Melbourne’s most loved restaurants and bars as well as to St Kilda beach and the No. 96 tram which will take you directly into to the city via the light rail which runs along Albert Park and Albert Park Lake.
description: This smart, modern apartment is stylish as well as functional and caters for both the business executive and today's modern family. You will find yourself superbly located on leafy, picturesque and quiet Herbert St directly across the road from the St Kilda Botanical Gardens. However, you will also be a very short walk to the Barkly and Acland St cafe and shopping strips and some of Melbourne’s most loved restaurants and bars as well as to St Kilda beach and the No. 96 tram which will take you directly into to the city via the light rail which runs along Albert Park and Albert Park Lake. You will have exclusive access to the apartment. Our reservations and ground teams will be available from 9am until 10pm every day . St Kilda was named after the Lady
neighborhood_overview: St Kilda was named after the Lady of St Kilda, a ship which was moored at the main beach in the early 1840’s. The suburb has a rich history and was always seen as a very popular place to be during victorian and Edwardian times due to its proximity to the bay. St Kilda has continued to be a very popular place to live and holiday destination. It is a hub for the Melbourne music scene and has three very identifiable landmarks close together on the Esplanade. The “Espy” – the Esplanade hotel, the Palais Theatre and of course Luna Park, with its array of rides and sideshows sitting on the edge of the water. Acland Street is renowned as being one of Melbourne’s most popular food destinations and it is famous for its array of superb cake shops. if you love gardens and flowers, be sure to visit St Kilda’s Botanic Gardens, also known as Blessington Gardens in Blessington Street. It has one of the most popular rose collections in Victoria. If you would like to see some excellent examples of Edwa
notes: Please feel free to let us know if there is anything we can do to help during your stay.
transit: Getting around is easy from St Kilda, which is located only approx. 5km South of Melbourne’s CBD. Trams commence in Acland St near Barkly St (St Kilda) and run via Acland St, The Esplanade, FitzroySt, South Melbourne Light Rail (Canterbury Rd, Ferrars St and Whiteman St), Clarendon St, SpencerSt, Bourke St (City), Spring St and Nicholson St to terminate near Blyth St (East Brunswick). Access to Melbourne’s rail network is via the Balaclava train station in St Kilda East.
access: You will have exclusive access to the apartment.
interaction: Our reservations and ground teams will be available from 9am until 10pm every day .
house_rules: If you think you will be arriving after 9pm, please let us know in advance.

host_about: Hello, my name is Betty,  My daughter Amy & Myself (as pictured), live in this beautiful home.  Having both travelled extensively, we love to interact with people from all over the world.  Gregarious and outgoing we are lucky to live in a beautiful part of Victoria.  Enjoy to socialize and share other peoples experiences.  We certainly have more than a few stories to share in return.  Enjoy a glass of wine around the open fire inside or cool off with a dip in the pool outside.  Be part of the house hold or keep to yourself as you pass through onto various destination.  We are non intrusive, yet fun to be with.  Hope to see you soon.  Just remember life is what it is, and we make it.....B1x

name: House in Pristine Coastal Village
summary: large modern house plenty room close to water the area as plenty of water activities fishing boating, bird watching on the way to Phillip Island .
space: Two bedrooms with own bathroom and lounge area. Car & boat parking available. Buses to Cranbourne stations daily. Close to boat ramp and local fishing in inlet and Western Port Bay room park car & boat  40kms from Melborne CBD and 30 kms from Philip Island. Close to Warneet Marina, with the following services - Boat & Canoe hire - Fishing charters - Sightseeing tours of Western port bay - Swimming available at local beach 5 mins walk away - Wharf with plenty of fishing spots - Yacht club is open Friday nights The area is very quiet, beautiful surrounds with plenty of bird life & walking tracks. The lady of the house is a registered child carer and is happy to offer services for an additional fee.

name: SUNLIT Kitchen/Vegie Garden/CLEAN
space: I'm Rovielle, eco-friendly, into sustainability and into the 4R's (reduce, reuse, recycle, rethink)... I am into an organic lifestyle and if you like John Seed or Michael Reynolds, even better! I have a room that will be available here in Truganina for a single traveler, professional or a couple who are, clean, reliable, trustworthy and easy going. It has large windows that overlooks some greenery. I have three vegie beds with a little Japanese touch in the decor (even in the garden).  There is a cosy loungeroom with books and magazines, a tv for movie nights/news and carspace at the front of the house.  Transportation to and from Laverton station takes 15 mins. The shops are five minutes drive. Very accessible to shops, schools and Freeway towards Geelong or CBD. By the way, there's a couple of great organic shops just 15 mins away from here. house_rules: Please take your shoes off at all times. House slippers will be provided for your use. There is alot of space to put luggage or large bags in the room. Two IDs (Valid Driver's and Passport) will be photocopied upon arrival, after a service of tea and biscuits. Keys will be exchanged once payment is secure and phone numbers are given. House Rules agreement with fees will be signed by both parties including the date of stay given. Camping gears and utensils can be rented out if interested. ($250-refundable $100) Great if you can share your skills in the garden or in the garage.  Cleaning is minimal as long as all the communal areas like lounge, kitchen, dining, toilet, bathroom, laundry and hallways are respectably tidy. Towels can be provided but each person must take responsibility to wash cloths they have used. Water-restrictions and water-saving practices are highly encouraged at this home at all times.  Parties must be discussed with all housemates. Noise level must be considered at
host_about: Nature is my muse. God is my love. My husband Kentaro is the partner and witness to my lifetime and vice versa. My family and siblings are what made me love life and witness nature with love.. and Friends make up all the colours of the rainbows to music and dancing to moments! Traveling lets me swim in the delicious flavours and colours of life.
