neighborhood_overview: Fitzroy is a vibrant area. The is an eclectic mix of old time residents, artists, migrants and refugees; there is a gay 'community', students, singles, professionals, families and all age groups.  The area abounds in cafés and restaurants and many small art galleries.
transit: There are two trams. One is 60 seconds walk from my place. The other is 3 minutes walk. Both take you to the city, Docklands or St. Kilda.  It's about a 15-20 minute walk to the CBD.  Rod Laver arena (Australian Open) is about a 30 minute pleasant walk, 50% through the beautiful Fitzroy Gardens.
access: Guests are welcome to use the kitchen, the sitting room, the garden and laundry facilities.   There is a TV and DVD player in the guest room and guests are welcome to borrow any of my movies, documentaries, etc.
interaction: As I live here too, host and guest interact every day. I am happy to help with tourist advice directions whenever needed. At times I may even be able to drive you to your destination.
house_rules: 24th September 2013 I've had to discard two sets of sheets and pillow cases because of indelible make-up stains.  PLEASE wash off make-up before going to bed. Conserve water!  We are the driest continent on earth. Though we have water right now, the next drought is just round the corner. No overnight guests. Other than that, just basic courtesy between us and we'll get along fine.
host_about:
I'm a retired librarian and Welfare Centre Manager.
I've loved travelling in the past. These days I enjoy vicarious travel throught hosting others.

summary: ENTIRE HOME  $350 per night 28 Dec - 18 Jan Stylish, larger than most & secure.  2 story townhouse, 2 lge, light queen bedrms, private & spacious.  Lge sunny deck upstairs with bbq, daybed and 6 seater dining setting & umbrella.  2 mins walk from creative vibe of Carlisle St, all transport, cafes, music, international cuisines, close to beaches, markets, Melbourne CBD. neighborhood_overview: BALACLAVA/ST. KILDA EAST (same area) Originally known for large population of Jewish families and more recently become the best known secret South of the Yarra.  Creative, communal, friendly and eclectic neighbourhood You will see a diverse mix of people from varying professions, religions, ages and cultures, primarily youngish and creative vibe. The neighbourhood is safe, however, like any such international inner city suburbs, safety precautions are advised. Every store you will need is just  2 mins walk to end of street to Carlisle Street including:  Organic supermarket - Little Hen, major supermarkets, yoga, pilates, 24/7 gym, cafes, restaurants - local and new Grill'd, Japanese, Mexican, Chinese, Moroccan, Fish & Chips (best in Melbourne!), Soup, Salads, Noodles, Korean ++ best coffee and breakfasts in Melbourne including famous Las Chicas (great food and coffee), Dana's (quiet with best pastries), Boddhi Monk Dhama (next to Safeway in hideaway street, ask a local for directions)
notes: Being close to transport we do hear trains intermittently. But for me, its always held a certain romantic attraction....I know, go figure.
transit: 2 mins walk from my home to Carlisle Street is immediate access to frequent (approx 12 mins) trams, trains, buses to anywhere in Melbourne or walk to many major destinations including St. Kilda Beach, Chapel Street to a plethora of  exciting bars, cafes, restaurants, clothing stores and shopping and art galleries.  PUBLIC TRANSPORT:  you need to buy a Myki card to travel on public transport before you get on as inspector will fine you.  see link for details:  (URL HIDDEN) MELBOURNE CITY  4 Train stops = 12 mins, Tram 25 mins, Walk = 40 - 50 min -Federation Square   -National Gallery of Victoria -Arts Centre - Gallery, Shows, Theatre, Sunday Markets, Restaurants, Cafes -Chinatown -Laneway cafes -Designer & bargain shopping -Southbank - casino, restaurants, boat tours -Victoria Markets ST KILDA - 20 min walk, 10 min by tram (not train station) -Beach  -Luna Park -Fabulous restaurants,  - Fitzroy Street   & Acland Street - cafes, bars, restaurants -Open air Cinema -Art Galleries -St Kilda
access: Security Gates  Easy access to secure property.
interaction: If I am here I am happy to greet you, show you around, explain things and  expect as a visitor you will want to organise your own schedule. Am happy to assist where I can and share my local knowledge and make your stay as effortless and enjoyable as possible.
house_rules: It would give me great pleasure if you appreciated and enjoyed your stay as much as I enjoy the privilege of living here.  I  would also appreciate your respect of my home by taking care and being clean. Leave walking shoes at door, no shoes to be worn in the bedroom. No smoking in the home excessive partying which could lead to damage. Please respect my property as some things are not able to be replaced. Respect certain areas and objects of privacy. Be mindful and respectful of neighbours if coming in late or leaving very early and noise levels. Clean up all your mess, take rubbish to bins and ensure bathroom floor is dried after showers. So... Relax, have fun and let the home love you!
host_about: Hi, I work in creative human development field with corporates,  exec coach and specialist in Creative Intelligence..  Have two grown up well travelled children who no longer live at home.  Love of art, quality films, beauty and and travel and gardening.  My work and study has lead me to learn from many fascinating philosophies, artists and leaders in consciousness.   Studied Fine Art and apply to my work in leadership.  Do yoga, love walking the Botanical gardens, quite well travelled...last trip was Morocco...always more to do and see. City dweller with love for the ocean, originally from Sydney. Non-smoker, healthy eater, private yet very socialable.  Have an affinity with Lake Como in Italy and all things Italian.  New projects - promote artists, take art & development retreats to exotic destinations and producer/host of ArtelierTV.

name: Your Own Place in Central Melbourne
summary: I love this city so I've made sure I've placed myself where I have easiest access to all Melbourne has to offer! I'd love you to experience the city as I do.
space: I love this city so I've made sure I've placed myself where I have easiest access to all Melbourne has to offer! Located just two doors from the Princess Theatre and 4 doors from the European, this one bedroom apartment is the perfect place to base yourself at while you explore the streets of Melbourne. The apartments consists of a queen size bed and is ideally suited for one or two people. There is also a fold up bed in the sofa if required.  There is also everything that you will need in order to make yourself at home, including cooking facilities, washing machine, dryer, TV, stereo. It's my home, so it's set up for my lifestyle. I love it, and am keen to share it with you! Facing west, the apartment gets the afternoon sun, but is bright all day round. With heritage listed Gordon House as our closest neighbour, the low rise buildings give an open view of the city.  If you tell me where you want to go, I'll tell you how many footsteps it is to get there! You will also be able to see m

notes: Wifi in the apartment.
transit: There is a railway station and tram stop at the front door. If you need them. I walk almost everywhere.

interaction: I'll leave you alone, but always happy to answer questions and give you tips about the city I love.
house_rules: I'd only ask that you respect my home and that of the other people in the building.
host_about:
I love my home and love my home town of Melbourne. It gives me enormous pleasure to show of the wonderful city that Melbourne is. The other bonus for me if you come and stay in my home, is that enables me to take off and see more of the world. I've seen plenty of of it, but still want more.
while I'm here in Melbourne, I make the most of the vibrant theatre and comedy scene, and am devoted to my AFL team, Collingwood.

name: A fantastic B&B in Heidelberg Melbourne
summary: Our B&B has 3 rooms all with their own ensuite.  Our specialty is that we offer cooked or continental breakfasts.  We drive our guests to and from the Austin Hospital/ Mercy Hospital /Warringal Private Hospital complex.  We also drop off our guests at the Heidelberg or Rosanna railway stations and local function centres such as the Heide Gallery and the Old England Hotel.  Our beautiful rooms have TV, DVD, heating, cooling , WIFI and are spacious and clean.  Come and stay with us!
space: Austin Rise B&B is a wonderful place to spend time in Melbourne.  We have 3 large rooms which allows 5 guests to stay with us. We are great B&B for family celebrations, bridal parties, singles, professionals and country travellers.   We are 5 mins drive from the Austin/Mercy /Warringal Private/ Heidelberg Repatriation Hospitals and The Brain Institute.  Our speciality is that we offer a cooked breakfast for our guests.  A fresh fruit platter is offered at every breakfast, cooked eggs, bacon, sausages, avocado mash, baked beans, tomatoes and mushrooms.  Guests can choose their breakfast and it is cooked to order. As you walk in our lovely home, we have a guest lounge room and spacious dining room.  As you turn to the right, the Streeton Suite has king size bed which converts to 2 singles and has a large bathroom and sitting room included.  Upstairs is the Withers and Roberts Rooms for guests.  They both have queen size beds, new ensuites, TV/DVD and all day tea/coffee making facilities.

neighborhood_overview: We hold a street party every year and so we know our neighbours and it is a really safe environment to park your car and walk to and from Burgundy Street /Austin Hospital complex
notes: Our service is amazing and our reviews on Tripadvisor let other guests know about us.
transit: We offer rides to and from the Heidelberg train station.   We will collect you when you call us and we can drop you off at nearby Heide Gallery and other function centres.
access: Guests have large rooms that they can use plus the downstairs loungeroom and the outdoor deck.
interaction: We offer lots of help, advice.  Our speciality is driving our guests to and from the Austin /Mercy Hospital complex.  We also offer to drive them to their nearby functions that they are going to, for example the Old England Hotel and Ivanhoe Town Hall.
house_rules: No smoking inside.  Smoking is allowed outside.  No pets. Consideration of other guests when talking and drinking outside.
host_about:
Brett works full time at our B&B.  He likes music, painting and loves different foods especially while travelling.  His favourite travel destination is Malaysia.

Beverley is his wife and she works full time, loves gardening, Nutrimetics and travelling.
Beverley can't live without Brett, her hairdryer, good food, my cat and my girlfriends. 

To stay with us means that you'll be as spoilt as you want to be.  If you need space and time by yourself that is ok with us or if you are happy to join us for drinks most afternoon/evenings and the odd BBQ we love that too.

name: 4/2 Pottery Court Brunswick, Melbourne
summary: Our one bed apartment is ideal for singles or couples. It is perfect for those wanting an inner city experience but not in the CBD. We find lots of people choose the destination because of proximity to relatives or friends and also the variety of very good cafes & pubs.
space: Comfortable secure flat in interesting converted Historic Brickworks in Brunswick. Close to Sydney Road, lots of pubs, bars, cafes and restaurants, plenty of public transport in every direction and on the correct side of the city for the airport. Brunswick has more than it's fair share of Melbourne's best eateries and the location is extremely well served by public transport. Buses stop at the front door which you can jump on if you want to get to Sydney Road or connect you to wherever you are headed, Carlton, the CBD and St Kilda Beach included. Two train stations are a 10 minute walk with a 15 minute ride to the CBD. It is a 2 minute walk to trams taking you to Melbourne Zoo and Melbourne University and the CBD(URL HIDDEN) For our guests convenience we have provided MYKI cards for public transport use around Zone 1. If you use them just top them up at any Post Office or Seven 11 so that future guests can also benefit. They are in the information folder. The complex is large, interest

neighborhood_overview: Our neighbourhood is very eclectic and diverse  and even though it is gentrifying it still retains it's working class, migrant and student base. Lots of old factories have been converted to residences as is usual in large cities now.
notes: Internet is available and provides unlimited access though NBN. The password can be found on a Telstra fridge magnet. Myki cards; use as required and top up at any 7/11 or Post Office for the guests who follow. Guests travelling with a car may note that there is limited street parking on Pottery Court,although this is free unlimited as is the parking in the surrounding streets. However the carpark facing Pottery Court is for the residents of the Kiln Apartments and if parking there you should take care NOT to park in the designated marked areas.
transit: It is easy to get to any area of Melbourne by public transport or as is more usual, by car. Lots of bike tracks if you know where to look and public bike hire is available . Check your Melbourne website.
access: Guests have full access to everything in the flat. We do not live there and nothing is off limits.
interaction: We have email communication from first inquiry. Either myself or a member of our family have telephone contact upon quests arrival in Melbourne and we arrange to meet personally at the apartment with the keys. We are very happy to hear at any time from our guests.
house_rules: Please water plants if there has been no rain. You can pick the figs if it is summer and they are fruiting! At end of stay please leave clean and tidy.  Please check that both electric heaters are switched off before leaving. When placing rubbish in the communal bins please make sure you use the bins at the rear so as not to overload the front ones. Of course we trust that if you are smoker you will not smoke inside the apartment. N.B. Our Check In and Check Out times can be flexible depending on guest change over so please ask us. We do discourage Check In after 8.30pm except for inevitable emergencies. If you will be needing the extra bedding please let us know prior to your arrival so it can be made ready. MYKI cards are provided for use; please top up if necessary at Post Office or 7/11 store for benefit of following guests. KEYS....... We do not normally provide two sets of keys as we like to retain a security key in case of problems. However if it is vital that you require a seco
host_about: I have been hosting on Airbnb since 2011. Now that my husband Ian has retired he has joined with me in the fun of meeting guests from all throughout Australia and around the world. We live in Brunswick as we have family in the suburb and we love to tell everyone visiting Melbourne what a great place Brunswick is. It is blessed with plenty of public transport which makes it easy for travellers to enjoy the CBD, the beaches and all the premier sporting venues that Melbourne excel at. The MCG for cricket and AFL football , Melbourne Tennis Centre for the Australian Open, Flemington Racecourse, home of the Melbourne Cup. These world class venues are a short PTV ride away. Brunswick also offers  great local amenities such as parks, swimming pool, library, bicycle tracks. We enjoy all these with our family, not to mention the food.... Spoilt for choice. Plus bars, pubs and nightclubs............ Maybe not always for us!

The suburb of Caulfield is best known as the place where the Caulfield Cup horse race is run and is located just 12 kilometres South East of Melbourne’s bustling heart. There are many things to see and do while in Caulfield including the famous Caulfield Park and Racecourse. There are 20 race days each racing seas
neighborhood_overview: The suburb of Caulfield is best known as the place where the Caulfield Cup horse race is run and is located just 12 kilometres South East of Melbourne’s bustling heart. There are many things to see and do while in Caulfield including the famous Caulfield Park and Racecourse. There are 20 race days each racing season and some of Australia’s most famous and historic races are conducted on those days. The Caulfield train station is less than a hundred metres from the racecourse.  Tavlin Restaurant on Glenhuntly Road, a popular middle eastern restaurant and Siam Thai Restaurant get consistently good reviews. These are but two of Caulfield’s many well known and well located restaurants. The Labassa, a French Renaissance mansion with luxuriant and expertly made interior, is well worth a visit while staying with us in Caulfield. Also available is a guided tour of the amazing wine making facilities of the Yarra Valley. Experience the rich history and knowledge from a life time of wine culture
notes: Please feel free to let us know if there is anything we can do to help during your stay.
transit: Caulfield is well serviced by public transport into the city. Caulfield railway station is located on the Pakenham, Cranbourne and Frankston lines. Trams also connect Caulfield extensively via route 67.
access: You will have exclusive access to the apartment.
interaction: Our reservations and ground teams will be available from 9am until 10pm every day .
house_rules: If you think you may be arriving after 9pm, please let us know in advance.
host_about: Conscientious and hard working

neighborhood_overview: The leafy suburb of Elsternwick is approximately 9km South East of Melbourne’s city centre. Closely bordered by colourful St Kilda on one side and upmarket Brighton one the other, Elsternwick is peaceful, yet a mere 2 minutes from the busiest areas on the bay. With several noteworthy new eateries and wine bars opening along Elsternwick Glen Huntly Road, the modest inner suburb has become a welcome alternative for those looking to enjoy the cosmopolitan vibe Melbourne is known for within a haven of peaceful inner suburban living. Glen Huntly Road is spattered with a wide range of venues; including a strong stable of well-established family run restaurants, notably Budapest Restaurant and Palinka Bar for wonderful Hungarian cuisine; as well as a string of new quality eateries the like of Hanoi Hannah for easy effervescent Vietnamese street food situated opposite the infamous Classic Cinema and the exciting new Bang Bang at the Rifle Club launched on Tuesday 31 January 2017, and allows co
notes: Please feel free to let us know if there is anything we can do to help during your stay.
transit: It’s easy to forget when staying in one of our luxury Elsternwick apartments, that you are really only approximately a 15-minute drive from the centre of Melbourne. Slightly longer by tram; however, there is something quite wonderful about a tram ride to the city. It really is something everyone should do while visiting Melbourne.

name: Heritage Listed House Close To Park
summary: Comfort, privacy and convenience. With your own bedroom and bathroom in this welcoming house you will be right at the centre of major Melbourne attractions and universities. And yet it is in a quiet street that ends with a world heritage listed park.
space: Welcome To Carlton - I have a comfortable furnished double room available in a heritage listed house. The house is fully renovated and furnished with a private courtyard and garden. You will have exclusive use of a bedroom with a double bed, separate bathroom and shared use of a fully equipped kitchen and comfortable living area. Location The house is situated in an excellent location, within walking distance to the city centre. It is also close to Melbourne Museum, World Heritage Exhibition Building, Carlton Gardens and the University. In just a short 7 minute walk, you will arrive at busy Lygon Street or trendy Brunswick Street and their many quirky shops, cafes and restaurants. The number 96 tram is just a short 3 minute walk from the house and will take you via Parliament House to Bourke Street in the heart of the city where you can also connect to the full range of other trams and trains and buses of Melbourne. Enjoy your stay in Carlton/Melbourne!!

I live with my partner Francisco who is a full time Master of Public Health student at the university. We enjoy meeting people, music, sailing, cooking and travel. Languages we speak are both English and Spanish.

name: Luxurious Self Contained Pool House
summary: Our luxurious and private Pool House is tucked away in an English style garden with a swimming pool and spa. We are located in a secure and safe suburb,  close to the city centre which is easily accessible by car, train, tram or even by bicycle.
space: Enjoy a tranquil stay in a magnificent garden with pool and spa, in a quiet suburb conveniently located close to the city centre. We accept a maximum of two guests only. Location Kooyong is a tiny sought-after suburb wedged between Malvern, Hawthorn, and Toorak--one of Melbourne's most exclusive suburbs. We are only 7km from the city centre. Our home backs on to Kooyong Park and there is easy access to the city which is only 10 minutes by train, or 25 minutes by bicycle path all the way (complimentary bikes available).  Amenities The modern Pool House is fully air conditioned and heated, and has its own private, separate entry. It is fitted with a smoke alarm and gas detector, and even has its own security system. There is unlimited broadband wireless Internet in the Pool House. We also provide a wireless printer (Mac or PC) to print out plane tickets or correspondence. The bathroom features a frame-less shower and there is a fully kitted out kitchenette with a two hob Miele gas stove,

Amenities The modern Pool House is fully air conditioned and heated, and has its own private, separate entry. It is fitted with a smoke alarm and gas detector, and even has its own security system. There is unlimited broadband w
neighborhood_overview: Kooyong is a small exclusive and quiet suburb wedged between Malvern, Hawthorn, and Toorak, close to the city centre. Our home backs on to Kooyong Park and there is easy access to the city by train (10 mins) or along the bike path (25 mins). Kooyong Village is a 5 minute walk away at the end of our street and has a quaint parade of handy shops and delightful cafes.
notes: Please let me know what your special interests are as I keep up-to-date with the arts scene and what's happening in and around Melbourne.
transit: We have free parking available directly in front of our house, although we recommend using public transport for easy access to the city. The train and tram are both at the end of our street and the train takes you to the city in 5 stops, or 7 minutes. The number 16 tram goes to The city via St. Kilda Beach, and the number 58 tram goes to the city via the Chapel Street shopping precinct and the Royal Botanical Gardens. We are close to the Toorak Road exit of Citylink which is only a 25 minute drive from the airport. Likewise, it is only 15 minutes by car to the city. Our house backs onto Kooyong Park and you can borrow our bikes and cycle all the way into the city along the scenic Yarra River bicycle/walking path, without leaving the track once. There are great cafes to stop off along the way.
access: The Pool House has it's own private, separate entry so guests can be completely independent.  Guests have access to the garden pool and spa. Most of the time they will have this area to themselves. For stays of one week or more, we are happy to put guests' laundry through our machine as there are no laundry facilities in The Pool house itself. Guests have access to unlimited Wi-Fi and their own dedicated wireless PC or Mac printer.
interaction: The Pool House has it's own private, separate entry so guests can be completely independent.  Most of the time guests will have the garden and pool area to themselves. We enjoy chatting with our guests and pointing them in the direction of interesting local spots and eateries, but we are also respectful of guests' privacy should they prefer it. I personally meet and greet guests upon their arrival and I am always contactable during their stay.
house_rules: For the comfort of other guests, smoking is allowed outside only. No loud music to be played after 11pm. Please ensure that heating or cooling is turned off before leaving the Pool House. No more than two visitors at a time.
host_about:
We are privileged to live in a lovely part of Melbourne. We have one teenager left at home, and one small friendly dog that lives mostly inside.

I am self employed and work mostly from home, which is ideal for having guests come and stay.

I love walking, cycling, cooking, reading, theatre, live music and travel and I try to keep up-to-date with what is happening in and around Melbourne, so I am able to recommend restaurants, activities and festivals. I am particularly fond of quirky events around town and am always dragging someone along!

When we travel we forgo the homogeneous chain hotels and stay in anything from camper vans to B&Bs to boutique hotels--accommodation that reflects a bit of the culture around us. I particularly love destinations that offer an insight into a completely different way of life.

I look forward to welcoming you to our part of the world and giving you some great tips on Melbourne.

name: Classic and Contemporary Apartment on Collins St
summary: Begin a day where morning light fills a cheerful apartment and illuminates gleaming timber floorboards. Furnishings are simple and tasteful, and there's a designated workspace that is sure to appeal to business travelers and holiday-makers alike.
space: Calm peaceful interior with high ceilings. North facing tenth floor residence with timber floorboards, French doors and expansive high ceilings reminiscent of a New York loft. With the Southbank promenade, university precinct, most forms of public transport and the Central Business District all at your doorstep. Minutes away from numerous Melbourne attractions - the Yarra river, the MCG, Queen Victoria Market, Etihad stadium and Royal Botanical gardens to name but a few.  Features include: - Enter from Lt. Collins or Collins street - Fully equipped kitchen - Microwave oven - Stainless steel European dishwasher - European cooktop, oven and range-hood - European Laundry - with Samsung washer and dryer - Bathroom includes hairdryer and towels - 1 bedroom with Queen ensemble and BIR - 32' LCD TV - Fast Wifi
description: Begin a day where morning light fills a cheerful apartment and illuminates gleaming timber floorboards. Furnishings are simple and tasteful, and there's a designated workspace that is sure to appeal to business travelers and holiday-makers alike.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is positioned at the prestigious west end of Collins Street. It's close to sporting venues, cultural amenities, and the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre.
notes: No parking space included Check in&out time can be flexible based on adjacent bookings
transit: There is a tram stop in front of the apartment building. Also the airport express bus(SkyBus) stop and Souther Cross station are only 700m far away from the apartment.
access: No other spaces to access
interaction: I am available for questions via mobile, airbnb messaging.
house_rules: Please give me a prompt notification if you lose the security keys. Please use the provided recycle bin for any recycles. The building recycle bins are located in the car parking area on level 1 in the Little Collins street side of the building. If you have any issues during your stay, please let me know. Be respectful and enjoy your stay.
host_about:
Hi there. I'm originally from South Korea and have been living in Melbourne since 2005. What I love about Melbourne is that Melbourne is friendly and beautiful - with art on street corners, tree-lined boulevards and parklands that extend right into the heart of the city.
If you are looking for a nice Melbourne accommodation, please contact me for more details.

name: Penthouse St Kilda Style
summary: This penthouse apartment is stylish as well as functional and caters for both the business executive and today's modern family.
space: The furniture, beds, bedding and linen are of the highest quality. We provide free access to Netflix and high speed unlimited internet. The apartment comes with security parking for two cars with lift access and the building has a security entrance.  You will find yourself superbly located with three balconies overlooking the Barkly and Acland St Cafe / shopping districts and some of Melbourne’s most loved restaurants and bars and a short walk to both St Kilda beach and the St Kilda Botanical Gardens as well as to the 96 tram which goes directly to the city via the light rail. *Please note: our apartment sleeps up to 7 people. The rollout 7th bed can be made up upon request

St Kilda was named after the Lady of St Kilda, a ship wh
neighborhood_overview: St Kilda was named after the Lady of St Kilda, a ship which was moored at the main beach in the early 1840’s. The suburb has a rich history and was always seen as a very popular place to be during victorian and Edwardian times due to its proximity to the bay. St Kilda has continued to be a very popular place to live and holiday destination. It is a hub for the Melbourne music scene and has three very identifiable landmarks close together on the Esplanade. The “Espy” – the Esplanade hotel, the Palais Theatre and of course Luna Park, with its array of rides and sideshows sitting on the edge of the water. Acland Street is renowned as being one of Melbourne’s most popular food destinations and it is famous for its array of superb cake shops. if you love gardens and flowers, be sure to visit St Kilda’s Botanic Gardens, also known as Blessington Gardens in Blessington Street. It has one of the most popular rose collections in Victoria. If you would like to see some excellent examples of Edwa
notes: *Please note: our apartment sleeps up to 7 people. The rollout 7th bed can be made up upon request Feel free to let us know if there is anything we can do to make your stay more enjoyable!
transit: Getting around is easy from St Kilda, which is located only approx. 5km South of Melbourne’s CBD. Trams commence in Acland St near Barkly St (St Kilda) and run via Acland St, The Esplanade, FitzroySt, South Melbourne Light Rail (Canterbury Rd, Ferrars St and Whiteman St), Clarendon St, SpencerSt, Bourke St (City), Spring St and Nicholson St to terminate near Blyth St (East Brunswick). Access to Melbourne’s rail network is via the Balaclava train station in St Kilda East.
access: You will have exclusive access to the apartment.
interaction: Our reservations and ground teams will be available from 9am until 10pm every day .
house_rules: If you think you may be arriving after 6pm, please let us know in advance so we can arrange your key collection.

name: Expansive City Views POOL SPA GYM!!
summary: If you want to be close to everything that makes Melbourne special; if you want spectacular views of the city; if you want to feel at home with all cooking, laundry and entertainment facilities available; if you want access to a pool, spa, gym, tennis courts and BBQ area 16 hours a day; if you'd like to sit on the balcony for breakfast  while hot air balloons float quietly by, or watch the sun setting behind the city with a glass of something - then come and share my apartment with me.
space: Welcome to Melbourne - Enjoy the view!! Enjoy a private room right in the heart of Melbourne's iconic Chapel Street shopping precinct, with expansive views of the city and beyond.   With floor to ceiling windows lay back in your queen size bed and enjoy a panoramic view of the Melbourne skyline!  Centrally located with easy access to restaurants, bars, cinemas and shopping, you can take advantage of the in-house heated swimming pool, spa, gym, tennis court and bbq area.  TV, WiFi internet, Heating, Air Con, Pool, Gym, Spa, Kitchen facilities etc are all available for you to use.  With the convenience of an on-site supermarket, pharmacy, bakery and other and other speciality stores you won't have to worry about a thing. Public transport is located right at your front door, or take a leisurely walk to the city, the Botanic Gardens, MCG, soccer, tennis or basketball stadiums.  At the end of a hard day's work or sightseeing enjoy a dip in the POOL, relax in the SPA, or take to the GYM for

TV, WiFi internet, Heating, Air C
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is safe, friendly and interesting.  Lots of coffee shops, cafes, restaurants, bars, cinemas and of course shopping.   It's close to the Prahran Market so easy access to plenty of good quality fresh produce, and food from all around the world. Two minutes away is the Yarra River walking/running/cycling track where you can follow the river right into the heart of the CBD - or maybe just as far as the beautiful Botanic Gardens.  If it's sports or entertainment you crave, then it's all just a short walk away. Rugby, soccer, tennis, basketball, cycling, netball, Aussie Rules football.
transit: Tram, train or bus - everything is right here.
access: Guests have access to all cooking and laundry facilities in the apartment. Also full access to the swimming pool, gym tennis courts and outdoor area. The bathroom is shared - so keep it clean.
interaction: I'm happy to help guests in any way I can.  Just let me know what you need.  I can organise trips out of the city for you.  Fancy a day trip to the Yarra Valley for some wine tasting?  Or maybe a trip to Phillip Island, with a stop off at the kangaroo and koala park where you can interact with the native animals?  How about the Great Ocean Road? The Ballarat Goldfields?  The Mornington Peninsular or Hepburn Hot Springs?  Even a guided tour of Tasmania if you have the time.
house_rules: House rules are simple: 1. Respect my home and remember it's not a hotel 2. Respect the other residents and keep the noise down 3. Keep it clean - clean kitchen, clean bathroom 4. No smoking 5. Definately NO PARTIES 6. No illegal internet downloads 7.  Lost key/security fob $100
host_about: I am originally from Tasmania, but I have lived in Melbourne for 20+ years.  I love the inner-city life style and everything it has to offer - great restaurants, great coffee and a wonderful mixture of people and cultures.

name: Very Large 2 Bdrm Apt in Melbourne!
summary: Bright, easy and comfortable to live in and so close to the train, tram, supermarket, shops, restaurants.
space: Welcome to Melbourne! This is a really comfortable flat to live in. It has a great kitchen with a dishwasher, a very large open plan living/dining room space plus study nook. The master bedroom is large and has a huge walk in wardrobe which will be half emptied so you can use it. The second bedroom has 2 single beds in the form of a 'captain's bunk bed' and large BIR with a window onto the balcony. There is a large bathroom with separate shower and bath. Also a separate toilet and european laundry cupboard with washing machine, dryer and sink. Large square sized balcony with BBQ and lounging chairs, with a view of the city off to one side. The flat is on the first floor and a 2min walk to Newmarket station which gets you into the heart of Melbourne in under 10 minutes. 2minute walk to the tram too. Flemington racecourse is a 10min walk up the road if you like horses. You can hear the train but it doesn't bother us at all.. the line is not used very often either. Anything you want or ne

Use whatever you find in the cupboards. Please don't leave the heater or air-con running 24hours or while you're not in the flat. Some pets may be allowed, contact us to find out.
host_about:
Hi!
I was born and raised in Australia and lived 5 years in Europe. 
My husband and I met while working in Europe. Funnily enough we were 2 Australians who were working for a small dance  company in Switzerland in Vevey. Eventually.. we fell in love got married and moved back to Australia, we still continued to work in Europe from Australia... but then Herbie came along last year. Our son was born in may 2011, he's just great. We are now still maintaining a little of our performing lifestyle by touring a show to canada.. but these days we are strongly based in Melbourne.

name: Split Level City Centre Apartment + free parking
summary: This light, bright, quiet apartment is right in the centre of Melbourne. It is spacious and has three double bedrooms so comfortably sleeps six people. Just a few minutes walk will bring you to all the special places such as CBD,  Federation Square, the Botanic Gardens and sporting venues like the MCG and Rod Laver Arena.The apartment is on the third floor of this low rise building and is reached by stairs.
space: This is a modern light filled apartment on the 3rd (top) storey of the building and it is reached by stairs. It has the benefit of air conditioning on both levels. It is only a short walk to the CBD and around the corner from the Royal Botanic Gardens and parklands. There are galleries, concert halls and theatres close by. A short walk across the parkland will bring you to the MCG, the Tennis Centre and other sporting venues on Swan St. There is plenty of public transport -  trams and buses on St Kilda Road; more trams on Clarendon St and Sturt St. Flinders St station is a ten minute walk from the apartment and you can catch a train from there to anywhere in Melbourne. South Melbourne Market and Clarendon St is the local shopping centre. When you first arrive and need a few supplies there is the IGA supermarket across the street, a two minute walk. The cafes, shops and galleries at Federation Square and the vibrant life of Southgate are just a short walk from home. The apartment is on

neighborhood_overview: This area is full of treats - Malthouse Theatre and Australian Centre for Contemporary Arts (ACCA) across the road; IGA supermarket open till midnight 6 nights a week; great cafe just around the corner on Miles Street; the wonders of South Melbourne market just a short walk away. All sporting venues are also within walking distance.
transit: We have countless trams on St Kilda Road and another on Sturt Street. Just a short walk to Flinders Street Station. A car is not essential here but if you have one, we have free on and off street parking.
access: The entire apartment is yours for the duration of your stay. You also have unlimited access to other treats like the gym, tennis court, the pool and beautiful gardens. We also have tennis racquets available and plenty of balls at your disposal.
interaction: Marian and I are just a phone call or an email away.
house_rules: There are 5 other families occupying this building, please consider them. Please leave the apartment as you find it. No parties. No smoking allowed, either inside or on the balconies. No pets. If you use the barbecue, please leave it clean for the next guests. Keep noise level down after 10pm on balconies and in stairwell. If young children are present keep balcony doors locked. Take all rubbish to rubbish skips before leaving. Do not vacuum or wash linen before you leave (apartment is serviced). If you require assistance or information use guest info folder under the coffee table.
host_about: We are a retired couple and we enjoy travelling in Australia, visiting family and friends

name: Grand Old Victorian Hawthorn Home
summary: A beautiful classic 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom Victorian home with big rooms and high ceilings in a sought after suburb only 8kms from the CBD. Situated on a quiet, leafy street, yet just a few minutes walk from cafes, shopping, trams and express trains.
space: We've been renting out our home to visitors and locals since 2008 and everyone who has stayed has always loved the place from the minute they walk through the door. It's an ideal corporate rental for executives on assignment or families relocating to Melbourne or just coming for a few weeks to visit friends. Situated on a quiet, leafy street it is just a few minutes walk from Camberwell cafes, restaurants and top quality shopping. Camberwell station is only a few minutes walk with fast trains providing easy access to the CBD and eastern suburbs, including most major businesses, universtities and hospitals. Suits both executives and families who like light filled, spacious living with easy access to all that Melbourne has to offer.
description: A beautiful classic 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom Victorian home with big rooms and high ceilings in a sought after suburb only 8kms from the CBD. neighborhood_overview: Situated on a quiet, leafy street it is just a few minutes walk from Camberwell cafes, restaurants and top quality shopping.
transit: Camberwell station is only a few minutes walk with fast trains providing easy access to the MCG and CBD and eastern suburbs, including most major businesses, universities, sporting venues and hospitals. Both the South Eastern and Eastern Freeways are easily accessible.
access: Large fully equipped kitchen with gas stove top, electric oven, dishwasher, microwave, large fridge-freezer and island bench with bar stools. The adjacent family room with dining table to seat up to 8 opens onto a paved area in the rear complete with table and chairs. The lounge has large flat screen digital TV, stereo, video, DVD player and digital grand piano.  The main bedroom has a queen size bed, wardrobes, chest of drawers and ensuite with a shower over the bath. Second bedroom has a queen size bed and wardrobes. The bright main bathroom has a walk in shower and also houses the washing machine. Ducted heating provides fast warmth in winter and the high ceilings with ceiling rose ventilation keeps the double brick house cool in summer. Included is FREE wireless cable broadband. Off street parking is available for up to 3 cars. For those who wish to relax at home there is a large collection of  games to suit all ages.
interaction: A property manager will prepare the house for your arrival and departure and be on hand for any queries during your stay.
house_rules: No Smoking, No pets, No parties. Arrival/departure times are generally 3pm arrive 10am depart but we can be flexible depending on the length of the stay and adjacent bookings. Please leave the house in a clean state. Whilst it will be cleaned after your departure, greasy cooktops etc will be charged extra
host_about: We are out of town quite often, so rent our lovely home out while we are away.

name: Uber-Cool Loft - South Melbourne + Crossfit gym
summary: The philosophy of the Loft is to provide a home away from home with functional design and nice surprises throughout the space. I welcome feedback - to keep the Loft as one of the most unique accommodations in this wonderful city Insta-ubercoolloft
space: Welcome To This Unique Location In The Heart Of Melbourne!  The Loft: Come stay and enjoy a 2 Bedroom loft apartment in super South Melbourne all to yourself/selves. The recently renovated apartment has everything we have thought of that one could want including:    Wifi    Cable TV    Off-street parking    Two bedrooms one with Queen bed and one Double bed Two single adult size foldout beds    Full kitchen including vintage milkshake maker    Eclectic designers furnishings    Glamorous bath-tub!! In addition you can enjoy a bicycle, karaoke, games, dvd's, treadmill, ipod dock and vintage hi-fi. Even have an AWESOME Landrover Defender that is available for rent! The Area: You will enjoy the perfect location in a quiet street but close to everything Melbourne has to offer!  Getting around is easy with the City tram literally at the door. There is a pub across the road and you will be in walking distance to South Melbourne market, botanical gardens, loads of shops and Albert Park Lake pr
description: The philosophy of the Loft is to provide a home away from home with functional design and nice surprises throughout the space. I welcome feedback - to keep the Loft as one of the most unique accommodations in this wonderful city Insta-ubercoolloft Welcome To This Unique Location In The Heart Of Melbourne!  The Loft: Come stay and enjoy a 2 Bedroom loft apartment in super South Melbourne all to yourself/selves. The recently renovated apartment has everything we have thought of that one could want including:    Wifi    Cable TV    Off-street parking    Two bedrooms one with Queen bed and one Double bed Two single adult size foldout beds    Full kitchen including vintage milkshake maker    Eclectic designers furnishings    Glamorous bath-tub!! In addition you can enjoy a bicycle, karaoke, games, dvd's, treadmill, ipod dock and vintage hi-fi. Even have an AWESOME Landrover Defender that is available for rent! The Area: You will enjoy the perfect location in a quiet street but close to ever
neighborhood_overview: South Melbourne has that wonderful blend of historical significance, modernity and village atmosphere all with a location that is second to none. Between the city, the beach, Albert Park Lake, the Botanical Gardens and of course with the heart of the suburb the wonderful South Melbourne market. For the little one's there are parks galore, swans to feed and trams to ride. I discovered South Melbourne ten years ago - and i am still discovering "new" charms....all the time.
notes: Everything and anything you would ever need to shop, eat and drink is in walking distance Highlights are: o South Melbourne Market (open all weekend) corner of Cecil and Coventry St (basically turn right out the door, walk to the lights (clarendon st), turn right, walk 3 blocks to Coventry and turn left (its at the end) o Coventry St itself is filled with awesome shops and even better cafes (take your pick they are all superb o Pubs (plenty of good ones including the water rat over the road, honey bar up on the clarendon st corner, golden gate and the George on Coventry st) o Resto’s o Excellent Greek at spitiko on Park st (just cross over clarendon and keep walking -  if you hit cecil st you have gone to far) o Excellent small plate style food on clarendon half way along to Coventry st at Hercules Morse o Excellent pub dining at Lamaro’s on cecil (bit more upmarket) o Great seafood at the south Melbourne market Claypots on the corner of cecil and York – very atmospheric o Really good
transit: Ok super convenient public transport. Firstly the airport trip is around 25 minutes in a cab which until Melbourne airport link arrives is the best transport option for a group. Secondly there is a tram stop outside the front door for the number 1 tram - takes around 6 minutes into Federation square. A few hundred meters walk you will be able to pick up the 112 which takes you to the Casino and Convetion centre (5 minutes) and then up Collins St. There is one parking spot in the drive directly in front of the Loft - free parking  worth its weight in gold in inner city Melbourne these days
access: Guests have the entire Loft to themselves. Laundry facilities are shared but available at all times. Single car spot available directly in front of the Loft in the driveway to the property (off-street) "which is a rarity in this part of Melbourne. The garage next to the Loft is a car park for the graphic design studio next door to the Loft.
interaction: I love meeting Guests and sharing local knowledge of living in South Melbourne for the last ten years and watching the suburb continue to evolve into a very special Melbourne "village"
house_rules: Simply to be friendly and respectful of the space. However stuff happens and i don't sweat the small stuff - i simply want my guests to feel as though they have a home away from home
host_about:
Right now I consider myself a very lucky person. For my work I get to both help people in need (working in International Development) and to travel to many interesting and wonderful places around the world. I like to eat street food and drink in local bars and avoid wherever I can, the bland (you could be anywhere) 4 and 5 star hotel experience. Food, wine, running (not all at the same time mind you) are all interests as well as any local festival that might be within coo-ee!!

As a guest I am friendly and unimposing having travelled so much in developing countries my expectation is that the experience is "what it is" and a "positive" attitude will mean you make the most out of it. As a host well, shortly, following a renovation I will have a cool new apartment in "the worlds most liveable city" Melbourne on the air so am very excited about this and giving all the lowdown on my great city!!

name: Smart Modern St Kilda
summary: This smart, modern apartment which looks out accross the St Kilda Botanical Gardens is stylish as well as functional and caters for both the business executive and today's modern family.
space: The furniture, beds, bedding and linen are of the highest quality. We provide free access to Netflix and high speed unlimited internet. The apartment comes with security parking with lift access and the building has a security entrance.  You will find yourself superbly located on leafy, picturesque and quiet Herbert St a short stroll to the Barkly and Acland St cafe and shopping strips and some of Melbourne’s most loved restaurants and bars as well as to St Kilda beach and the No. 96 tram which will take you directly into to the city via the light rail which runs along Albert Park and Albert Park Lake.

You will find yourself superbly located on leafy, picturesque and quiet Herbert St a short stroll to the Barkly and Acland St cafe and shopping strips and some of Melbourne’s most loved restaurants and bars as well as to St Kilda beach and the No. 96 tram which will take you directly into to the city via the light rail which runs along Albert Park and Albert Park Lake. You will have exclusive access to the apartment. Our reservations and ground teams will be available from 9am until 10pm every day . St Kilda was named after the Lady of St Kilda, a ship which was moored
neighborhood_overview: St Kilda was named after the Lady of St Kilda, a ship which was moored at the main beach in the early 1840’s. The suburb has a rich history and was always seen as a very popular place to be during victorian and Edwardian times due to its proximity to the bay. St Kilda has continued to be a very popular place to live and holiday destination. It is a hub for the Melbourne music scene and has three very identifiable landmarks close together on the Esplanade. The “Espy” – the Esplanade hotel, the Palais Theatre and of course Luna Park, with its array of rides and sideshows sitting on the edge of the water. Acland Street is renowned as being one of Melbourne’s most popular food destinations and it is famous for its array of superb cake shops. if you love gardens and flowers, be sure to visit St Kilda’s Botanic Gardens, also known as Blessington Gardens in Blessington Street. It has one of the most popular rose collections in Victoria. If you would like to see some excellent examples of Edwa
notes: Please feel free to let us know if there is anything we can do during your stay to help.
transit: Getting around is easy from St Kilda, which is located only approx. 5km South of Melbourne’s CBD. Trams commence in Acland St near Barkly St (St Kilda) and run via Acland St, The Esplanade, FitzroySt, South Melbourne Light Rail (Canterbury Rd, Ferrars St and Whiteman St), Clarendon St, SpencerSt, Bourke St (City), Spring St and Nicholson St to terminate near Blyth St (East Brunswick). Access to Melbourne’s rail network is via the Balaclava train station in St Kilda East.
access: You will have exclusive access to the apartment.
interaction: Our reservations and ground teams will be available from 9am until 10pm every day .
house_rules: If you think you may be arriving after 9pm, please let us know in advance.

name: Smart Modern in St Kilda
summary: This smart, modern apartment is stylish as well as functional and caters for both the business executive and today's modern family.
space: The furniture, beds, bedding and linen are of the highest quality. We provide free access to Netflix and high speed unlimited internet. The apartment comes with security parking with lift access and the building has a security entrance.  You will find yourself superbly located on leafy, picturesque and quiet Herbert St directly across the road from the St Kilda Botanical Gardens. However, you will also be a very short walk to the Barkly and Acland St cafe and shopping strips and some of Melbourne’s most loved restaurants and bars as well as to St Kilda beach and the No. 96 tram which will take you directly into to the city via the light rail which runs along Albert Park and Albert Park Lake.

You will have exclusive access to the apartment. Our reservations and ground teams will be available from 9am until 10pm every day . St Kilda was named after the Lady
neighborhood_overview: St Kilda was named after the Lady of St Kilda, a ship which was moored at the main beach in the early 1840’s. The suburb has a rich history and was always seen as a very popular place to be during victorian and Edwardian times due to its proximity to the bay. St Kilda has continued to be a very popular place to live and holiday destination. It is a hub for the Melbourne music scene and has three very identifiable landmarks close together on the Esplanade. The “Espy” – the Esplanade hotel, the Palais Theatre and of course Luna Park, with its array of rides and sideshows sitting on the edge of the water. Acland Street is renowned as being one of Melbourne’s most popular food destinations and it is famous for its array of superb cake shops. if you love gardens and flowers, be sure to visit St Kilda’s Botanic Gardens, also known as Blessington Gardens in Blessington Street. It has one of the most popular rose collections in Victoria. If you would like to see some excellent examples of Edwa
notes: Please feel free to let us know if there is anything we can do during your stay to help.
transit: Getting around is easy from St Kilda, which is located only approx. 5km South of Melbourne’s CBD. Trams commence in Acland St near Barkly St (St Kilda) and run via Acland St, The Esplanade, FitzroySt, South Melbourne Light Rail (Canterbury Rd, Ferrars St and Whiteman St), Clarendon St, SpencerSt, Bourke St (City), Spring St and Nicholson St to terminate near Blyth St (East Brunswick). Access to Melbourne’s rail network is via the Balaclava train station in St Kilda East.

There are many things to see and do while in Caulfield including the famous Caulfield Park and Racecourse. There are 20 race days each racing seas
neighborhood_overview: The suburb of Caulfield is best known as the place where the Caulfield Cup horse race is run and is located just 12 kilometres South East of Melbourne’s bustling heart. There are many things to see and do while in Caulfield including the famous Caulfield Park and Racecourse. There are 20 race days each racing season and some of Australia’s most famous and historic races are conducted on those days. The Caulfield train station is less than a hundred metres from the racecourse.  Tavlin Restaurant on Glenhuntly Road, a popular middle eastern restaurant and Siam Thai Restaurant get consistently good reviews. These are but two of Caulfield’s many well known and well located restaurants. The Labassa, a French Renaissance mansion with luxuriant and expertly made interior, is well worth a visit while staying with us in Caulfield. Also available is a guided tour of the amazing wine making facilities of the Yarra Valley. Experience the rich history and knowledge from a life time of wine culture
notes: Please feel free to let us know if there is anything we can do during your stay to help.
transit: Caulfield is well serviced by public transport into the city. Caulfield railway station is located on the Pakenham, Cranbourne and Frankston lines. Trams also connect Caulfield extensively via route 67.

name: Point Cook Homestay with Private Bathroom
space: •Our property is a spacious double-storey house with the rental unit on the upper floor. The friendly host family of 3 stays on the lower floor and provides better services than the hotel concierge ! •The rental unit consists of 2 bedrooms, one with a queen size bed and the other with 2 single beds, both attached to a common private bathroom. Guests will use either the queen bedroom (for a single person or couple), or both bedrooms (for bigger group). •Guests have their own private living and dining area (with TV, mini-fridge, microwave and coffee-making facilities), and are most welcome to use our main living room, kitchen, dining area, laundry, WiFi and piano.  •Bed linens and towels are provided. neighborhood_overview: Just a hop, skip and jump from the CBD, Richmond is a vibrant and thriving neighbourhood with all the benefits of inner-city living. If you're wanting to get amongst the action, Richmond's the place to be. Everywhere you look Richmond oozes character; from its narrow laneways covered in magnificent street art to its trendy microbreweries and hidden foodie delights. Richmond showcases an eclectic mixture of fascinating architecture which pays homage to the neighbourhood's working class heritage, with converted warehouses contrasted with gorgeous Victorian buildings and ultra-contemporary designs.

Use the PTV (Public Transport Victoria) App to help you get around Melbourne. It's free and easy to use.

space: I have a 150 year old terrace house with it's original facade, however hidden behind is a modern, architecturally designed conversion with a warehouse feel.  You have access to a large upstairs  deck, private balcony and private en suit bathroom.  It is a medium sized room with a super comfortable, queen sized bed with a latex mattress, feather pillows and crisp white cotton bed linen with either a duvet and/or blankets. The room has a private en suit bathroom. It is fairly small but it is modern, fully functional and with plenty of hot water. There is a small fridge in the room and tea and coffee making facilities.  The room has two french doors which open onto a private balcony where you can sit overlooking the street. You also have access to the large upstairs private deck with comfortable outdoor furniture. It is a bit chilly in winter, but for all the other seasons, you'll find it is a great place to sit in the sun and read a book, have a drink or catch up with friends. It is spac

neighborhood_overview: See my description but I am close to everything in Central Melbourne. Close to CBD,  universities, hospitals, Queen Victoria market, supermarkets, restaurants, shopping malls, boutique shopping strips, art galleries, theaters, music venues, pubs  and wine bars, Melbourne zoo, Melbourne aquarium, parks and gardens, sporting venues, car hire, public transport, tour operators and much more.  Most are walking distance or short public transport ride.
transit: I am 5 minutes from the two major public transport routes to the entire city of Melbourne.  I am 2kl from Southern Cross station which is the country link railway station.
access: Private room. Large upstairs deck. Private balcony. Kitchen and meals area.
interaction: As much or as little as the guests like. I live here but work during the day. I am usually here at breakfast time and most evenings and sometimes during the day. I am self employed so sometimes work from home. I converse easily with guests but also do not mind if guests keep to themselves. The entrance  to the house and the guest room is separate from my part so guests can be completely private if they wish. I am not offended if people keep to themselves.  Sometimes I am very busy with work and can't get caught up in long conversations, or relax, but this is rare.
house_rules: Smoking is ok but only on the outside deck or balcony please.  You are welcome to have visitors but just let me know in advance. And please no overnight stays unless they are paying guests.  Alcohol consumption is OK but please, nothing to excess and no inconsiderate behavior. I have to work in the morning!
host_about:
My name is Lucy and I'm a middle aged professional who works in Melbourne's CBD. I have a house which occasionally I share with my 22 year old daughter, Ellie. 
My daughter and I have traveled a lot and stayed in airbnb's in a number of countries. We found it a great way to find affordable, comfortable accommodation while meeting great people. We hope you will enjoy our place as well. We would love the opportunity to introduce you to our vibrant city. We both love travel, art, books, photography, good food, wine, lively discussions and friends.

name: New apartment in Melbourne's west
space: Welcome to Melbourne and thank you for checking this listing!  The apartment is located in a new complex in the heart of Maidstone and is a close many points of interest.  The Apartment: Spacious 2 Bedroom apartment, with open plan kitchen and large balcony. Modern Bathroom and well appointed. Kitchen is fully equipped, LCD TV in the living room and washing machine. Undercover parking is included with the apartment.  The Rooms: 2 Rooms; one room with 2 single beds and another with 1 double bed both rooms with built in wardrobes.  What's Close: Highpoint Shopping complex located 2 minutes down the road.  Tram line a stone's throw away. City is 15 minutes by car.  Melbourne racecourse - 10 minutes down the road by car.  Barkley st in Footscray - 5 minutes away which is lined with local eateries and buzzing cafes. I am looking forward to welcome you to Melbourne in the near future!

Barkley st in Footscray - 5 minutes away which is lined with local eateries and buzzing cafes. I am looking forward to welcome you to Melbourne in the near future!
house_rules: No smoking inside. There's a balcony available.
host_about:
I grew up in Melbourne. As a local, I can know all the great places to eat (both budget and high end) and things to see. I love showing visitors around my city. 

I enjoying my sports and I love being active. I play soccer, basketball, tennis and snowboarding and I practice yoga regularly.

I also love to travel. I travelled for more than 3 years in UK and Europe, usually staying with locals. I think that is the best way to travel as you experience the culture and the food. I spent most of my time working in London and studying Italian in Italy, but also visited France, Germany, Spain, Greece, Belgium, Ireland and Sweden. 

At the moment, I have my own business, which runs independent of me, so I have free time to show people around town. I am a relaxed host. I like to give some advice of where to visit, but I also like to show people around and play tourist guide every now and then.

name: Northside in Preston + wifi
summary: Cute 2 bedroom unit in the north side of Melbourne.  25 mins from Airport
space: Hi I'm Kirsten. I am an artist and instructional designer living in vibrant Preston with my lagotto puppy called Funf. My 2 bedroom unit is on a quiet street just off the Gilbert Road Tram 11 which takes 35 mins into the city. My unit has got central heating, has lots of natural light and is situated on a quiet street that is a 5 mins walk to tram stop 45 on Gilbert Road. My house is a 4 minute walk to Woolworths Coburg Hill on Elizabeth Street. I am a 15 min walk to Preston market open Wednesdays to Saturdays, great fresh produce and atmosphere. I love walking there on a Saturday and cooking afterwards. My unit is decorated eclectically with artwork. I enjoy making art, going to galleries, yoga and meditation. I have done lots of travel myself and am keen to meet like minded individuals who are keen to explore the wonders of my favourite city, Melbourne. I have travelled to South East Asia, Africa, USA, Europe and lived in Japan. I have lots of international friends who I have hosted

neighborhood_overview: Preston is a great place and an upcoming suburb. the Preston Market is the biggest drawcard. Fresh, cheap food. Preston is also close to suburbs like Brunswick and Northcote for bars and nightspots. I am on the 11 tram which takes you through Northcote, North Fitzroy and popular Brunswick Street, Fitzroy which is a great place for cafes, galleries, shops and bars.
transit: I am a 3 minute walk to a tram stop and 15 walk to Preston train station.
access: Lounge, Kitchen, bathroom, courtyard
interaction: I am happy to interact with guests but some of the time I might be out and about myself.
house_rules: Respectful, friendly people. Feel free to smoke outside. Feel free to use anything in the kitchen to cook meals but please wash up after use. Sorry no off street parking available but plenty of free, unrestricted on the street.
host_about:
Hi I'm Kirsten. I am an artist and designer living in vibrant Preston. I have a young lagotto dog called Fünf. My 2 bedroom unit is on a quiet street just off the Gilbert Road Tram 11 which takes 35 -45 mins into the city. I am a 15 min walk to Preston market open Wednesdays to Saturdays, great fresh produce and atmosphere. I love walking there on a Saturday and cooking afterwards. My unit is decorated eclectically with artwork. I enjoy making ceramics, walking my dog, going to galleries and yoga.

I have done lots of travel myself and am keen to meet like minded individuals who are keen to explore the wonders of my favourite city, Melbourne. I have travelled to South East Asia,  Africa, USA, Europe, South America and lived in Japan. I have lots of international friends who i have hosted and I've got plenty of ideas of what to do and see here. 
I am about a 25 min Uber  from the airport which is about $36. Also a 12 min walk to Preston station. Merri Creek, Coburg Trash and Treasure Market, local cafes and yoga studios are short walks away. I love making ceramics, sculpture and jewellery from my home studio. I also love music and am a short tram ride to Northcote Social Club or Brunswick Street, Fitzroy.

name: BOUTIQUE STAYS - Brighton Rose, Pet Friendly
summary: Professionally managed by Boutique Stays, Brighton Rose offers regal furniture, classic striped wallpaper and elegant decor. Tucked away in a private, leafy area of Brighton just a block from the beach, this home will give you a taste of comfortable Melbourne living. You're just a short stroll away from the colourful bathing boxes by the bay, Church street for great restaurants and shops as well as the train station connecting you with the rest of Melbourne. The perfect seaside getaway.

The impressive gourmet kitchen has granite bench tops and everything you need to cook up a storm as well as a dishwasher and built-in coffee machine for your morning caffeine hit! This classy home has two spacious living and dining areas giving you the choice to relax in a more formal or casual space. The formal living room has a cosy gas log fire to curl up next to during the colder months. The bedrooms are large, with the main bedroom serviced by a walkthrough robe and good size ensuite. There's a family sized bathroom with full sized bath and full laundry facil

neighborhood_overview: Home for many of Australia's most rich and famous, Brighton has some of the city's grandest homes and most extravagant lifestyles of any neighbourhood in Melbourne. Perched on the water's edge about 11 kilometres from the city, it's boutique bayside living at its finest. The pristine Brighton foreshore attracts many beach-goers wanting to escape the city during the warmer months and plays host to Melbourne's colourful iconic beach bathing houses dotted along its foreshore.
notes: • Minimum stay 5 nights
transit: When it comes to public transport, Brighton is spoiled for choice with the neighbourhood well connected by trains and buses. Use the PTV (Public Transport Victoria) App to help you get around Melbourne. It's free and easy to use.
access: Check-in is 2PM Check-out is 11AM Off street parking (in driveway) for 2 small vehicles or one large vehicle.
interaction: Boutique Stays is available 6 days a week during normal business hours and we have an after hours contact number in case of emergencies. We're always happy to help you any time before, during and after your stay.

Founded in 2006, the Boutique Stays Accommodation Group is an accredited tourism business providing quality houses and apartments to singles, couples and families in Melbourne. Distinguished by a commitment to high property standards, impeccable presentation and personalised customer care provided by a team located in the bayside suburb of Port Melbourne. 

A bespoke collection of 60 homes in Melbourne’s most iconic and popular neighbourhoods are handpicked to make guests feel at home with peace of mind that a dedicated, professional customer service team are ready to support each and every guest seven days per week.  A range of one, two, three and four bedroom homes are available in a choice of twenty suburbs in Melbourne for guests visiting family and friends, holiday makers travelling with or without pets and business travellers.

name: BOUTIQUE STAYS - Clifton Park, Pet Friendly
summary: Professionally managed by Boutique Stays, Clifton Park is surrounded by many parks and trails onto Merri Creek, which is perfect for walking and cycling. Surround yourself with endless fun and venturing options. If you're a bit of a foodie you'll enjoy the vibrant cafe and restaurant scene right on your doorstep; or if you're feeling more adventurous take a short trip to the CBD which is only 5km away.
space: • FREE UNLIMITED WIFI • FREE Welcome Pack • FREE Departure Clean • FREE Porta Cot  CLIFTON PARK Clifton Park is located in a quiet street and boasts fabulous accommodation for 4 people. The front bedroom has French doors opening onto a small private garden and offers a flexible bedding setup, as either two singles or one king bed. The master bedroom has a comfortable queen bed. Both have built-in robes. From the comfort of the living room you enter the dining area and fully equipped kitchen which overlook the landscaped courtyard. Here you can relax, entertain and enjoy a BBQ.  Ducted heating throughout the house and reverse cycle air conditioning in the lounge room ensure year round comfort. name: BOUTIQUE STAYS - Sandyside 2, Pet Friendly unit
summary: Professionally managed by Boutique Stays, Sandyside 2 is set in the wonderful Melbourne suburb of Sandringham Beach. It's a great place for swimming, walking and cycling with all it's well kept reserves and tracks making it a preferable favourite for Melbournians looking for the ultimate chill out spot. The house is located a few minutes away from the train station where you can take a short trip to the CBD.

Upload the Public Transport tracker to your iPhone or android and you will be able to visit the city and surrounds with ease.

name: Belsize Garden Apartment St Kilda
summary: A romantic art deco tree top apartment minutes from a trendy cafe and restaurant strip has an art house feel of spaciousness and light. So gorgeous film crews have hired it for films, photographic sessions and art house films.
space: Welcome to this Romantic Art Deco Garden Delight!  This beautiful 2 bedroom apartment is all yours, and includes 2 large bedrooms and a grand bathroom. (Please note, this and my other listing together can accommodate 12 guests together but the apartments are 2kms apart. To get the price please put in the number of guests into each listing https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/542188) This apartment has two bay windows, a large eat-in kitchen, sunny, leafy Juliet balcony overlooking the courtyard garden for bright breakfasts and there is also a formal dining area in the lounge for your enjoyment.  Polished, honey-colored floorboards, excellent quality antique furniture, including a modern piano, beautiful mood lamps and original art on the walls.   (Website hidden by Airbnb) Located close to Carlisle St with fantastic cafes, restaurants, coffee shops, funky clothes shops and more.  Around the corner from a train to the city (12 minutes ride, running every 10 minutes in peak hour) and trams to th

Polished, honey-colored floorboards, excellent quality antique furniture, including a modern piano, beautiful mood lamps and original art on the walls.   (Website hidden by Airbn
notes: There are two double beds in the apartment, two single foldout beds. This may not suit six adults but would be perfectly comfortable for four adults and two children, or six adults if they are not heavy!
access: Total apartment. Please note, in winter excessive heating usage will result in an extra charge based on last year's bill of the same period.
house_rules: Please take shoes off when inside. Smoking only on balcony and please don't throw cigarette butts into the courtyard. Also, when on the balcony, please be aware that sound ricochets around the courtyard so keep noise outside to a minimum.  Also, because of the old constructions of this art deco building, noise travels and is amplified between the downstairs and upstairs floors, so please keep noise to a minimum, particularly at night. Violation of the no party policy will result in bond being kept.
host_about: Hi, I'm Barbara. I'm an Australian author and traveller. An experimenter and love being challenged by life.  I've most recently worked in a remote Aboriginal community but was previously a journalist. Gabriel Garcia Marquez is my favorite author. On my retirement agenda, is a month doing yoga in India, a month in Perguia  at a school improving my Italian and a month at a language immersion school in France to improve my French.

name: Quiet Studio Next to Train Station
summary: Private self contained ground floor studio apartment located in downtown Rosanna.  It is a one minute walk to the train station, but quiet, because we are nestled deep in the shopping strip, with vibrant cafes and eateries.  The room has a private ensuite toilet, but you share the upstairs shower.
space: Private cozy self contained ground floor studio apartment located in downtown Rosanna.  Great access, as it is a one minute walk to Rosanna train station and the Rosanna shopping strip.   If you don't feel like going out, you have a kitchenette, a 42 inch plasma TV, and fast internet. The apartment is quite new and very cozy, in a heritage building, formerly tenanting a cobbler and then a conveyancer. The room has a private ensuite toilet, but you share the upstairs shower.  It is very quiet most of the day, as it is set back from the main street.

Internet, kitchen, laundry facilities My roommate and I live on the floors above the flat, and we are are very friendly;  we are from Canada and Si
neighborhood_overview: Apartment located in downtown Rosanna, a one minute walk to the train station and the Rosanna shopping strip.  We are right next door to vibrant cafes and eateries, including Greek, Italian, Thai, Chinese, Vietnamese restaurants, and even an gourmet burger joint.  Two minutes away, we have Rosanna Parklands, a 15 hectare park with creek, playground, and even a tree house.  If you want to explore further afield, you can use our bicycles.
transit: Probably the best access to public transport of any Airbnb in Melbourne. The train to the city stops just outside the door, and also, there are buses for east west travel, for example, an 8 minute trip to Northland shopping centre. Transport from the airport is easy;  take the Melbourne airport bus (Skybus) from outside the airport terminal to Southern Cross train station in downtown Melbourne, and then cross over to the Eltham/Hurstbridge metro train line.  Get off the train at Rosanna station, and you are there.   Alternatively, it is about $50 by taxi. There is parking nearby, and Melbourne city is a 29 minute direct train ride, with at least 3 trains per hour.  We are 2km from Austin/Mercy Hospital and 4km to La Trobe University.
access: Internet, kitchen, laundry facilities
interaction: My roommate and I live on the floors above the flat, and we are are very friendly;  we are from Canada and Singapore, and together, we can communicate in French, Spanish, English, Mandarin, Cantonese, Hokkien, Teochew, Malay, and Indonesian. We work and study at La Trobe University during the day, but are happy to visit when we are home.
house_rules: The apartment is located in a residence; staying here means you can live like a local! You become part of the community for the time you are with us. As part of that community, we would expect our guests to be respectful of other residents. ______________________________________________________________________ Smoking, pets and parties are not allowed inside the studio. ______________________________________________________________________ Check in  is 3pm and check out is 10am, but this is flexible.  Have a great stay! -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Short stays incur a $30 linen/cleaning charge.  Week and monthly stays do not include cleaning or breakfast. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- You are asked to behave in a considerate manner with regard to noise especially at night.
host_about: I am a complete geek, from the automated least distance path garage sale web app I built 10 years ago, to the fourth  electronic door unlock system I built last week.
