name: Brunswick St at your doorstep
space: Cozy and secure 1 bedroom apartment in the heart of fabulous Fitzroy. Seconds walk to iconic Brunswick and Gertrude streets full of bars, boutique clothing shops, and weird and wacky novelty shops in all their colour and glory!  Walking distance to the following: * Melbourne Museum & Exhibition Building - 2 mins * Parliament tube station - 5-10 mins * No. 86 & 96 trams - 2-5mins * Melbourne Cricket Ground - 10 minutes  * China Town - 10 mins * Federation Square, Flinders Street Station & Ian Potter Gallery - 15mins Features include: - Kitchen with cooktop, oven, microwave, fridge and dishdrawer - Living room with flat screen tv and dvd player - Bathroom/Laundry with shower/bath and washing machine - Bedroom with comfortable queen size bed and wardrobe space - Spacious balcony with gas BBQ and retractable clothes line - Phone/wifi with unlimited national calls - Heating and cooling - Loveable rag doll cat named Floyd This is a small set of apartments located above a bottle shop and supe
description: Cozy and secure 1 bedroom apartment in the heart of fabulous Fitzroy. Seconds walk to iconic Brunswick and Gertrude streets full of bars, boutique clothing shops, and weird and wacky novelty shops in all their colour and glory!  Walking distance to the following: * Melbourne Museum & Exhibition Building - 2 mins * Parliament tube station - 5-10 mins * No. 86 & 96 trams - 2-5mins * Melbourne Cricket Ground - 10 minutes  * China Town - 10 mins * Federation Square, Flinders Street Station & Ian Potter Gallery - 15mins Features include: - Kitchen with cooktop, oven, microwave, fridge and dishdrawer - Living room with flat screen tv and dvd player - Bathroom/Laundry with shower/bath and washing machine - Bedroom with comfortable queen size bed and wardrobe space - Spacious balcony with gas BBQ and retractable clothes line - Phone/wifi with unlimited national calls - Heating and cooling - Loveable rag doll cat named Floyd This is a small set of apartments located above a bottle shop and supe
neighborhood_overview: It's Fitzroy - So there is never a dull moment. Shopping, galleries, bands, gigs, street art and more - Soak it all up.
notes: I would love you to look after my indoor ragdoll cat Floyd whilst I'm away. He is docile and friendly, and you will win his heart instantly.
transit: Hop skip and a jump from trams, trains, buses. Less than 10 minute walk into the top end of the city.
access: I can provide 1 undercover secure car park if required.
house_rules: Please be quiet and respectful of the neighbours. Strictly no parties.
host_about:
I am Dave - Born and raised in Melbourne. 

I work the health industry and study psychology. I appreciate art, music and shared experiences. I choose to live in Fitzroy for it's diversity and colour - A juxtaposition of 'up-market' and 'down-and-out', of clean and grit, of new and old!

5 things I can't live without are

1.  People
2.  Music/Dance
3.  Travel
5.  Yoga
6.  Me time

I would be more than happy to recommend some places to visit in Melbourne in order to enrich your stay! 

Regards

Dave

name: Smart Caulfield Townhouse
summary: This open plan ground floor townhouse with spacious outdoor area is stylish as well as functional and caters for both the business executive and today's modern family.
space: The furniture, beds, bedding and linen are of the highest quality. We provide free access to Netflix and high speed unlimited internet and the apartment comes with security parking.  You will find yourself superbly located in the heart of South Caulfield with easy access to Melbourne's Eastern suburbs and a short ride into the CBD.

The suburb of Caulfield is best known as the place where the Caulfield Cup horse race is run and is located just 12 kilometres South East of Melbourne’s bustling heart. There are many things to see and do while in Caulfield including the famous Caulfield Park and Racecourse. There are 20 race days each racing season and some of Australia’s most famous and histori
neighborhood_overview: The suburb of Caulfield is best known as the place where the Caulfield Cup horse race is run and is located just 12 kilometres South East of Melbourne’s bustling heart. There are many things to see and do while in Caulfield including the famous Caulfield Park and Racecourse. There are 20 race days each racing season and some of Australia’s most famous and historic races are conducted on those days. The Caulfield train station is less than a hundred metres from the racecourse.  Tavlin Restaurant on Glenhuntly Road, a popular middle eastern restaurant and Siam Thai Restaurant get consistently good reviews. These are but two of Caulfield’s many well known and well located restaurants. The Labassa, a French Renaissance mansion with luxuriant and expertly made interior, is well worth a visit while staying with us in Caulfield. Also available is a guided tour of the amazing wine making facilities of the Yarra Valley. Experience the rich history and knowledge from a life time of wine culture
notes: Please feel free to let us know if there is anything we can do during your stay to help.
transit: Caulfield is well serviced by public transport into the city. Caulfield railway station is located on the Pakenham, Cranbourne and Frankston lines. Trams also connect Caulfield extensively via route 67.
access: You will have exclusive access to the apartment.
interaction: Our reservations and ground teams will be available from 9am until 10pm every day .

name: Bay Views Port Melbourne
summary: This self-contained, substantial, open plan apartment with views over Port Phillip Bay is stylish as well as functional and caters for both the business executive and today's modern family.
space: The furniture, beds, bedding and linen are of the highest quality. We provide free access to Netflix and high speed unlimited internet. The apartment comes with security parking with lift access and the building has a security entrance.  Situated in a new designer complex one street away from the hustle and bustle of Port Melbourne’s iconic Bay St and some of Melbourne’s best loved café’s, restaurants and bars you will find yourself a short walk to the Port Melbourne beach and boardwalk and to public transport.

neighborhood_overview: Situated on the shores of Hobsons Bay and the Yarra River, Port Melbourne was once a bustling transport town. Port Melbourne is now known for its parklands, bayside beaches, attractive apartment complexes mixed in with its rich history. Port Melbourne is a Suburb not far from the Port of Melbourne and has the Port Heritage Trail stretching from Station Pier in Port Melbourne to Gellibrand in Williamstown providing information and historical photos for you to discover while either walking or bike riding. Just a block from the Palm lined beach side is Bay Street, full of good cafes and shopping. The Nautical Restaurant and Lounge on the waterfront is a sophisticated and relaxed place to go and the Railway Club Steak House at 107 Raglan Street is another popular place to eat. Ciao Cielo is exceptional if you are looking for Italian and Mediterranean food, and Rock, Paper Scissors which opened in early 2016 has been getting great reviews for both their food and coffee. Port Melbourne was k
notes: Please feel free to let us know if there is anything we can do during your stay to help.
transit: Getting to and from Port Melbourne by tram is easy. The No. 109 tram runs from Collins Street and takes about 20 minutes. Alternatively, the No. 238 bus from the corner of Collins and Market streets to Bay Street takes about 25 minutes.

name: BOUTIQUE STAYS - Sandy Haven C, Pet Friendly
summary: Professionally managed by Boutique Stays, Sandy Haven C is a pet friendly home located in the heart of upmarket seaside suburb Sandringham, best known for being a friendly and country style village. This beautiful home is only a 5 minute walk to the beach where you can discover some delicious eateries and browse some fantastic shops. You're also not far away from the station, if you hop on a train you'll be in the CBD within 28 minutes where you'll discover all that the city has to offer.

neighborhood_overview: Sandringham is a stunning beachside suburb with picturesque views from the beach and a variety of restaurants and cafes for your enjoyment. Sandringham is far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the city yet close enough via the train which is only a short stroll from the property.
notes: •	Minimum stay 5 nights •	Extended stays for 7 nights+ are available at reduced rates.
transit: Sandringham Train Station is just a short walk away. Sandringham Train Station is only a few minutes walk from the property and the train will get you to the CBD in leisurely fashion passing through some of Melbourne's most affluent suburbs including Brighton, Elwood and South Yarra. Get yourself a Myki and you have full access to Melbourne's vast tram, train and bus network. Getting around is easy! Upload the Public Transport tracker to your iPhone or android and you will be able to visit the city and surrounds with ease.
access: Check-in is 2PM Check-out is 11AM Secure garage parking is available for 1 vehicles with remote access.
interaction: Boutique Stays is available 6 days a week during normal business hours and we have an after hours contact number in case of emergencies. We're always happy to help you anytime before, during and after your stay.
house_rules: House Rules Photo Identification will be requested upon confirmation of your booking.  1. By accepting our Terms and Conditions the ‘booking name’ is deemed the Registered Guest. - The registered guest is responsible for: - Any visitors and their behaviour while at the premises - Ensuring all guests and visitors are aware of the booking terms and conditions. 2. The property and its contents for the entire period of the booking and will be liable for all breakages and damages however caused by any Guest or visitors regardless of whether you are present or not at the time the damage occurs. 3. The number of guests staying at the property must not exceed the number agreed to in the booking details. There are no exceptions unless we approve additional Guests in writing. At our discretion additional costs may apply for any additional guests found to have been at the Property during your booking. 4. A strict no party policy applies at all times in all our properties. 5. All guests are expect
host_about:
Founded in 2006, the Boutique Stays Accommodation Group is an accredited tourism business providing quality houses and apartments to singles, couples and families in Melbourne. Distinguished by a commitment to high property standards, impeccable presentation and personalised customer care provided by a team located in the bayside suburb of Port Melbourne. 

A bespoke collection of 60 homes in Melbourne’s most iconic and popular neighbourhoods are handpicked to make guests feel at home with peace of mind that a dedicated, professional customer service team are ready to support each and every guest seven days per week.  A range of one, two, three and four bedroom homes are available in a choice of twenty suburbs in Melbourne for guests visiting family and friends, holiday makers travelling with or without pets and business travellers.

The Boutique Stays Accommodation Group has welcomed over 4,000 guests and 150 pets into our homes in the past year and look forward to welcoming you for your first or return visit.

name: Budget-friendly double room
summary: Great northside location. Bedroom with double bed, high ceilings in older character-filled home. Free wifi. Very close to public transport & nearest supermarket. Good coffee just a few blocks away. Two friendly miniature dachshunds. Great budget option if you are tired of hostel accommodation. Please note we do not provide additional storage: the room is set up for one or a couple of tourists/travellers, with 1 suitcase or two. If you have a carload of stuff please book elsewhere.
space: PRICE OF ROOM CURRENTLY REDUCED AS I AM USING IT FOR STORAGE FOR MY FASHION LABEL AND WILL REQUIRE SOME (LIMITED) ACCESS DURING YOUR STAY. Our home is a long, narrow, older-style house, it was built in 1920, with double brick plastered walls and high ceilings. Close to three trams, a supermarket, train station and bus stop. Your guest room contains a comfortable queen-sized double bed, with free wifi  included.  PLEASE NOTE that we only offer the *one* guest room in our home, available to one booking at a time, so you will not be staying in a house with any other guests! We get this particular inquiry often, I'm assuming it happens a bit out there in Airbnb land, so hopefully this makes if very clear. You will be sharing our home with us as we go about our normal lives.  This does mean exactly that: we very much enjoy having laid-back guests in our home, but we will continue to go about life as normal while you are here. This is not a 5-star hotel, it is our home. We are not super-tidy
description: Great northside location. Bedroom with double bed, high ceilings in older character-filled home. Free wifi. Very close to public transport & nearest supermarket. Good coffee just a few blocks away. Two friendly miniature dachshunds. Great budget option if you are tired of hostel accommodation. Please note we do not provide additional storage: the room is set up for one or a couple of tourists/travellers, with 1 suitcase or two. If you have a carload of stuff please book elsewhere. Our home is a long, narrow, older-style house, it was built in 1920, with double brick plastered walls and high ceilings. Close to three trams, a supermarket, train station and bus stop. Your guest room contains a comfortable queen-sized double bed, with free wifi  included.  PLEASE NOTE that we only offer the *one* guest room in our home, available to one booking at a tim
neighborhood_overview: An eclectic and vibrant area in Melbourne’s inner north, Brunswick & Coburg bustle with a diverse cross section of interesting street cafes and restaurants flaunting a spectrum of global flavours. Easy walking distance to bars, cafes, inexpensive restaurants, shops & post office (the house is within easy walking distance of both Lygon Street and Sydney Road). The area has plenty of cafes and bars, lots of artists and musicians live in the area and there is an active live local music scene. Historically it was a poor working class/migrant area which has recently become gentrified. There are lots of front yards still with lemon trees and fig trees growing to reflect this history. There is a great article in Broadsheet Melbourne (a local online paper) describing some of the excellent places you can eat out in Brunswick for under $10 if you feel like googling!
notes: Sometimes I must admit to being very absorbed in my work which can mean I stay up very late working in the home office, however I am very quiet when I do this! It can also mean that sometimes if I am absorbed in planning a photoshoot or some such thing, the house is not tidied for a couple of days. If neither of these things would bother you then I am sure you will enjoy staying with us.
transit: Trams: #8 and #1 tram are both a very easy 2-3min stroll away - both trams will take you in to the city. #19 tram is also an easy walk. Trains: the Upfield train line is approx 900 metres away on the other side of Sydney Road. Buses: the 510 which travels between Essendon & Ivanhoe via Brunswick, Northcote &Thornbury goes right past the door, the nearest bus stop is a two minute walk.
access: Guests have access to most rooms in the house, including the shared bathroom, laundry, toilet & kitchen. Every room in the house, in fact, except for my home office, and our bedroom. You are welcome to make yourselves at home! During the warmer months we enjoy dining and relaxing on the back deck, enjoying the sun. You are most welcome to do the same.
interaction: It is up to you how much interaction you have with us. Some guests like to retreat to the privacy of their room, or spend all their time out and about exploring Melbourne. Other guests like to spend time chatting around the kitchen table with us. Either is welcome, however please keep in mind that as I work from home, a lot of the time I do need to actually get work done rather than socialise.
house_rules: No smoking indoors. No extra pets, please (two dogs and some fish is quite enough). If you use the kitchen, please clean up after yourself. You are welcome to use the washing machine but please do ask first. The bathroom is a shared facility - please leave it in the same state you found it. Please remember to close & lock your window and the front door when going out. Our security depends on you! Please show consideration with regards to noise eg loud talking/music/tv/slamming doors/etc early in the morning (before 8am) and late at night (after 10pm). Please don't turn on the central heating without asking first. If you wish to eat in your room, feel free to do so, but please clean up after yourselves. Leaving food & crumbs on shelves and grease in the bed is not the way for a preferred guest to behave, and encourages pests.
host_about: Hey there! I'm a creative, fun-loving, travel-loving, cocktail-drinking, chocolate-eating person. My husband Mick and I love to travel. And when we are not travelling ourselves, we love hosting other travellers in our home. We are pretty independent people, and are happy to leave you alone if you are too - but also very happy to share our expertise if there's anything you would like to know. I'm very often at home, and always available to share all our tips & tricks for getting the very best out of your visit to Melbourne.

host_about:
Hello Hello and GUTEN TAG,

I am a German Girl living in Australia already since nine years. 

I am very open minded, outgoing and love to go for a nice dinner and to the movies.

I live a very active life and always go and catch up with friends.

I live with my fiancé Andy, our doggies Roam, Kilda and Otto and our cat Olivia in this beautiful house.

I am very excited to meet a lot of nice people.

See you soon

Lisa

name: Relax! Private, Stylish Loft & Spa!
summary: Comfortable, spacious, air conditioned, attic style room in modern two storey home with private bathroom with spa, TV, WIFi, tea, coffee and delicious breakfast provided, close to public transport, off street parking available. 2nd room available upon request. Cooking facilities available by arrangement. Home away from home.
space: Welcome to this Stylish, large B'n'B style Loft space! Available is a large attic style room with a queen size bed, it's own bathroom with spa bath, air conditioning, television, internet, fridge, and tea and coffee making facilities. There are also laundry facilities for your convenience. The price is for one queen size room for a single person or a couple. There is also another queen size room available @ a cost of $30.00 extra per person per night. This is flexible if family and can add an airbed to the mix. Delicious continental Breakfast Included! No cooking in the bedroom, but happy to share the kitchen for some evning meals. Transport In terms of transport, a parking space is available, the place is just walking distance to the tram, bus and shops. There are also laundry facilities for your convenience. The price is for one queen size room for a single person or a couple. There is also another queen size room available @ a cost of $30.00 extra per person per night. This is flexible if family and can add an airbed to the mix. Delicious continental Breakfast Included! No cooking in the bedroom, but happy to share the kitchen for some evning meals. Transport In terms of
neighborhood_overview: My neighbourhood is safe, close to transport and shops with a nice park nearby if guests feel like a leisurely walk.
notes: Basic toiletries provided, Shampoo, Conditioner, Body Wash and hand wash. Fridge in room for personal use, Tea and coffee making facilities available at all times with ample breakfast provided in the kitchen.  Lockable bedroom and bathroom.
transit: Walking distance to the tram, which takes you to the city (approx 50 minutes) or a 5 minute walk to the bus stop which takes you to Box Hill station. Train approximately 25 minutes to the city from Box Hill.
access: Off street parking available and close to public transport.
interaction: I respect my guests' privacy but also like to make them feel at home if they feel like a chat or share a wine or a coffee with me.
house_rules: Coffee, tea provided in the room. No meals to be cooked in the bedroom as it has carpet on the floor and no exhaust fan.  Kitchen available but please put dishes in dishwasher and leave it as clean and tidy as you found it. I don't charge cleaning fees so can keep the room charge reasonable. I like guests to make themselves at home and treat my house as their own.
host_about: I am a very active person,  I love travelling, ballroom dancing, swimming and hiking. I enjoy sharing my home with people from all over the world and learning all about their countries and adventures. I have been hosting people, especially travellers, young and old, since 2000 and  love to have a chat over a glass of wine or a coffee. Since the accomodation I offer is quite self sufficient, guests can have as much or as little privacy as they wish.

name: Quiet modern home 1
summary: The room has built in robes, a double bed, a desk and chair that you can use to connect to super fast internet access free. Bathroom/toilet/laundry access is all at your fingertips.  The room is heated and has a fan overhead to keep you cool on hot days as well as a small bar fridge and freezer for you to store your own food etc
space: Our property is a little unique given that we have a completely edible garden, we have our own chickens, from which we get fresh eggs from each day and we love to cook and there's not much better than fresh eggs Our House is nearly 9 years old, it has 4 bedrooms, of which we have two for hire , there is a rumpus/games room, a large family meals and kitchen area that overlooks our organic edible garden.  We have a sustainable property that provides all of our vegetable and herb requirements all year round. We have two bathrooms and the house is very modern.

transit: About 200 metres from us there is a bus (number 181) that connects to the train system and easy to get in and out of the City if you want to, we think there is already enough to do and see here in Werribee,
access: The part of the house that has the two rooms is all for the guests the toilet, and bathroom is not shard the laundry is but there is only two permanent residents in the house so it is next to always available
interaction: You can as much or as little interaction with us as you like we are happy to join you or you with us at mealtime , have a chat or what ever you like, we will always make you feel welcome.
house_rules: We expect people use a common sense approach here regarding behavior whilst staying with us, we will not put up with loud argumentative people that like to yell and or fight with their partner we expect them to take that elsewhere.  We also expect people to respect our Home and surrounding garden and treat it is their own or as they would have someone treat their own home.  We are pretty relaxed regarding most things and are accommodating but don't like our kindness abused.
host_about: I am a middle aged Bloke that runs his own business teaching others how to live as self sufficiently as they by running workshops on a variety of topics, like edible gardening, fruit trees, raising chickens, Bee keeping, cheese making, Making salami’s and cured meats, preserving fruit and veg, etc.  I am also the president of a local heritage orchard at Werribee Park Mansion.  I love working with people, I am easy going and like helping people where I can.

space: Welcome to the Paris end of Collins Street! Located at the famous Paris end of Collins Street, this funky apartment has up to the minute interior design by artist Katharina Rapp.  Bold use of colour and texture and the exposure of polished concrete flooring makes this an exceptionally stylish place to stay in Melbourne.  Individual airconditioning and a balcony overlooking Collins St along with an outdoor heater make this a most comfortable experience whatever the weather conditions Melbourne dishes up. In terms of appliances, your stay is enhanced by large LCD TVs in lounge and bedroom, a Phillips soundbar theatre system in the lounge and dishwasher, front-loading washing machine and dry sensor clothes dryer.  The master bedroom has a Queen size bed and the 2nd bedroom has a Double bed. The lounge has a King Single sofa bed that has slept 2 but very comfortably fits a large adult. name: Mitford Street Elwood Lifestyle
summary: This apartment is stylish as well as functional and caters for both the business executive and today's modern family.
space: The furniture, beds, bedding and linen are of the highest quality. We provide free access to Netflix and high speed unlimited internet. The apartment comes with security parking and the building has a security entrance.  You will find yourself superbly located in the quiet, leafy and picturesque Mitford St and is a short walk to the St Kilda Botanical Gardens, the Elwood Marina and the Ormond Rd and Barkly and Acland St Cafe / shopping districts. The 96 tram, also a short walk away, will take you directly into the city via light rail.

The 96 tram, also a short walk away, will take you directly into the city via light rail. You will have exclusive access to the apartment. Our reservations and ground teams will be available from 9am until 10pm every day . Elwood is just 8 kilometres form the Melbourne CBD. The nearest trains are at Rippon Lea or Elsternwick stations, both on the Sandringham Line. You can access most areas of Melbourne via this line and its con
neighborhood_overview: Elwood is just 8 kilometres form the Melbourne CBD. The nearest trains are at Rippon Lea or Elsternwick stations, both on the Sandringham Line. You can access most areas of Melbourne via this line and its connections.  Trams on the 67 tram line reach the city. Also there are many bus services in this area, that travel to the city and beyond. Elwood’s greatest attraction are long stretches of beach where many go for windsurfing or just walking along the foreshore. The tree lined leafy streets of Elwood are also popular for cycling. The beaches have many paved tracks for walking, cycling or to simply take in the views. Further south from the highest point there are amazing views of the city across Elwood’s beaches and towards the marina at Brighton. Sails On The Bay is a great location on the foreshore with a menu to match. It is romantic and very well positioned. Dandelion Vietnamese Restaurant has good reviews and is just a block from the bay. All Things Italian – a historical Italian
notes: Please feel free to let us know if there is anything we can do during your stay to help.
transit: Getting around Elwood is easy. Transport options include train, tram, bus or bike. Research ‘Myki’, which is Melbourne's ticket to travel on the city's trains, trams and buses. Plan your trip with Public Transport Victoria's journey planner.
access: You will have exclusive access to the apartment.
interaction: Our reservations and ground teams will be available from 9am until 10pm every day .
house_rules: If you think you may be arriving after 9pm, please let us know in advance.

WiFi Internet is now available with unlimited data.

name: Luxury Penthouse Near StKilda & CBD
space: Welcome to this Luxury Penthouse in Middle Park between St Kilda & the CBD Here you will find the Best Views of Melbourne!! This penthouse offers a one bedroom getaway with double bed. It is contained in a large 3 bedroom apartment occupied by single owner. It has 2 bathrooms, 2 toilets and 4 balconies so there is plenty of privacy.  Walk across the quiet street with little traffic and you are in the Aquatic Centre swimming pools, gymnasium and golf driving range at Albert Park lake or take a short walk to the beach in the other direction. Have breakfast on the balcony with the parrots from the park then take a walk with the swans on the lake. All this and you are only minutes away from the CBD and St Kilda by tram. Included is wireless internet and foxtel TV on a giant 60" screen. The bedrooms have 42" TV's on the wall.  There is a secure undercover car park for 1 car. summary: Spacious, home with breakfast and foods . Beautiful garden , pool, barbecue,bicycles provided. 3 living areas with billiard table. Close to parks and gardens and large shopping centre . Close to  train to city 20 min.. and buses.

neighborhood_overview: The area is very beautiful with 2 parks within 100 metres of the house and generally the houses and gardens are very large and beautiful. Also the huge  Chadstone shopping centre  is within walking distance .
notes: Our house is in a very safe upper middle class area and the neighbours are very helpful. It is safe for anyone to walk home from the train station even at 1am in the morning. There are never any robberies.  I have a government working with children registration so you are safe with me. The house has a paid subscription with the local tennis courts and we provide the rackets and balls

access: You will have access to everything in the house and the gardens just as if it is your home. You have complete access to all of the house and kitchen equipment and everything inside it as though it is your own home and the outside gardens barbecues and sports facilities including bicycles table tennis swimming pool.
interaction: My partner and I we think are very social. Usually everyone eats together. We love helping guests  settling into Australia and planning their activities. As myself and partner live here then we are very easily able to help you and fulfil your requests. We have a full library of travel books atlas's brochures. Often we cook for each other and share meals, watch Netflix cable TV Dvds on our overhead projector in the billiard room with home theatre sound. We love talking to guests, particularly about their travels and do travel photo nights .Partner and I we think are very social. Usually everyone eats together at the same time. We love helping guests  settling into Australia and planning their activities
house_rules: Treat the house and other people the way you would like them to treat you and your house.
host_about: I like to surf and ski. I work as a computer technician. I love dogs. I like entertaining. I travel a lot and have been to nearly every Asian and Pacific Country and America.

name: Smart Artz Gallery - Venue Hire
space: Located in a stunning converted warehouse in South Melbourne, Smart Artz Gallery offers a unique and vibrant gallery space that showcases contemporary artworks from emerging and established Australian artists, as well as offering a venue that is refreshing and exciting to function organisers.  Whether it's a party, a seminar or a conference, we offer a range of space and seating options in a stylish ambience, surrounded by outstanding contemporary Australian art. Function organisers, can ensure their guests have a memorable time surrounded by exciting contemporary art, with top-quality catering and a versatile space that can be used for functions big and small. Venue hire includes all staff costs, equipment, magnificent Banquet table, crockery, cutlery, public liabilities insurances etc Smart Artz Gallery is perfect for Weddings, Cocktail Parties, Conferences, 21st Birthday (Website hidden by Airbnb) Engagements, Birthdays and Intimate Dinners!!! Meal and beverage packages are availabl

name: Oberon Stylish Art Deco
summary: This apartment has an elegant but comfortable, quality art house feel with air and light minutes from the most exciting and eclectic street in Melbourne, Acland St. Enjoy unusual decor, a mix of old-world and modern close to beach and botanical gardens.
space: This gorgeous apartment has a new Bosch dishwasher, Turkish leather couch, antique lacquered wardrobe, hand knotted Shiraz carpet, luxury linen and original art work. The apartment is a three minute walk from Acland St St Kilda which is the oldest, most popular area of Melbourne. Not only visitors from Interstate and Overseas visit Acland and Fitzroy Streets (nearby), but even Melburnians flock there on weekends. At either end of Acland St are trams to the city (20 minutes) and Balaclava (5 minutes) where there's another whole world of interesting shops. Acland St itself has the best restaurants and cake shops you'll find in Melbourne, from Blue Corn, the best home made Mexican food (hand made burritos, tacos and tortillas) you'll find in this half of the globe, to Leroys, the coffee connoisseur's choice, delicious Chinta Ria's Malaysian kitchen and Santa Anas Tapas Bar to die for. A three minute walk behind the apartment is the 100-year-old St Kilda Botanical Gardens with gazebos, a l

This gorgeous apartment has a new Bosch dishwasher, Turkish leather couch, antique lacquered wardrobe, hand knotted Shiraz carpet, luxury linen and original art work. notes: No parties are allowed. This is a residential block and neighbours complain. They have my phone number. Loud parties, drugs or smoking in the apartment will result in eviction without refund if guests do not redress such behaviour. Please note THE SECURITY DEPOSIT WILL BE KEPT IN IT'S ENTIRETY IF PARTYING OCCURS. I've had to do this after bad experiences of guests who, even after being phoned by airbnb, have refused to shut down an all night party. Only once in six years, but I had no leverage. Now, I want some.
house_rules: As mentioned elsewhere in this listing, parties are not allowed. No smoking on the premises or the block, only in the street. No drugs allowed on the premises. This includes smoking weed. If neighbours complain and guests do not redress such behaviour, eviction without refund will result.
host_about: Hi, I'm Barbara. I'm an Australian author and traveller. An experimenter and love being challenged by life.  I've most recently worked in a remote Aboriginal community but was previously a journalist. Gabriel Garcia Marquez is my favorite author. On my retirement agenda, is a month doing yoga in India, a month in Perguia  at a school improving my Italian and a month at a language immersion school in France to improve my French.

name: Stylish Fitzroy Apartment with Cool Brick Arches
summary: Experience the best of Fitzroy’s most stylish food, wine, and coffee spots from an architect-designed apartment on the edge of the city. The modern kitchen in spotted gum, painted brick walls, and quirky ornaments create a unique, contemporary look.
space: This beautiful Fitzroy studio apartment seeks guests who enjoy cafes, galleries, picturesque gardens and short walks to the centre of Melbourne.  Located in the fabulous Gertrude Street precinct, this elegantly renovated apartment is perfect for an individual or couple who are seeking to stay in a great location.  We generally host longer-term stays, which is why the nightly rate is much lower than similar apartments in the area. If you are seeing this listing for a short-term visit, congrats! You have found a small spot between bookings. :) The apartment includes free wifi, air-con, reverse cycle heating and ceiling fans. It has a full kitchen including microwave, oven, dishwasher and stovetop espresso machine. Enjoy city views from your comfortable queen sized bed, or tumble out to Gertrude, Brunswick, Smith Street or the CBD which are all at your doorstep.
description: Experience the best of Fitzroy’s most stylish food, wine, and coffee spots from an architect-designed apartment on the edge of the city. The modern kitchen in spotted gum, painted brick walls, and quirky ornaments create a unique, contemporary look.
neighborhood_overview: Fitzroy is Melbourne's hippest neighbourhood, and an easy walk to the centre of the city. It boasts cafes, nightlife, and fashion, record, and book stores. The apartment is a few hundred metres from the beautiful Fitzroy and Treasury Gardens.
transit: The apartment is an easy walk to the centre of town. There are many different trams that run from the CBD through Fitzroy, or walk 20 minutes to the subway.
interaction: The apartment is yours for the duration of your stay. I will be available via SMS or email, and can arrange to attend the premises if you have an urgent request.
house_rules: Our home is your home, as the saying goes, so please treat the apartment kindly and the universe will smile upon you. The apartment is recently renovated, so everything is in good working order. I will send more info once you confirm the booking, so you know where to find everything and can make the most of the facilities during your stay.
host_about: Based in Melbourne, we travel regularly. We really enjoy the win/win situation of renting our place out - someone gets a cute place to stay, and we cover some costs while we're away.

name: Fabulous house, fabulous ST KILDA
summary: Stay with a local host instead of a hotel.  You will share a WHOLE HOUSE, with your own private bedroom and fully equipped bathroom.  All  the modern conveniences are here. Friendly, knowledgeable host can provide sightseeing advice & local tips.
space: Welcome to Melbourne! Modern town house, your own private bedroom and bathroom, close to many restaurants, bars, cafes and tourist attractions.  It doesn't get much better than this in our lovely and elegant city!! You definitely won't need a car if you stay here.  Also close to Grand Prix circuit.  Vroom Vroom in March!! If you are a single traveller or a couple, this will be the perfect place to experience a short stay in Melbourne.  There are many things for tourists to do when they are staying in this area. You will be located 300 metres from the famous St Kilda beach, 400 meters from Albert Park ( Grand Prix circuit), 4 km from the centre of the city, (15 minutes by tram) Your BEDROOM: You can expect a quiet, comfortable bedroom with a Queen Size bed and all linen supplied.  You will enjoy bathroom of your own with nice thick bath towels, beach towels and a hairdryer also supplied for your convenience. The HOUSE:  You will share the rest of the house and all facilities with your f
description: Stay with a local host instead of a hotel.  You will share a WHOLE HOUSE, with your own private bedroom and fully equipped bathroom.  All  the modern conveniences are here. Friendly, knowledgeable host can provide sightseeing advice & local tips. Welcome to Melbourne! Modern town house, your own private bedroom and bathroom, close to many restaurants, bars, cafes and tourist attractions.  It doesn't get much better than this in our lovely and elegant city!! You definitely won't need a car if you stay here.  Also close to Grand Prix circuit.  Vroom Vroom in March!! If you are a single traveller or a couple, this will be the perfect place to experience a short stay in Melbourne.  There are many things for tourists to do when they are staying in this area. You will be located 300 metres from the famous St Kilda beach, 400 meters from Albert Park ( Grand Prix circuit), 4 km from the centre of the city, (15 minutes by tram) Your BEDROOM: You can expect a quiet, comfortable bedroom with a Qu
neighborhood_overview: My home is a peaceful oasis in a bustling and vibrant area. Close by is our famous St Kilda beach, Albert Park Lake, 4 km to central Melbourne (shopping and sightseeing, bars and restaurants) and 5 minutes walk from a busy bayside strip of shops and restaurants on your way to the pier and beach (for Kite surfing lessons, watching the penguins come in at dusk or swimming).    There is also a world class aquatic centre close by and excellent public transport, parks, hire bikes and supermarket within 400 metres. This area is the best in Melbourne and you will love your stay here.
notes: If you are allergic to cats, this isn't for you.  I have two beautiful, long haired cats and the house is vacuumed daily but.......
transit: There are three tram routes (96, 12 and 16) within 300 metres of the house, so getting around on public transport is easy and convenient.  A public transport card (MYKI card) costs $7 to buy initially, then only $7.30 for the daily fare.  If you are hiring a car, you will be given a parking permit for on street parking outside my home.
access: You will have access to the whole house including: living areas, kitchen, laundry, study, computer, WiFi, cable television, balcony overlooking garden, garden, your own room and own bathroom.  Only area out of limits is owner's bedroom.
interaction: Depending on other social and work commitments, it is nice to interact with guests and share a glass of wine or cup of tea.  I am well equipped with knowledge about my local area and sightseeing day trips and happy to provide ideas and advice to make your stay more enjoyable. I love meeting and hosting fellow travellers.
house_rules: NO SMOKING INSIDE NO ILLICIT DRUG USE Clear and Simple House Rules:  Ensure house is secure at all times.  This means locking up properly (including safety shutters) when you leave the house. Keep shared living areas tidy and as you find them No access to owner's bedroom suite area. Arrivals before 9 pm please. No guests other than those booked - this is a private residence. Prefer shoes off upstairs....  wooden floors can disturb people resting or sleeping downstairs. Smoking is not allowed inside the house but there is a covered balcony with table and chairs available for smoking outside. Be kind to the pets.
host_about:
I run a successful consulting firm which keeps me fairly busy during the day Monday to Friday but I still find time to travel overseas every year for at least one month.  I can easily host a single traveller or a travelling couple in my lovely house located in a magical area close to the beach, the park and the centre of our city of Melbourne.

The location is within 400 metres of the famous St Kilda Beach and just as close to the Albert Park Lake reserve where the Grand Prix is held in March each year.

I am in my early 50's, ride a motorbike for fun, love skiing in Europe and am accustomed to having friends and guests stay over and am happy to provide you with ideas for your Melbourne stay over.  

The only reason I occasionally host guests from airbnb is because it provides an opportunity to meet interesting people from around the world.  Therefore, I will look at your profile, to see how you have described yourself and any partner you might be travelling with, to make my decision.  Airbnb stays are very different from staying in a hotel.............. and you need to understand this as a prospective guest.

My experiences with airbnb have been fantastic and I have met people I will know for the rest of my life.  Interesting, happy, engaging, respectful and cat friendly people who have understood how to share the house and amenities.

If you have received a request from me to rent your house, please realise that as a host myself, I will look after your house as if it is my own.

name: Fitzroy Terrace close to Gertrude S
summary: This 1860 Terrace,  has been sympathetically renovated to retain it's period charm. Modern bathrooms, a country style kitchen, separate living and dining rooms, this  property  will  meet the expectations of people seeking something special
space: An 1860 Terrace sympathetically renovated to retain it's period charm. Fitted with modern bathrooms, a country style kitchen, separate living and dining rooms, this is a property that will  meet the expectations of people looking for an upmarket experience of Melbourne in a friendly 'at home' environment. You will have full access to all the facilities in the house. This is my private home, and although I am generally able to vacate when people want to take both rooms, there are times when I may need to stay in my studio at the rear of the courtyard. In these instances I will need to share the kitchen with you, which has not proved to be an issue for previous guests. If you are specifically looking for a property where the host is not present, please enquire as to whether I can accommodate your requirements.  There are two bedrooms available on the second story. One large room with Queen Bed and heaps of wardrobe space and a smaller room fitted with two single beds and cupboard storage
description: This 1860 Terrace,  has been sympathetically renovated to retain it's period charm. If you are specifically looking for a property where the host is not present, pleas
neighborhood_overview: Cafes, restaurants, shopping,wonderful architecture, parks and of course the 'locals'. Proximity to CBD, MCG, Museum and numerous galleries.
transit: Fantastic tram system a 2 minute walk from my front door. Star Shuttle bus departs from a local hotel directly to and from airport.
access: Entire house on basis described above.
interaction: As guests require or wish.
house_rules: Food not permitted in bedrooms and I'd prefer any little ones to eat and drink only in the kitchen/dining areas. I have grandchildren and am conscious of the extra cleaning they can necessitate. Energy consciousness greatly appreciated.
host_about:
Hi - Welcome to my house. 

I've been a leading business person and conduct my advisory service to both the not for profit and private sectors from my home office/studio apartment.

Being a mother of two grown daughters and grandmother to four, I'm very child friendly. I'm a relatively seasoned traveler  and understand the needs of those seeking the unusual but also wanting something special, accommodation beyond the impersonal experience of hotels. You will find your stay warm, friendly and memorable.

name: Look out over the CBD from a Boutique Flat
summary: Soak up the natural light from the beautiful steel arched windows of this apartment located at the top of the historic Majorca Building. Set in the heart of the cafe precinct, the flat is bright, spacious, and has a fully equipped kitchen.
space: A minutes walk to Flinders Street Station, Federation Square, Tram to St. Kilda Beach, Arts Centre, National Gallery, Collins Street fashion houses and the Yarra River. Boasting arched windows this well appointed, spacious apartment with jarrah floors and high ceilings overlooks Degraves Street and Flinders Lane. A Juliet balcony adjoins the bedroom with ensuite. The kitchen is fully equipped with cooking utensils and a dishwasher. An entrance hallway leads to an open plan kitchen, dining and living area. Includes separate laundry with both washer and dryer. The apartment is an ideal place to stay to enjoy the activities available during the International Comedy Festival, Melbourne Arts Festival, Summer Music Festival, Midsummer Festival, Formula One Grand Prix, Moomba, Australian Open, Royal Melbourne Show, Spring Racing Carnival and of course the AFL Grand Final.
description: Soak up the natural light from the beautiful steel arched windows of this apartment located at the top of the historic Majorca Building. Set in the heart of the cafe precinct, the flat is bright, spacious, and has a fully equipped kitchen.
neighborhood_overview: There is always a great buzz around the area with coffee houses and fashion boutiques literally on the doorstep. Centre Place, where the entrance to the Majorca Building is located, is probably the most happening laneway in Melbourne.
transit: Leave the car at home........walk, tram,train or bike anywhere you want to go. If you need your car there are commercial carparks close by in Flinders Lane.
access: Linen, towels, hairdryer and ironing facilities supplied.
interaction: We will meet you at the apartment and show you all you need to know for a great stay.
house_rules: NOT AVAILABLE FOR - PARTIES  - GATHERINGS  - FUNCTIONS  - PHOTO SHOOTS  - COMMERCIAL USE  - TRAINING  - SEMINARS NO CHECK INS ON CHRISTMAS OR BOXING DAYS NO SMOKING This is a home, not a party house; Treat it as your own;  Respect your neighbours;  Leave it as you find it. Replacement fee payable for lost or damaged keys. name: Executive Elwood Apartment
summary: This modern and superbly located apartment is stylish as well as functional and caters for both the business executive and today's modern family.
space: The furniture, beds, bedding and linen are of the highest quality. We provide free access to Netflix and high speed unlimited internet. The apartment comes with security parking and the building has a security entrance.  It is superbly located right on the Ormond Rd café and shopping strip and short walk to Elwood beach. The people of Elwood have a style of their own, we think. Spend some time in this cosy little corner and let us know if you agree.
description: This modern and superbly located apartment is stylish as well as functional and caters for both the business executive and today's modern family. The people of Elwood have a style of their own, we think. Spend some time in this cosy little corner and let us know if you agree. You will have exclusive access to the apartment. Our reservations and ground teams will be available from 9am until 10pm every day . Elwood is just 8 kilometres form the Melbourne CBD. The nearest trains are at Rippon Lea or Elsternwick stations, both on the Sandringham Line. You can access most areas of Melbourne via this line and its connections. Trams on the 67 tram line reach the city. Also th
neighborhood_overview: Elwood is just 8 kilometres form the Melbourne CBD. The nearest trains are at Rippon Lea or Elsternwick stations, both on the Sandringham Line. You can access most areas of Melbourne via this line and its connections. Trams on the 67 tram line reach the city. Also there are many bus services in this area, that travel to the city and beyond. Elwood’s greatest attraction are long stretches of beach where many go for windsurfing or just walking along the foreshore. The tree lined leafy streets of Elwood are also popular for cycling. The beaches have many paved tracks for walking, cycling or to simply take in the views. Further south from the highest point there are amazing views of the city across Elwood’s beaches and towards the marina at Brighton. Sails On The Bay is a great location on the foreshore with a menu to match. It is romantic and very well positioned. Dandelion Vietnamese Restaurant has good reviews and is just a block from the bay. All Things Italian – a historical Italian l
notes: Please feel free to let us know if there is anything we can do during your stay to help.
transit: Getting around Elwood is easy. Transport options include train, tram, bus or bike. Research ‘Myki’, which is Melbourne's ticket to travel on the city's trains, trams and buses. Plan your trip with Public Transport Victoria's journey planner.
access: You will have exclusive access to the apartment.
interaction: Our reservations and ground teams will be available from 9am until 10pm every day .
house_rules: If you think you may be arriving after 9pm, please let us know in advance.
host_about: Conscientious and hard working

name: Bright & spacious home stay
space: The apartment is in an iconic 1960s building. It is bright, spacious, peaceful and comfortable. The building has a garden, a separate laundromat & multiple entrances all with security locked doors.
description: The apartment is in an iconic 1960s building. It is bright, spacious, peaceful and comfortable. The building has a garden, a separate laundromat & multiple entrances all with security locked doors. The guest room is bright and well-furnished. I have everything you would need for day to day use, including a european laundry and home office area. Wireless internet, linen and towels are included as well as the use of my second bike. There's kitchen cupboard space for guests who want to do some of their own cooking. I have local guide booklets and magazines. I like to know what is happening around town so i am happy to help you in planning your time in Melbourne. I also use a lot of public transport, so I am happy to answer any questions regarding getting around. East St Kilda is a cultured and eclectic area. Near by you will find beautiful parks, great cafes, shops, restaurants, bars and galleries. We are close to the beach and the city centre, which is only 6km/15 mins with very near by
neighborhood_overview: East St Kilda is a cultured and eclectic area. Near by you will find beautiful parks, great cafes, shops, restaurants, bars and galleries. We are close to the beach and the city centre, which is only 6km/15 mins with very near by bus, tram or train.  St Kilda and Windsor are a short walk from here. That's where you'll find more galleries, cafes, artists haunts, markets, cinemas, the beach, beautiful gardens, places to do yoga and more!
notes: Short and or long term stay is available. Feel free to ask me for any more information you may need. And please note, I have an indoor cat.
access: The guest room is bright and well-furnished. I have everything you would need for day to day use, including a european laundry and home office area. Wireless internet, linen and towels are included as well as the use of my second bike. There's kitchen cupboard space for guests who want to do some of their own cooking.
interaction: I have local guide booklets and magazines. I like to know what is happening around town so i am happy to help you in planning your time in Melbourne. I also use a lot of public transport, so I am happy to answer any questions regarding getting around.
house_rules: I hope you will be comfortable in yourself and treat the apartment as if it were your own home.  I am happy to share my things as needed, i only ask you return them the way you found them.  Please make sure the heating/cooling system is turned off before you leave the apartment. Please respect my neighbours.  For security reasons, i may ask to see your ID before you stay.
host_about: Hi and welcome to Melbourne. I have met some wonderful people using airbnb on my travels, which i hope to continue doing.

name: Spacious modern studio
summary: A private studio at the bottom of a 3 level house. It has double bed, adjoining sitting room, toilet and pantry. It has direct access to two courtyards that gets lots of sunlight. Visitors love the private entrance and nearby public transport.
space: Features: - large bedroom with double bed  - lots of space to keep your belongings including a cupboard and dresser, - adjoining sitting room with a sofa and coffee table, - studio opens into 2 courtyards so it is light and airy. - Total privacy : own private courtyard entrance  access. - a big bathroom upstairs, - DVD player, and - WiFi.
description: A private studio at the bottom of a 3 level house. It has double bed, adjoining sitting room, toilet and pantry. It has direct access to two courtyards that gets lots of sunlight. Visitors love the private entrance and nearby public transport. Features: - large bedroom with double bed  - lots of space to keep your belongings including a cupboard and dresser, - adjoining sitting room with a sofa and coffee table, - studio opens into 2 courtyards so it is light and airy. - Total privacy : own private courtyard entrance  access. - a big bathroom upstairs, - DVD player, and - WiFi. In the pantry there is: - a small fridge,  - a microwave, - a tea/coffee making facilities, and - a toaster. We will be present during your stay but the studio occupies the entire  basement level and you do not have to go through the house whenever you come in or go out. As such, feel free to interact with us as little or as much as you like. Our house is located  in Hawthorn (an inner city suburb) in a quiet st
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located  in Hawthorn (an inner city suburb) in a quiet street next to a lovely park. It is in a very convenient location near shops, restaurants and cafes.
notes: - There is cleaner that comes once a fortnight (included in price). - heating. - Please note: we have a small/medium size dog living with us. Very gentle and friendly. Does not bite. * 1 guest per booking only (no visitor(s) staying overnight please). * Minimum booking is for 1 week. * CANCELLATION: please refer to policy DOES NOT include: * No Kitchen. No cooking. * No clothes washing facilities but a laundry service is provided at a cost of AUD$10 per large load. Laundry service takes 2-3 days.
transit: Getting around Melbourne is a breeze with the city being only 20-30 minutes away by train. There is a a tram stop right on the street (1 min walk to tram stop) and walking distance (7 min walk) to Kooyong train station. Street parking is also available.
access: In the pantry there is: - a small fridge,  - a microwave, - a tea/coffee making facilities, and - a toaster.
interaction: We will be present during your stay but the studio occupies the entire  basement level and you do not have to go through the house whenever you come in or go out. As such, feel free to interact with us as little or as much as you like.
house_rules: *No smoking. *There are no cooking facilities . *Guests are expected to keep the room clean and tidy. *One guest per booking only. *Please be mindful of your data usage when using the WiFi.
host_about: I am easy-going, friendly and fun. I enjoy meeting new people and learning about different cultures. I am a lawyer but in my down-time I like to travel, read and eat great food.

name: Convenient Location
summary: Our furnished house in Ashburton is rented by the room providing accommodation for both long and short term stays for the last nine years. We live on site in a separate residence and are always available to help with any problems or just for a chat.
space: The single bungalow bedroom currently available is lockable and has a single bed, desk, chair, wardrobe and private bathroom. The house is fully furnished, centrally heated and situated in a lovely, quiet and safe location, close to the Ashburton train station, shops, parks, bicycle tracks and only 30 minutes from Melbourne city by train, or 15 minutes by car. Parking is available. Rent covers all bills and includes unlimited NBN internet access.
description: Our furnished house in Ashburton is rented by the room providing accommodation for both long and short term stays for the last nine years. We live on site in a separate residence and are always available to help with any problems or just for a chat. The single bungalow bedroom currently available is lockable and has a single bed, desk, chair, wardrobe and private bathroom. The house is fully furnished, centrally heated and situated in a lovely, quiet and safe location, close to the Ashburton train station, shops, parks, bicycle tracks and only 30 minutes from Melbourne city by train, or 15 minutes by car. Parking is available. Rent covers all bills and includes unlimited NBN internet access. Lounge/dining area, kitchen, laundry, bathroom and front and rear garden area. Having lived in Melbourne all our lives we know a lot about the city and enjoy nothing more than being able to share our knowledge. We are happy to have coffee and a chat with our guests although do not usually share mea
neighborhood_overview: Our local parks and gardens provide lovely walks and often the opportunity to see native wildlife. Combine this with the close proximity to shops, public transport, bicycle tracks and even a freeway on ramp, and you have a peaceful yet convenient place to live.
notes: The house is professionally cleaned on a weekly basis and we provide a safe, covered bicycle storage area and off street parking for 2 cars plus free unlimited on street parking.
transit: We are a 2 minute walk from a train station and also close to bus and tram stops plus a bicycle track which goes all the way to the city center. The shops and restaurants are also a 2 minute walk from the house.
access: Lounge/dining area, kitchen, laundry, bathroom and front and rear garden area.
interaction: Having lived in Melbourne all our lives we know a lot about the city and enjoy nothing more than being able to share our knowledge. We are happy to have coffee and a chat with our guests although do not usually share meals, except for the odd barbecue when the weather is nice. Also we are happy to give our guests privacy if that is what they prefer.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES • No smoking anywhere on the property • No cooking in the bedrooms • Personal heaters are not permitted • Bedrooms & bungalow bathrooms must be kept clean and bed linen changed regularly • Heaters in the bungalows are to be turned off before leaving the house • Never drape clothes over the heaters in the bungalows – this is a fire hazard SHARED AREAS OF THE HOUSE • Deep frying is not permitted • When using the stove do not leave pots unattended • The fridge is available for shared use and it is a good idea to place your items in a container marked with your name • There is a labelled cupboard in the kitchen & a draw in the freezer for each room • Please leave shared areas of the house clean and neat after use • Please turn off all lights and any electrical equipment you have been using, before going to bed • For security reasons please ensure all windows and doors are locked before leaving the house • Please empty rubbish bins before they are full • Please be considerate of
host_about: I have lived in Melbourne all my life and enjoy gardening, sewing and cooking.

name: Simple but clean and secure room in Carlton!
space: Medley Hall is a residential college of The University of Melbourne.  What this means is that during the University academic year, our rooms are occupied by students.  In the break times (Dec to mid Feb) our rooms are vacant and from $80 per night can live in one of these rooms and located perfectly and accessible by foot to all of Melbourne's favorite spots. Just around one corner is the bistro life of Carlton and The Melbourne Museum and the the University of Melbourne, and around the other are the Exhibition Gardens, the Central Business District, Chinatown, theatres and night life etc. The recent renovations and major building works at Medley Hall includes a lift to help shift between the fully renovated three levels of bedrooms (some doubles), a tv lounge room adjoined to a fully functional kitchen allowing you to cook your own food if you wish, and a modern and beautiful three story high glass atrium. The atrium ties the new with the old, a magnificent Victorian Italianate buildi
description: Medley Hall is a residential college of The University of Melbourne.  What this means is that during the University academic year, our rooms are occupied by students.  In the break times (Dec to mid Feb) our rooms are vacant and from $80 per night can live in one of these rooms and located perfectly and accessible by foot to all of Melbourne's favorite spots. Just around one corner is the bistro life of Carlton and The Melbourne Museum and the the University of Melbourne, and around the other are the Exhibition Gardens, the Central Business District, Chinatown, theatres and night life etc. The recent renovations and major building works at Medley Hall includes a lift to help shift between the fully renovated three levels of bedrooms (some doubles), a tv lounge room adjoined to a fully functional kitchen allowing you to cook your own food if you wish, and a modern and beautiful three story high glass atrium. The atrium ties the new with the old, a magnificent Victorian Italianate buildi
neighborhood_overview: It's a quiet neighbourhood even though we are a block away from the CBD.  It is safe, but like any city in the world, precaution is advised very late at night.
notes: This is not a hostel more like a hotel but without so many frills.  The room you occupy will be clean with clean linen and towels.  There is no airconditioning in the rooms but there is heating.  The bathrooms are cleaned daily but cannot guarantee the state of these after other guest's use.  We try to maintain the place so our guest feel like this is a home away from home.
transit: Transportation is located a short walk away.  You will find trams and trains and buses that will take you all over Melbourne.
access: Access to all areas unless otherwise notified.  Sometimes we have wedding ceremonies in the mansion part of the buildings.  Guests will be notified if this is the case.
interaction: Medley Hall office is open Mon to Fri 9.30am to 6pm.  After this time we have staff who live on the premises and can be contacted for any emergencies or issues like lock outs or for advice.
house_rules: 18 single rooms per floor.   Each floor has 5 bathrooms (one of which is wheelchair accessible) Each floor has a kitchenette with microwave, kettle, toaster, fridge and dishwasher, Coin operated washing machines and dryers. No smoking on the immediate parameters of the premises or inside. Check in available from 10am Check out at 10am TV lounge and kitchen with complete cooking facilities available.   Tennis table available. All rooms are single bedrooms. Rooms available from Dec to Feb and July only. In the interests of safety, all bedroom and all outside doors must be kept locked.  Medley Hall takes all care but no responsibility for personal possessions. Departure time is 10.00am but arrangements may be made to store your luggage until later in the day.
host_about: This is a residential student college.  We have 55 rooms available to be rented out to guests during the mid year break and the end of year when the students depart.  We are located a short stroll away from the city and the bustling cafe life of famous Lygon Street.  The rate of accommodation is for a single room, equipped with bedding and towel.  There are 5 showers/toilets on each floor and a kitchenette too.  It is clean, fresh and modern simple accommodation surrounded by a beautiful mansion which is heritage listed and close to everything important to visitors to Melbourne.  Happy to provide you with more information.  Just email me.

notes: Accommodates up to 4 people, with extra mattress in the room. Occasionally, bookings up to 5 guests can be considered - apartment is equipped with double sofa bed in living room, only used if booking is made for 5 or more people. *!Please contact me before booking for more than 2 people. For availability and rates, click on the calendar. Don't hesitate to contact me for any queries! :) If you are looking for the most incredible room in terms of both location and quality, THIS IS IT!

Next to Melbourne Central Station, China Town & QV (Woolworths, BigW, groceries and restaurants). 5 minutes to Flinders Station, Queen Victoria Market, Fed Square, The University of Melbourne and RMIT University...etc. It can't get more convenient in Melbourne! SURPRISE! Ready to book? Extra discount if you sign up as a new Airbnb user, ask me for more details. :)
access: Free Gym, Pool and Sauna access on the 26th floor. Free Skybus shuttle to apartment from Southern Cross Station. Wanna chill-lax after a day of traveling? Help yourself at the pantry for coffee and tea. :) Free streaming of movies, TV shows and Live Channels from over the world on 51" FULL HD TV! With BOSE® Home Theatre! :) Want some games? We have PS3 as add-on entertainment. What more can you ask for?
interaction: My partner and I work full time and have a busy schedule, so the apartment is yours most of the time. I am more than happy to recommend places/restaurants and show you around Melbourne! :)
house_rules: PLEASE TAKE OFF your shoes before stepping onto carpeted area in the apartment. NO SMOKING - in the building and apartment. NO EXCESSIVE DRINKING - including BUILDING AREA and APARTMENT.  NO NOISE after 11pm.  No illegal activities. Sleep only in your room, and NOT on the sofabed unless requested and approved.  Keeping the apartment clean and tidy is also basic. Extra Cleaning Fee will be charged if apartment is left unreasonably dirty and untidy.
host_about:
Hi, I am Vivian and welcome to Melbourne!

I am an easy going person and I love meeting people from all over the world, I also love traveling so we can share our traveling experiences. I am out most of the time but I am more than happy to recommend places/restaurants and show you around Melbourne when I am around or via text/phone. :)

Please click into my listing for further details regarding my apartment:
Incredible Location and Quality in ABSOLUTE HEART of Melbourne CBD

I look forward to hosting you during your stay in Melbourne. Hope you love the apartment as much as I do and have an amazing Airbnb experience! :)

name: Right in the heart of the City!
space: Quiet, 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment with amazing 12th floor views, right in the heart of downtown Melbourne. In building parking, Gym, Sauna, Pool and access to an indoor/outdoor entertaining area. Opposite Melbourne's iconic Southern Cross station, Etihad Stadium, a tram stop and taxi rank, this place really is ideal for the traveler looking to be 'right where the action is'. Those coming straight from the airport can simply jump on the Melbourne Airport Skybus service (about $15AUD) - the bus stops directly in front of the apartment building! Walking distance from Melbourne's Crown Casino, Southbank,  award-winning restaurants, bars and clubs. If shopping is more your thing, this apartment sits opposite a D.F.O (Direct Factory Outlet) and is a ten minute walk from Bourke Street mall, Melbourne Central Shopping District and many boutique fashion stores.  There is even a push bike rental station within a 1 minute walk of the building, for those who live a more active lifestyle!

name: Edna Walling Cottage (Heritage)
space: Set on 3 acres, this 1936 cottage was originally built as a full-sized dolls' house and is located amidst Edna Walling's "greatest achievement," Mawarra, described by Edna herself as "a symphony in steps and beautiful trees." Edna Walling Cottage is a boutique bed and breakfast with accommodation for a 2 adults. The cottage features a lounge, TV, and kitchen, along with a bathroom and upstairs Queen-sized bedroom. There are also laundry and washing facilities available for your convenience The cottage is found through security gates, down the driveway to Mawarra at the Grove. Cottage parking is just past the gates. It is also close to a selection of restaurants and cafes and is metres from Sherbrooke Forest. Wineries and berry farms are also nearby.  Whether you are coming to the Dandenong Ranges for a night or a week, you will receive a warm welcome at Edna Walling Cottage, the perfect spot for a break from the hassles of city life. Pets are welcome to the grounds but must sleep outsi
description: Set on 3 acres, this 1936 cottage was originally built as a full-sized dolls' house and is located amidst Edna Walling's "greatest achievement," Mawarra, described by Edna herself as "a symphony in steps and beautiful trees." Edna Walling Cottage is a boutique bed and breakfast with accommodation for a 2 adults. The cottage features a lounge, TV, and kitchen, along with a bathroom and upstairs Queen-sized bedroom. There are also laundry and washing facilities available for your convenience The cottage is found through security gates, down the driveway to Mawarra at the Grove. Cottage parking is just past the gates. It is also close to a selection of restaurants and cafes and is metres from Sherbrooke Forest. Wineries and berry farms are also nearby.  Whether you are coming to the Dandenong Ranges for a night or a week, you will receive a warm welcome at Edna Walling Cottage, the perfect spot for a break from the hassles of city life. Pets are welcome to the grounds but must sleep outsi
house_rules: Please leave the house and grounds in the same condition as you found them.
host_about: Welcome to Melbourne! We are Melburnians who can give you lots of free advice on sport, theatre, music venues and even who to vote for.

name: Stylish South Yarra Apartment
summary: Bring a beverage onto the cozy, sunny balcony and enjoy views across an upscale neighbourhood. Return from shopping to an ultramodern space with soothingly neutral decor, punctuated by black-and-white photography and warm, wide-plank wooden floors.
space: This one bedroom apartment is situated in South Yarra on the corner of Toorak Rd and Cunningham St. It features a spacious open planned living and dining area, bedroom with a queen size bed, large balcony, european laundry with washer/dryer along with a modern fully equipped kitchen fitted with a dishwasher, gas stovetop, Miele oven and stone bench. The spacious open planned living area offers all you will need for in-house entertainment with a Smart TV offering access to Netflix and youtube along with unlimited wifi. Located in the heart of South Yarra, this apartment is just minutes walk away from almost everything. - Tram Stop (1 minute walk) - South Yarra train station (5 minute walk)  - CBD (7 minutes by train)  - CBD (15 minutes by car) - Supermarket (5 minute walk) - Chapel St (1 minute walk) Secure car park is available for an extra $15 per night.
description: Bring a beverage onto the cozy, sunny balcony and enjoy views across an upscale neighbourhood. Return from shopping to an ultramodern space with soothingly neutral decor, punctuated by black-and-white photography and warm, wide-plank wooden floors.
neighborhood_overview: In the heart of ritzy South Yarra, the apartment is close to the well-known shopping and restaurant hub of Chapel Street, as well as several parks with running tracks, football ovals, and tennis courts. There is easy access to trams and trains.
notes: While we will try our best to accommodate early check-in and late check-out's, we cannot guarantee your requests. Please inquire before booking. In the case we can't accommodate your preferred times our standard times are below: Checkin: Anytime after 1pm Checkout: Anytime before 11am Please Note: If we are not able to accommodate your early or late check in/out request there are luggage lockers at Southern Cross Station that can store your belongings for 24 hours. Want to see more? We are on Instagram as @luxuria.property.group
transit: Leave the car at home........walk, tram, train or bike anywhere you want to go. This apartment is in prime location for public transportation. It is 1 block from the South Yarra Train Station and the closet tram stop is just 1 minutes walk from our buildings entrance. Both modes of transport are a quick ride to Melbourne CBD. In Melbourne, we use the Myki card on all forms of public transport. We provide these in the apartment for you. If used please ensure they are put back, otherwise a $10 replacement fee will be charged. If you require a car, we offer a secure carpark for an extra $15 per night.
access: As a guest you will have access to the entire apartment with linen, towels, hairdryer, ironing facilities, washing machine and dryer all included. Bathroom amenities provided include Shampoo, Conditioner, Body Wash and Toothpaste. Kitchen cooking essentials provided include Milk, Tea, Coffee, Sugar, Oil and Salt & Pepper.
interaction: We are available 24 hours, 7 days for anything you need!
house_rules: We expect all guests to respect our property as if it was your own. - No Partying: There is NO partying allowed at any time. Eviction and fees will apply to any parties during your stay.  - No Smoking: Smoking is never permitted inside the home or in any part of the building. Fines will apply if there are odours remaining. - No drinks or food in the bedroom - No Illegal Internet downloading  Please ensure the apartment is left clean and tidy. Dishes are to be cleaned and rubbish disposed. If you plan to cook, please be aware that the fire alarm is rather sensitive, so please be sure to open the balcony door and switch on the range hood while cooking. DO NOT open the door to the hallway as this could set off the entire buildings fire alarm. Noise must be at a reasonable level during your entire stay. Please make sure that you respect the neighbours as this is a home and not a hotel room.  Please be mindful that $200 (Per set) will be charged for any lost keys during your stay. TRAVELLIN
host_about:
Welcome to Luxuria Property Group! 

Luxuria Property Group provides designer short-term accommodation around Melbourne.

All Luxuria properties are fully equipped with 5-star linens, towels, toiletries, complimentary Wi-Fi and all the essential items that you will require during your stay.

Live like a local in a little bit of luxury with the help of a Local Information Book, unique to each property to provide you with the insiders guide to the best local haunts for great coffee, food, wine, shopping and activities.

We want to help make your next trip perfect, if there is anything we can do to help please don't hesitate to contact us!

name: Fitzroy - Queen room in great house
space: An 1860 Terrace, Chunky House has been sympathetically renovated to retain it's period charm. Fitted with modern bathrooms, a country style kitchen, separate living and dining rooms, this is a property that will  meet the expectations of people looking for an upmarket experience of Melbourne in a friendly 'at home' environment.  Large private bedroom for one or two guests. Queen Bed and heaps of wardrobe space. Private bathroom, downstairs lounge area, kitchen and courtyard. Room is fitted with locks should there be other guests in the house. The kitchen is fully available to share with me, however with so many great cafes around you'll probably decide to go out for most meals. One car parking permit is also available but not guaranteed as I have another room available. Please enquire on booking. ($50 refundable deposit applies) Fitzroy is Melbourne’s equivalent of Soho in London and New York, the Left Bank in Paris or Greenwich Village. Here you will find a profusion of restaurants of

house_rules: All good common sense really. No eating in bedroom, you're welcome to browse my books but please don't go away with any without discussion. Please provide profiles and ID details for me before booking confirmation.
host_about:
Hi - Welcome to my house. 

I've been a leading business person and conduct my advisory service to both the not for profit and private sectors from my home office/studio apartment.

Being a mother of two grown daughters and grandmother to four, I'm very child friendly. I'm a relatively seasoned traveler  and understand the needs of those seeking the unusual but also wanting something special, accommodation beyond the impersonal experience of hotels. You will find your stay warm, friendly and memorable.

name: Fitzroy Terrace - Room for one or two guests
summary: Room with two single beds in the liveliest part of Fitzroy - close to the shopping, cafes, bars and nightlife of Gertrude and Smith streets.
space: Partners Ollie and Simon live in the house. We both work a lot and have active social lives, but we are always nearby should we be needed for any reason. We love Melbourne and we particularly love Fitzroy. We are very knowledgable on the area, and Melbourne city in general should you need any recommendations. transit: Very close to the 86 Tram, a short walk to the 96 Tram. Both trams will take you into the city (10 mins) - the 96 can take you all the way to St Kilda.
