name: Picture Perfect Oasis Richmond
space: This gorgeous one bedroom apartment, with entertaining courtyard would ideally suit a couple, or individual.   3kms from Melbourne city it is set in lovely private and secure grounds. The open plan apartment has a very realxed feel, with lots of natural light streaming in from the large floor to ceiling windows, opening up to a leafy private courtyard.  The living area is comfortable and relaxing- features flat screen TV, T-box, DVD & Ipod dock. The modern kitchen has all amneties- electric stove top, oven, Bosch dishwasher and lots of bench space if you enjoy cooking. The dining space comfortably seats four.  The bedroom features a queen sized bed, with telephone in room for local calls, large windows facing courtyard and generous wardrobe space.  Equipped with a secure under cover car space,  internet, spacious bathroom and european laundry. This Richmond oasis is just a  stone's throw from Bridge Road shopping and dining precinct and Church St.  At the end of the street you have acc

host_about:
I live in Elwood, Melbourne Australia. I am a Counsellor and have my own wellbeing business. 

I love travelling- and I really enjoy finding my own way around a new place. Often by walking around a new city, I discover the best hidden places- off the main tourist track. My favourite places, so far are: Southern France (Aix en Provence/Avignon/Montpellier/Antibes).. Italy, Spain and Asia. My apartment is a top floor private two bedroom oasis, that has everything one could desire. Set in a small block with only two other apartments in the building, it is top floor with view of rooftops (very parisian) & treetops.  With a cute little balcony, it is perfect for relaxing with a chilled drink after a relaxing day beachside. An under cover car space, within close proximity to the main entrance into the block. Wifi internet, laundry with washing machine & dryer, comfortable living area and fabulous, all amneties kitchen- it really is ideal. A stone's throw from stunning Elwood beach and a two min walk to the gorgeous Elwood village. 

I would welcome you to stay in my abode, and am quite sure you will have a wonderful experience of Melbourne, whilst having the comforts of this apartment to come home to at the end of a day.

name: 2 Bedroom Apartment MT267
summary: Spacious 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom apartment in Southbank high rise complex.  Fully equipped with kitchen, laundry and entertainment systems. The building has gym, pool and tennis court. Concierge service from 6am to 10pm and 24 hour security guard.
space: The Apartment Fully serviced 2 bedroom apartment within Melbourne Tower Complex in the heart of Melbourne. Right across from the Crown Casino, 5 minutes walk to Flinder St station, Business District, Victoria Arts Centre. The apartment is located on the 26th floor with a nice city view to the north side. Master bedroom is furnished with a queen size bed. The other room is furnished with 1 king bed or 2 single beds. The living room also has a foldout couch that sleeps 2 additional people. The living room is furnished with leather couch, flat screen tv and iPod docking station. Fully equipped kitchen complete with stainless steel fridge, dishwasher and all the utensils you need to cook up a feast. Complex Facilites The complex has a heated pool and gym located on the 6th floor (opening hours are 6am to 10pm) and tennis court (day light only).  The building also has its own concierge desk which is attended from 6am to 10pm.  The concierge desk has weather report, direct telephone diallyin

house_rules: No parties in the apartment! Toilet paper, linen, towels, shampoo, hair conditioner ans soap are all supplied The building policy prohibits clothes horses on the balcony, so please keep the clothes rack inside the apartment. Absolutely no smoking in the apartment, smoking is permitted on the balconies only. Prior to check out, please kindly dispose normal rubbish down the rubbish chute located to the right of the elevators on each floor. Recycled rubbish bins are located next to the car park entrance on the ground floor. Please also clean the dishes, pots and cooking utensils either using the dishwasher or the detergent provided. If you have unpacked any extra bedding, please place them back. Upon check out, please return both sets of keys to the concierge in the envelope provided.   Loss of the set of keys with the car park remote will incur a replacement charge of $300 and the other set will incur a charge of $100
host_about: I am a melbourne girl with a finance professional background.  Due to passion for travelling, meeting  new people and property, i have, over the last few years, managed to combine my hobbies into owning a guesthouse and a number of apartments in and near the Melbourne city. I hope I can cater all types of groups with the range of accommodation options I offer. I also love the opportunity to show all my guests what a wonderful city Melbourne is. As an airbnb guest, I will look after your place like its my own.

name: QS bed & PRIVATE bathroom, Gr8 WiFi, TV & Netflix
summary: Great WiFi. Modern & very clean bedroom (Wall mounted 40" Sony LCD TV with active Netflix via AppleTV), dedicated guest bathroom in the heart of Port Melbourne offering an array of shopping, relaxation and dining experiences, within 200m of the beachfront & 600m walk to the 109 tram (Stop 129) at StationPier (Spirit of Tasmania access point). Price breaks at 7 nights & again at 28 nights  : )
space: North facing bedroom on the top floor in a modern (Building completed July 2013) two bedroom apartment in Port Melbourne. Located one block back from the popular & beautiful Port Melbourne beach, your bedroom opens directly onto the balcony & faces North offering glimpses of the city & Docklands skylines. You will enjoy a luxurious dedicated guest bathroom & shower (Contains infrequently used but SHARED Euro laundry). The apartment is very well furnished.  Access to the front loader washing machine & condenser clothes dryer is included. Excellent Wi-Fi access is provided as well as a fully equipped kitchen, with gas stove, microwave oven, convection oven, dishwasher & fridge freezer should you choose to use it. I also provide clean towels and freshly laundered bed linen on arrival (Bed linen, including DOUBLE pillow coverings, as well as towels are washed weekly for longer term guests).
description: Great WiFi. Access to the front loader washing machine & condenser clothes dryer is included. Excellent Wi-Fi access is provided as well as a fully equippe
neighborhood_overview: Port Melbourne has become one of Melbourne's favourite suburbs and for good reason! This leisurely, sun drenched precinct offers an array of some of the finest entertainment, shopping, relaxation and dining out experiences that Melbourne has to offer. Just ten minutes southwest of Melbourne CBD by light rail (Route 109 terminus is approx 600m walk & serviced every 8 minutes) and walking distance to the famous Bay Street, Port Melbourne Pier (Spirit of Tasmania departure point) with foreshore cafes, restaurants and shops. Two major freeways run adjacent to Port Melbourne, The Westgate Freeway (To Avalon airport, The Surfcoast & Great Ocean Road) and Citylink which provides 'express' access to Tullamarine airport.
notes: The bed is fitted with an electric blanket for an extra pleasant & comfortable sleep in the cooler months (Generally April through to August).
transit: The 109 tram is an easy 600m walk away & provides an easy link into Melbourne's public transport system, especially Southern Cross Station & the CBD.  You will need to purchase a "Myki" card to use the system.  These are available at most train stations as well as 7-11 stores across Melbourne. A bus stop is located approx 200m away on Bay St & requires the same "Myki" card for use.
access: The beach is a 200m walk South & the water is visible from street level at building entrance. The building has a rooftop deck/common area offering 360 degree views of the CBD, Docklands & the Melbourne 'Star' as well as Port Phillip Bay. All are quite spectacular at night & great for unique photographic opportunities. Port Melbourne's  main retail shopping strip, Bay St is a mere 200m walk away to the East & offers an increasingly diverse range of food, café, clothing & entertainment options.
interaction: I'm always up for a chat & am interested in my guest's experiences.  I'm happy to provide opinion & advice about local knowledge if sought : )
house_rules: The room is for the individual/couple that booked it, no friends or 'randoms'. Strictly NO SMOKING in apartment or on the balcony.  If you are a smoker, please take it to the rooftop on level 6 or to the footpath at street level.  Your compliance with this requirement is greatly appreciated. I am providing quality bed & linen in a dedicated bedroom, please DO NOT sleep anywhere else in the apartment. The leather couch in the common area is NOT for sleeping on at guest discretion (Bed linen can be easily removed & cleaned, leather couches cannot be easily cleaned). Guests are welcome to use the kitchen for meals, please place used/dirty dishes in the dishwasher for cleaning when finished. Overhead pantry cupboard on the LEFT of the rangehood as well as the lower shelving of the fridge is dedicated for guest use. Please be respectful of the space, treat everything as if it was your own & leave the space as you found it i.e. Clean & tidy. Please ensure you lock the apartment when you leav
host_about: As a trusted SUPERHOST, I like my guests to feel 'at home' & I've enjoyed meeting people from around Australia & around the world!  I'm quite enjoying my Airbnb experience (Since 2012) & I look forward to meeting you and introducing you to Port Melbourne & Australia! : )

neighborhood_overview: This neighbourhood is very quiet whilst being very close to the city, beach, shops, cafes and restaurants.
notes: There is a farmers market 3rd Sunday of every month at Gasworks a few minutes walk. South Melbourne Market is open Wed, Fri, Sat and Sun offers incredible selection of ingredients to cook with and meals from around the globe - approx 20 minutes walk.
transit: Close to number 1 and 109 tram.
access: Guests have access to communal pool, gym and BBQ area.
interaction: On arrival I can spend time with you to show around the apartment and amenities. I will also provide a local map and leaflets to update you about events taking place during your stay and tips for local restaurants and shops. As I live close by I'm also on hand to help out with questions during your stay.  I've often been called on for extras required such as travel adapters, umbrellas and even a scooter! If there's an essential item you may need let me know as I may be able to help.
house_rules: While this is a great place to enjoy the best of Melbourne it is not a party place. The body corporate is very strict on late night parties and noise and fines are issued if security has to be called out. It is a family friendly place and we are looking for considerate people/family who will be respectful of the apartment, neighbours, facilities, and body corporate rules. The kitchen is stocked with basic ingredients so please help yourself to these things and leave behind useful ingredients for others to share too. Please be honest if anything is broken during your stay. Replacing broken items may mean that your bond will not be used. No smoking or pets are allowed. On departure please start the washing machine with a load of washing and leave all other linen and towels in the bath.
host_about: I'm English but have been living in Melbourne for over 15 years.  Having travelled to numerous cities around the world I consider Melbourne the best city to be in the world.

name: Hip sun drenched Windsor apartment
summary: A stylish home with all the amenities of an actual residence, full of all the mod cons. It's is a super comfy pad overlooking the city with easy access to the vibrance of Chapel St and it doubles as a quiet treetop getaway.
space: Comfortable homely city apartment. This is a super convenient location. Ideally located only metres to Chapel Street, close to trams, Windsor train station, near a variety of fashion shops, cafes, bars, restaurants, florist, and grocery stores. The fresh food and wine Prahran Markets are only 15 minutes walk . The apartment is open plan living with polished parquetry flooring,reverse cycle heating and cooling, a private balcony, fantastic views, dishwasher, stainless steel appliances and fully equipped kitchen. Coffee, tea and condiments included. Juicer and fresh fruit for juicing included. Herbs and vegetables (when in season) can be picked from the balcony garden. Stylish bathroom with fully tiled huge frameless shower and master bedroom with mirrored robes with access to hanging space for clothes and drawers. Security entrance and intercom system. There is on street parking and a guest permit is available to ensure you have good access to resident street parking. Apartment includes

Hi. I works as a Speech Pathologist in the Health Sector. I have an apartment in Windsor, a suburb of Melbourne.

 I love nature, cycling and electronic music.

I am clean, tidy, social and respectful of others and their space. I am particularly considerate of noise levels. I am a non smoker. I speak English and French.

Si vous voulez, je peux communiquer en Français, et parler assez bien.

name: Sunny Central Space for 3!
space: Ideally located within a short drive or 18 minute train ride to the Melbourne CBD.  Surrounded by great cafes, restaurants and Williamstown beach a short 7 minute drive away. Short walk to train station and bus stop. Offering semi self contained accommodation with own entrance via the rear of home to large bedroom and bathroom and also separate living area. neighborhood_overview: Spotswood is ideally located within a walk or short drive to the beach, cafes, restaurants and the Sun Theatre (in Yarraville). It is also home to Science Works  a world renowned interactive science museum in Melbourne, Australia. It is a venue of Museum Victoria which administers the cultural and scientific collections of the State of Victoria Historical Williamstown is a short 5 - 7 minute drive where guests can enjoy a variety of restaurants and cafes,  a swimming beach and botanical gardens. Or perhaps you may wish to enjoy the farmers markets and craft markets that are held regularly along the foreshore.
transit: Bus stop is located less than 1 minute walk away and train station about a 7 minute walk. Also located close to the main freeway that will take you to Geelong and beyond to the Great Ocean Road.
access: Guests will have access to a fully equipped shared kitchen and shared laundry facilities. Bedroom, bathroom and living area are for the exclusive use of the guests only  Guests are provided with their own separate entry via a door at the rear and the location of the  guest bedroom, living area and bathroom allows for complete privacy if required.
interaction: My previous interactions with guests seems to depend on when and if our paths cross during the course of our days. I find that most of the interactions tend to occur if guests are at home for meals and they are using the kitchen to cook in. The kitchen is the midpoint between where the guest accommodation is and where my living quarters are.  Depending on time of year it is possible that I may not be present but there will be someone to meet and greet you on my behalf.
house_rules: Must be clean and tidy especially of shared areas. Inside of home is a smoke free zone.
host_about: Sharing with friendly, sociable and easy going 50 year old female and very likeable 6 year old child.

name: Fitzroy pad with secure Parking
space: Welcome to Melbourne!   Enjoy the best this fabulous city has to offer, right in the heart of it! The Apartment This Fitzroy pad is a modern 2 bedroom apartment on the top floor of a secured building.  The apartment faces onto the quiet courtyard of the complex and hosts modern, open plan living with a large living room and kitchen.  Feel free to make the most of the kitchen facilities and appliances!  You may entertain or enjoy the sunshine on this north facing balcony. Facilities Include Wireless internet,  Laundry facilities including Washer and Dryer  TV with Foxtel included WiFi Air Conditioning and Heating The Area Outside are the cafes, bars, restaurants of Brunswick street right in the heart of vibrant Fitzroy. Stroll to Melbourne Museum, Imax and the city. Transport The 112 Tram is on your doorstep and provides easy access to the City and St Kilda - it also provides direct transport to and from Southern Cross Train Station.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is on Brunswick street which is the Main Street of Fitzroy and is packed with restaurants, bars, cafes and speciality shops and boutique fashion stores. It’s a short stroll to Gertrude street and Smith Street in Collingwood which also have dozens of interesting places to eat, drink and browse. Neighborhood Carlton has the Exhibition building. Melbourne Museum and the IMAX centre
transit: If you are coming by public transport, there is a tram stop right outside the building. This route travels through the city via Collins street and passes Southern Cross station - where the Skybus terminus is for transport to and from the airport.  Tram 11; direction: West Preston; Stop #15: Bell & St David Streets. If you are driving there is a secure parking space (#1098) in the basement of the building on the 2nd level. The garage entrance is via St David street. You will need the remote control from the lockbox to open the garage door on entry and on exit. On the day you check out, be sure to move your car out of the garage before locking the keys inside the apartment
access: You will have access to the entire apartment and also the security parking space in the basement
interaction: I live interstate but just a phone call away and happy to answer any questions you might have
house_rules: * You are responsible for damage, breakages, theft and loss of the Property and any part of it during your stay. You must notify us of this immediately. Management may recover from you repair or replacement cost (at Management's discretion)  * Only the guests nominated and agreed in the Booking may stay in the Property over night. If any other guests stay extra charges may apply or the agreement may be terminated without refund.  * Disturbance to our neighbours, including excessive noise, is prohibited and may result in termination and eviction without refund and extra charges may be made for security and other expenses.  * Before departure, all food must be removed from fridges, all rubbish put in the appropriate council rubbish bins provided, and crockery and cutlery washed and packed away. The Property must be left in a clean and tidy condition.  * Extra cleaning charges may be incurred for the cleaning of dirty dishes, washing machine, dishwasher, emptying the fridge, removal of ex

name: Cosy Inner City Studio Eco-Apartment
summary: Cosy & Spacious - self contained studio apartment with its own street entrance and very quiet. In inner city Melbourne suburb of Brunswick, it's very close to restaurants, cafes, public transport, shops & bars. Also close to Fitzroy, Carlton, Northcote :) There is a kitchenette with microwave, fridge and small cooker. Outside is lovely garden with a lemon tree (that nearly always seems to have lemons) and a very active birdbath. This is a quiet oasis with endless 5 star reviews :)
space: Spacious and private, self contained studio apartment with separate street entrance!. In inner city Melbourne suburb of Brunswick. A short walk to cafes, shops, pubs and bars of Brunswick, close to Fitzroy, Carlton, Northcote and Thornbury. Also close to the public transport & freeway to/from Melbourne airport (Tullamarine) making it convenient & easy for international visitors. I provide as much as possible (towels, soaps, hairdryer, umbrella, internet, TV, air-con, full bedding, Myki smartcards, tea & coffee, milk, bottle of wine, pack of Tim Tams biscuits, etc  :) so you can travel as lightly as possible. The Studio Apartment A new, furnished, freestanding studio apartment in the backyard of my house in Brunswick. Has a separate street entrance so you have complete independence - come and go as you please. Newly built with very high green credentials, it is really cozy and warm. It accommodates 2 people in a very very comfy queen size bed (with King size duvet/quilt!).  A fold out b

neighborhood_overview: Very close to restaurants, cafes, public transport, shops & bars of Brunswick. Also close to other inner-city hotspots of Fitzroy, Carlton, Northcote.
transit: Trams to city are 300 meters away  - couldn't be easier :)
access: The studio has its own street access, so you can come and go freely. ie no need to come through the house
interaction: The studio has its own space, totally separate to the house space. Plenty of opportunity to cross paths, but guests totally have their own space.
house_rules: Easy going overall, but no wild drinking sessions/parties - I have very nice neighbors and don't like to annoy them :) Also, no candles (just too dangerous).
host_about:
Hello - my name is Anthony and I live in Brunswick, Melbourne.

I am a musician and engineer and interested in finding solutions to climate change.

In my music work, I love singing, playing bass and performing. I do everything from performing at weddings, to parties, to busking (which I love).

I enjoy traveling  and exploring cities of the world, whether in Australia or overseas (Europe especially beguiling - London, Paris, Berlin). 

I am into sustainability, pretty relaxed and easygoing, don't smoke, and enjoy meeting up with friends for coffee and films  :)

Also, I have many interests, and tend to go out a lot of the time, rather than being house-bound.

AirBnB says to include a Life Motto ..... well, I like this one..... "Find something you love doing and you'll never work a day in your life"

Best Regards
Anthony

name: Entire apartment - heart of Prahran
summary: Location, Location, Location. Quiet apartment in the heart of Prahran with shopping, cafes & bars all within 5 mins walking distance. Aircon & heating!
space: This apartment is perfect for those wanting to experience the best of Melbourne. Situated in the heart of Prahran and Windsor with cafes, restaurants and shopping right on your doorstep.  Please note Instant booking has now been removed to ensure no double bookings occur. The apartment has a double security entrance and situated at the back of the building where it is lovely and VERY quiet (which surprises everyone). It's fully furnished with sofa, coffee table, LCD TV on the wall, a fully equipped full size kitchen, fridge, washing machine and queen size bed.  Full of natural light and lockable bi fold doors in the lounge room look out over the communal walled garden which let in plenty of fresh air. Living room boasts floating floor boards and air conditioning. Kitchen is a fantastic size for a 1 bedroom apartment; with stone worktops, plenty of cupboards, SMEG cooking appliances and dishdrawer, complete with washing machine and fridge that are tucked away behind a sliding door. Walk
description: Location, Location, Location. Quiet apartment in the heart of Prahran with shopping, cafes & bars all within 5 mins walking distance. Aircon & heating! Full of natural light and lockable bi fold doors in the lounge room look out over the communal walled garden which let in plenty of fresh air. Living room boasts floating floor boards and air conditioning. Kitchen is a fantastic size for a 1 bedroom apartment; with stone worktops
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the heart of Windsor & Prahran which is famous for Chapel street boutique  & high st shops, trendy cafes and an abundance of new and very cool restaurants which have popped up around Chapel and High Street. Some of the local faves which are a 2-5 mins walk: - Dukes Cafe on Chapel Street (best coffee!) - Hanoi Hannah - High Street (3 doors up - modern Vietnamese) - Charlie Dumpling - High Street (5 doors up - modern Chinese) - Saigon Sally - Duke Street off Chapel St (Modern Asian) - That Thai Place - Authentic Thai and cheap on Chapel Street - Orange Cafe/Bar on Chapel Street - Boston Kid on Chapel Street - Sticky Beak Cafe - Green Street off Chapel St - Fonda Mexican - Chapel Street - David's Chinese Yum Cha - Cecil St off Chapel St - Hooked - fish & chips on Chapel St - St Edmunds Cafe - St Edmunds Street - Mission Cafe - Great coffee! on Chapel St - Huxtaburger - across the street - Tokyo Tina - modern Japanese on Chapel St - Mr Miyagi - Japanese on Chape
transit: Trams outside the door, train station is a 5 min walk.
house_rules: CHECK OUT: Check out is strictly 11am unless you have organised a late check out. Please be considerate to my cleaner who has a busy schedule running a cleaning business.  Anyone checking out later than 11am will incur a $50 per part of each hour fee. This will be deducted from your bond. A $A200.00 bond is payable and will be refunded within 5 days in full subject to the below conditions being met. It is designed to cover any additional costs incurred including but not limited to, any breakage, damage or excess cleaning requirements, extra guests beyond those declared, loss of keys etc... The property should be left in a similar state to its condition on arrival. Air-conditioning and lights are to be turned off before leaving and additional bedding used on the sofa or fold out bed is to be stripped and left in the bathroom.  Any food from the fridge, freezer and cupboards are to be removed. Parties and Functions are strictly prohibited. Non smoking and no additional guest are allowed.
host_about: Hi I'm Wendy, please get in touch if you'd like to know more details about my apartments.

summary: Close to Blessington Gardens, close to beach, nightlife, bars, restaurants, cafes , shops, supermarkets, delis, green grocers and all transport. 15-20 min to Melbourne city. Trams at the doorstep.  Perfect for an iconic St Kilda holiday. A walk through the gardens on a warm night is essential to your stay.
space: Lovely Deco Apartment. On Mozart St. Good size Master Bedroom. Child's Room, Plus study/bedroom.  Bath and Shower. Cosy and neat. Close to all amenities and Cafe Precinct/s,  Stunning Blessington Gardens and St Kilda Beach, in the Heart of St Kilda, Melbourne. Bluray DVD,Wifi,Wii,Train,Trams and Buses, close to city. neighborhood_overview: It'(email hidden)ly community. Arty. Friendly. Great restaurants and Cafe's. Close to the beach and gardens. Light (email hidden) No 96 Tram. And 67 tram at Brighton Rd.
notes: Please be aware. This is an old building and the interior is a little rustic in places with only a light Reno. It has a real deco charm, with no air conditioning basic stove and oven and small cooking space. No Diswasher. And Laundry is shared with 5 other units downstairs.  Leave the blinds bathroom door and study door closed on a hot day and the heat doesn't come in. The smoke alarm is super sensitive. The loft is not accessible.
transit: Across the road on Brighton Rd is 67 Tram which gets you into the City in roughly 15mins. Also 3 and 16 on Carlisle St. 96 from Acland light Rail to City via Spencer St. Balaclava Train Station 2 blocks away on Carlisle St. Easy to get around by walking. Everything is a stones throw.
access: Access to all amenities. Use of all kitchen equipment, bed linens, towels. Use of TV, Bluray DVD. Patio BBQ. Wifi. Books to read. Child's room has toys with kitchen set and dolls house.  Very secure. 3rd floor of building. Close to main Rd but noise has never worried us. Always had a good night's sleep. Great sky views at sunset on the patio. 2 min walk to one of St Kilda's hidden gems, Blessington Gardens.
interaction: Only if there's a problem or a question that needs answering. Will leave a house manual with all instructions on this listing.
house_rules: Please keep moderately tidy. No need to wash towels or linen that is used. Enjoy St Kilda and all it has to offer. Don't mind a soirée or gathering but not a full blown party. Treat as you would your own place. Be at home.
host_about:
Clean and tidy comedian. Moved back to St Kilda Feb 2012, and love the community. 
We are often travelling with our work and are happy to have guests enjoy our place when we're away.

name: Artist Warehouse Apartment Fitzroy
summary: If you like Art, Food, Design and Fashion you haven found the place, Located in the heart of Fitzroy in between Brunswick St and Smith St in what was formally a chocolate factory now a stylish Warehouse conversion, filled with my art and others.
space: me and my girlefriend are renting out the second bedroom in my renovated warehouse apartment, the medium sized room is fully furnished has built in robes, queen sized bed, lounge, books, and large warehouse style windows and polished floors.  The flat rotates around the themes of art, literature, good food and sustainability with a big open space with a large kitchen and dining room looking out onto a well stocked vertical garden so if you love to cook, read, relax and enjoy art this place is for you.     Ideal for guests in Melbourne for a short time who want to live like a local in vibrant Fitzroy and who are interested in staying in lovely bright, Art filled apartment and want something much more then a hotel.
description: If you like Art, Food, Design and Fashion you haven found the place, Located in the heart of Fitzroy in between Brunswick St and Smith St in what was formally a chocolate factory now a stylish Warehouse conversion, filled with my art and others. me and my girlefriend are renting out the second bedroom in my renovated warehouse apartment, the medium sized room is fully furnished has built in robes, queen sized bed, lounge, books, and large warehouse style windows and polished floors.  The flat rotates around the themes of art, literature, good food and sustainability with a big open space with a large kitchen and dining room looking out onto a well stocked vertical garden so if you love to cook, read, relax and enjoy art this place is for you.     Ideal for guests in Melbourne for a short time who want to live like a local in vibrant Fitzroy and who are interested in staying in lovely bright, Art filled apartment and want something much more then a hotel. We provide towels, beach towels
neighborhood_overview: Located in a quiet street yet within a very short walk of cafes, restaurants, shops, galleries, studios, bars, pubs, book shops, vintage shops and with large amounts of clothing shops …etc
transit: The #86 and #11 trams are just at the end of the street. or take a relaxed walk down Brunswick St or Smith St into the city via the gardens.
access: We provide towels, beach towels, sheets, blankets, wi-fi internet, Washer/Dryer and lockable storage space in bedroom. The large kitchen has a gas stove and electric oven, plenty of cutlery and crockery, plus plenty of herbs     I have plenty of guide books of all the best food, coffee and drinks places of the cool Melbourne foodie scene.
interaction: As a artist i am some times really busy and other times a bit more relaxed and am able to chat, hangout have a martini. I’m always happy to answer any questions you have about things to see and do, there is always a few art openings going on each night in Melbourne.
house_rules: No smoking, No pets, No big Parties apart from civilized dinner party’s. Tidy up the kitchen after your self and respect the space. and be as sustainable as posable while staying ( turn of lights when not in the room and use the recycling bin)       Relax and enjoy your self!
host_about:
I am full time Artist, Writer, Designer, philosophy loving, well traveled, open-minded and sociable. 
I have currently returned to Melbourne after living in Paris and am now starting up a business aimed at helping the creative industry become more sustainable. 
I have lived in france, UK, germany, china, japan, vietnam as well as travailing to numerus other places around the world.

I have a broad range of interest from art, fashion, architecture, design, philosophy, sustainability, news and current affairs and food!  

I studied sculpture and spacial practises at the Victorian college of the Arts and have goon on to exhibit here in Australia and overseas you can see more of my art and writing on  my website (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

On returning to melbourne I renovated my warehouse apartment instilling all my loves of food, sustainability, art, and socializing  at the core of the design.
When it is not being rented out on AirBnB I run a residency program called the philosophical rose (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

I am easy going and love a good glass of wine, food and good conversation.

name: Artist's Home in South Yarra
space: Stay in cosmopolitan South Yarra, ten minutes by tram from Federation Square and the funky laneways of Australia's most gracious city.  I'm offering a clean, light-filled private room with a queen size bed and shared bathroom facilities. My charming first floor apartment has a lovely leafy outlook from a comfortable sitting room. There's WiFi and parking on the street using my visitor's parking permit. Past guests have praised the fantastic location and speak highly of my relaxed hospitality.  My apartment is half a block from Melbourne's beautiful Botanic Gardens, and an easy walk through parkland to the theatres, concert halls and galleries of the arts precinct on St Kilda Road. The city's world-renowned sports precinct is a casual stroll along the Yarra River, including the MCG for footy and cricket, and Rod Laver Arena for tennis. If it's shopping you're after, the boutiques of Chapel Street and Toorak Road, along with a multitude of restaurants, bars and cafes, are a few tram stop
description: Stay in cosmopolitan South Yarra, ten minutes by tram from Federation Square and the funky laneways of Australia's most gracious city.  I'm offering a clean, light-filled private room with a queen size bed and shared bathroom facilities. My charming first floor apartment has a lovely leafy outlook from a comfortable sitting room. There's WiFi and parking on the street using my visitor's parking permit. Past guests have praised the fantastic location and speak highly of my relaxed hospitality.  My apartment is half a block from Melbourne's beautiful Botanic Gardens, and an easy walk through parkland to the theatres, concert halls and galleries of the arts precinct on St Kilda Road. The city's world-renowned sports precinct is a casual stroll along the Yarra River, including the MCG for footy and cricket, and Rod Laver Arena for tennis. If it's shopping you're after, the boutiques of Chapel Street and Toorak Road, along with a multitude of restaurants, bars and cafes, are a few tram stop
transit: If you arrive in Melbourne via Tullamarine Airport the easiest way into the city is to catch the SkyBus just outside the arrival hall. You can buy a one-way or return ticket at the ticket office there. The 30 minute ride will take you into the city and drop you at Southern Cross Station. From there you can catch a taxi to my place (15 to 20 minutes, depending on the time of day). Or you can walk two blocks east along Collins Street to Williams Street and catch a number 58 tram heading south. This tram goes toward Toorak and takes about 20 minutes to reach South Yarra. Get off at stop 124/Walsh Street and walk one block north along Walsh Street. Turn left into Domain Road and you'll find my place just down from the corner, on the left hand side. You will need a Myki card to use the tram system. You can buy these at the airport, railway station or any convenience stores. Note that tram travel in the city centre is free. In addition there are several other tram routes that travel south fr
access: As my guest you will have your own private bedroom, plus access to all the main rooms and facilities in the apartment. The bathroom and kitchen are shared with me. I provide a key to the front door so you can come and go as you please.
interaction: I will be welcoming you into my home and will be there from day to day. During the day I am usually out and about but I enjoy catching up with my guest at the beginning and end of the day, to hear about their activities, to provide information about what Melbourne has to offer and to discuss whatever is interesting in the world.
house_rules: If you have no previous reviews from Airbnb hosts, it would be helpful before I accept your booking to know something about yourself and your plans for your stay in Melbourne. Check-in after 10am and before 10pm.
host_about: I've travelled to many parts of the world, lived and worked in some of them, but Melbourne is the place that really feels like home to me. Previously in book publishing, I went back to university in the mid 90s and studied Fine Art. Now I'm a professional visual artists with a studio in West Melbourne and loving my new career with a passion. Mostly I make large scale public art installations, but I also do smaller or temporary works for exhibition and private commissions. My spare time and my art practice tend to blend seamlessly together. I love reading and walking in different landscapes.

name: Private, self contained apartment.
space: Perfectly located accommodation for holiday makers, visiting academics, professionals, and serious shoppers! Located at the rear of our main Edwardian residence, you will enjoy the privacy and security that this free standing property has to offer. This apartment is fully furnished with quality furnishings and equipment, private paved courtyard with out door setting & clothesline, and ample free on street parking. Spacious upstairs loft style bedroom with queen bed, draws, wardrobe and a modern ensuite bathroom with shower over bath.  Reverse cycle air conditioning, heating, separate modern kitchen with electric cooktop, oven, fridge, washing machine, microwave, kettle, toaster, 2 chairs & table, lounge room with Flat screen T.V. and CD stereo, wireless internet access and passport safe.  Including, iron, hairdryer, linen, pillows & Doona, towels etc. Just arrive with your bags and start exploring Melbourne, Australia.  10 minutes bus/train trip to Monash University and Monash Medical

access: You will have exclusive access to the apartment during your stay, which is located via a short walk down a secure gated driveway.
house_rules: Hello! We ask Guests to remove footwear when entering the apartment.  And please, no smoking in the space.  It is also important that guests call or message me before their arrival to confirm an arrival time. This is especially important for international guests.  We ask that you ensure that the driveway gate is fully closed as you enter and leave the premises. We ensure the property is cleaned to the highest standard on your arrival, and we ask that the property is left in a clean manner when you leave.  Whist we do charge a small fee to cover the cost of all the bed linen and towels to be dry cleaned for each guest, there is no cleaning fee charged and this is the reason we ask guests to ensure the property is cleaned prior to leaving.  We ask our guests to ensure that all appliances, including heaters, air conditioners and wifi extender remains turned off when the apartment in vacant. We care about our carbon footprint, and we appreciate your mutual understanding. Due to the private
host_about:
John Sharkey originally hails from Ireland, and is a Melbourne based Executive and Leadership Coach, and Corporate Facilitator. 

We enjoy meeting different people from around the globe, we respect your privacy, though we are always up for a ‘chat' and happy to answer any questions you might have that will make your stay more enjoyable!

John is happily married to his wife Kerry and has two beautiful children who he adores, you may on occasion hear them laughing, oh! and we also believe 'what goes around comes around'! 

We look forward to meeting you.

name: ** Cute Studio on Chapel St ** best location
summary: Cosy place for the perfect getaway in Melbourne. Close to best cafes, eateries and public transport! ***NEW: Free Internet from September 1st 2017!!!***
space: Abundance of natural lights in this tasteful studio apartment in St Kilda. (close to famous Chapel Street and Acland Street) Close to public transport (tram stop in front of the door and the train station is just a 5 minutes walk away). Cafes, pubs and shops just around the corner. You can even walk to the beach. The beautiful Alma Park West on the other side of the road.  The apartment provides: -security entry - brand new, fully equipped kitchen with cook top,microwave, fridge  - small meal area - modern stylish furniture - heating - polished timber floors - TV - DVD-player - stereo - double size bed (ideal for couples) - built-in wardrobe - hair dryer - small book & dvd collection - coffee plunger - 100% cotton towels  - ***free unlimited internet access available*** You will get a great fully furnished studio apartment just for yourself, with sheets, blanket and pillow-- ready to move in.   Tram: 78 and 79 at the door step, 5 and 64 less than 500m away and approx 800m to 3, and 16.

neighborhood_overview: Our Studio is only walking minutes away from famous chapel street shops, bars and restaurants!! You get food from al over the world that suits every budget. And really good coffee ;)  We are also right next to a great park for Picknicks, sports or just relaxing.  The city centre (CBD) can easily be reached by train from Windsor station which is 5 walking minutes away. St Kilda with its famous cake shops and beach esplanade is walkable or can be reached by tram which is right outside your door. Tip: Just off Chapel Street you can find Prahran Market for fresh produce and amazing eats! You might bump into one or the other famous Australian Chefs there too.
transit: Tram: 78 and 79 at the door step, 5 and 64 less than 500m away and approx 800m to 3, and 16. Train: Sandringham Line : Windsor Station or Balaclava Station If you like to ride the bike, a Melbourne bike share station is on Fitzroy street which is 15 minutes walking from the apartment block.  Great for bike tours along Port Philipp Bay.  Please check
access: Guest have the studio apartment including bathroom and kitchen fully to themselves.
interaction: We do offer self check-in which gives you great flexibility in regards to your arrival time. Having said that, we are more than happy to meet you to say hi if you like us to.   We are also available via phone, text, (Hidden by Airbnb) or messanger on Airbnb, in case you have any questions.
house_rules: To maintain a good standard for our guests we require certain conditions to be compliant with. We appreciate most will respect our property but the occasional abuse requires that we state the following conditions.  A photo ID will need to be presented, which will be photographed. All our apartments are non-smoking apartments. For smoking please step outside and make sure you don't leave cigarette butts behind. No pets or animals are accepted. Number of Guests should not exceed the number stated on the Confirmation Notice or subsequently agreed in writing or email.  Fees will apply for excess guests not agreed with the owners in advance. Parties and Functions are strictly prohibited. The price charged is for domestic use only and not commercial. Accordingly this rate does not allow for the extra wear associated with functions in terms of cleaning, garbage removal, wear and tear, repairs etc. Damage, breakages, theft and loss are the tenants responsibility during their stay. Departure -
host_about:
We're a German/Italian couple/family. We like the beach, the cafes and the lifestyle of Melbourne especially around St Kilda.
We speak English, wir sprechen deutsch, parliamo italiano, hablamos espagnol, on parle francais aussi.

name: Artist Warehouse Apartment Fitzroy
summary: If you like Art, Food, Design and Fashion you haven found the place, Located in the heart of Fitzroy in between Brunswick St and Smith St in what was formally a chocolate factory now a stylish Warehouse conversion, filled with my art and others.
space: I am renting out my newly renovated warehouse apartment, which has 2 medium sized rooms that are fully furnished, built in robes, queen sized beds, lounge, books, and large warehouse style windows and polished floors.  The flat rotates around the themes of art, literature, good food and sustainability with a big open space with a large kitchen and dining room looking out onto a well stocked vertical garden so if you love to cook, read, relax and enjoy art this place is for you.     Ideal for guests in Melbourne for a short time who want to live like a local in vibrant Fitzroy and who are interested in staying in lovely bright, Art filled apartment and want something much more then a hotel.
description: If you like Art, Food, Design and Fashion you haven found the place, Located in the heart of Fitzroy in between Brunswick St and Smith St in what was formally a chocolate factory now a stylish Warehouse conversion, filled with my art and others.   I am renting out my newly renovated warehouse apartment, which has 2 medium sized rooms that are fully furnished, built in robes, queen sized beds, lounge, books, and large warehouse style windows and polished floors.  The flat rotates around the themes of art, literature, good food and sustainability with a big open space with a large kitchen and dining room looking out onto a well stocked vertical garden so if you love to cook, read, relax and enjoy art this place is for you.     Ideal for guests in Melbourne for a short time who want to live like a local in vibrant Fitzroy and who are interested in staying in lovely bright, Art filled apartment and want something much more then a hotel. We provide towels, sheets, blankets, wi-fi internet,
neighborhood_overview: Located in a quiet street yet within a very short walk of cafes, restaurants, shops, galleries, studios, bars, pubs, book shops, vintage shops and with large amounts of clothing shops …etc
notes: one condition with booking this place is the vertical garden needs your love and watering, daily in summer but very simple to do with the watering can.
transit: The #86 and #112 trams are just at the end of the street. or take a relaxed walk down Brunswick St or Smith St into the city via the gardens.
access: We provide towels, sheets, blankets, wi-fi internet, Washer/Dryer and lockable storage space in bedroom. The large kitchen has a gas stove and electric oven, plenty of cutlery and crockery, plus plenty of herbs     I have plenty of guide books of all the best food, coffee and drinks places of the cool Melbourne foodie scene.
interaction: I’m always happy to answer any questions you have about things to see and do.
house_rules: you will need to give the vertical garden a daily water while you stay.  No smoking (even on the undercover balcony), No pets, No big Parties! but civilized dinner party’s are ok . Tidy up the kitchen after your self and respect the space. and be as sustainable as posable while staying ( turn of lights when not in the room and use the recycling bin under the sink)       Relax and enjoy your self!
host_about:
I am full time Artist, Writer, Designer, philosophy loving, well traveled, open-minded and sociable. 
I have currently returned to Melbourne after living in Paris and am now starting up a business aimed at helping the creative industry become more sustainable. 
I have lived in france, UK, germany, china, japan, vietnam as well as travailing to numerus other places around the world.

I have a broad range of interest from art, fashion, architecture, design, philosophy, sustainability, news and current affairs and food!  

I studied sculpture and spacial practises at the Victorian college of the Arts and have goon on to exhibit here in Australia and overseas you can see more of my art and writing on  my website (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

On returning to melbourne I renovated my warehouse apartment instilling all my loves of food, sustainability, art, and socializing  at the core of the design.
When it is not being rented out on AirBnB I run a residency program called the philosophical rose (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

I am easy going and love a good glass of wine, food and good conversation.

name: Large Victorian Style Building 2
summary: A newly renovated large Victorian style building capable of sleeping up to 26 people.  PRICING VARY DEPENDING ON SEASON, NUMBER OF ROOMS AND PEOPLE.
space: THE PROPERTY Located right across from beautiful Albert Park Lake 1km away from Melbourne City Centre.  It has been recently (2015) completely refurbished comprising 12 guest rooms across 3 levels . The maximum sleeping capacity is 26 people.  Pricing varies depending on how many people, the type of room and how many rooms you book.  Unless you book for all 12 rooms, you MUST share the common area with other guests. BEDROOMS All guest rooms have their own bathroom, furnished with desk, digital tv and dvd player. Continental breakfast can be provided for an additional cost. Guest can also cook their own breakfast. PRICING The price is dependent on the final number of rooms you want (NOT THE NUMBER OF GUESTS). AND UNLESS YOU PAY FOR ALL 12 ROOMS, YOU WILL NOT GET THE ENTIRE BUILDING). Price  includes internet use, towels and fresh linen.   PARKING Free parking is available during non office hours and limited free street parking can be organised upon request.

neighborhood_overview: Everything!!!! Literally!!! South Melbourne is one of the most charming inner city areas of Melbourne, full of boutique shops and restaurants.  Supermarket is 5 minutes away.  If you walk any direction for 2 minutes, you will reach a tram stop that will take you to almost anywhere in inner Melbourne. Albert Park is right across the road, while Royal Botanic Gardens and Eureka Tower are both closeby. Also nearby are Melbourne Cricket Ground and Etihad Stadium.
transit: Very good tram connection takes you to the city and beach within 10 minutes.
access: Keys are handed over by person during office hours or via key drop box during after hours.
interaction: Either myself or my staff will have some level of interaction with guests.
house_rules: IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A PARTY HOUSE, PLEASE FIND SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!' Smoking is only allowed outside. Guests are required to dispose of their own rubbish at the back of the building upon departure.
host_about: I am a melbourne girl with a finance professional background.  Due to passion for travelling, meeting  new people and property, i have, over the last few years, managed to combine my hobbies into owning a guesthouse and a number of apartments in and near the Melbourne city. I hope I can cater all types of groups with the range of accommodation options I offer. I also love the opportunity to show all my guests what a wonderful city Melbourne is. As an airbnb guest, I will look after your place like its my own.

house_rules: You will enjoy your stay even more if you.... - Smoke in outdoor areas, but not inside our apartment - Protect the wooden floor by removing sharp high heels - Respect our neighbours by keeping things quiet after midnight - Respect our apartment and our belongings Enjoy St Kilda & Melbourne!
host_about:
We are a well-travelled, open-minded, 30-something couple who originate from Melbourne. We know this great city like the back of our hands and are happy to answer any questions you may have! 

Things we love include:
- St Kilda & the Bayside area
- Globe trotting & mixing with people from abroad
- Sailing and water sports
- Tibet and Asia, more broadly
- Cooking new recipes

name: Warehouse Conversion Collingwood
summary: Light filled, easy to live in, comfortable, individually styled, right in the heart of the coolest suburb in Melbourne.
space: Welcome to Melbourne! The Loft A Converted warehouse loft, with exposed timber beams and original wood features, in the heart of Melbourne's most vibrant suburb.  The Rooms One bedroom upstairs, plus a study downstairs, this apartment has a large open plan kitchen and living area, with high ceilings and lots of light. It is beautifully furnished and comes with great cooking facilities, a washing machine, dryer, and a car-space. There's is also a courtyard. Location & Transport It is in the heart of Collingwood, and is within an easy walk from many of Melbourne's newest and most fashionable restaurants, bars and cafes. It is moments from Smith St, Gertrude St, Stanley St and Peel St and is surrounded by galleries exhibiting local artist. Collingwood is the heart of Melbourne's thriving cultural scene. There is plenty public transport nearby, and it is walking distance to the city, the MCG, Melbourne Park, Melbourne Museum and many other attractions. Enjoy your stay in the best area in t

name: Sofabed in Yarraville - nice sub
space: I have a sofabed in my house in Yarraville.  Formerly a working-class suburb, in recent years Yarraville has experienced rapid gentrification due to its proximity to the Melbourne city centre. Yarraville lies immediately north of the West Gate Bridge, and immediately west of its namesake, the Yarra River. Anderson and Ballarat Streets, in the heart of the Yarraville Village, are lined with refurbished 19th century buildings and dotted with quaint neighbourhood cafés, restaurants and boutique shops. This village atmosphere is anchored by the restored Sun Theatre and the adjacent Sun bookshop. Notable examples of Edwardian and Victorian architecture can be found in Yarraville. The Yarraville Village is home to many award-winning restaurants and cafes. A reflection of Melbourne’s multicultural nature, Yarraville offers an array of world cuisine styles including Greek, Italian, Modern Asian, Indian, Cambodian, Thai, Chinese and Modern Australian.

name: Fitzroy Terrace - Large Bedroom with ensuite
summary: Get a feel of Melbourne's lifestyle.   This terrace home has been internally renovated with the modern conveniences  and we have kept some of it's historic features.
space: The bedroom is situated on the ground floor, it is fully furnished with a comfortable King bed, desk, walk-in-wardrobe, 2 seater sofa, Smart TV, heating/cooling (which is needed when staying in Melbourne) and your own ensuite bathroom.
description: Get a feel of Melbourne's lifestyle.   This terrace home has been internally renovated with the modern conveniences  and we have kept some of it's historic features. The bedroom is situated on the ground floor, it is fully furnished with a comfortable King bed, desk, walk-in-wardrobe, 2 seater sofa, Smart TV, heating/cooling (which is needed when staying in Melbourne) and your own ensuite bathroom. You will be sharing the kitchen, lounge/dining rooms with the current guests.   Foxtel/Cable TV is in the lounge area. A coin operated washing machine & dryer are on the premises (costing $2 per wash/dry).  We have plenty of drying rack to use to dry your clothes. I don’t live at the property and I am always contactable to help anytime. I like to meet the guests on arrival.  Our other guests that stay here live in a happy and respectful environment. Some have stayed here long term while others are short stays. A fantastic way to get a feel of Melbourne and the inner city lifestyle  This prop
neighborhood_overview: A fantastic way to get a feel of Melbourne and the inner city lifestyle  This property is conveniently close to the city centre (we are bordering East Melbourne, Collingwood and Carlton). Transportation is a few minutes away or just walk where you need to go.  Nearby is Melbourne's Museum, Fitzroy Gardens, Carlton Gardens, IMAX cinema, sporting arenas such as Rod Laver Arena (Australian Tennis Open), and MCG (ALF Football and Cricket).  Vibrant Fitzroy has plenty of cafes, restaurants, bars to chose from and are on Gertrude St, Smith St and Brunswick St (you can literally chose any type of cuisines from all around the world). Vintage shops, galleries, as well as local street art is close....and even the upmarket shopping strip of Collins Street is a 12 minute walk (LV, Chanel etc).  This property is also walking distance to hospitals such as St Vincent's, Epworth Freemasons, and Eye & Ear hospital.  The Coles Supermarket is a 9 minute walk from the house on Smith St.  Foodworks (mini-s
notes: Smoking outside only Clean and tidy environment
transit: The house is in the middle of 2 tram stops (Tram 109 will take you onto Collins Street, through the city, past the Aquarium, past the Casino, all the way to Port Melbourne)...You can also just walk into the city from the property, takes upto 20 minutes to walk to the centre of the city. Parliament Train Station is a 10minute walk. Or hire a bicycle and explore Melbourne (we are a bike friendly city). ...and if you need a car spot, we have space at the rear of the property.
access: You will be sharing the kitchen, lounge/dining rooms with the current guests.   Foxtel/Cable TV is in the lounge area. A coin operated washing machine & dryer are on the premises (costing $2 per wash/dry).  We have plenty of drying rack to use to dry your clothes.
interaction: I don’t live at the property and I am always contactable to help anytime. I like to meet the guests on arrival.  Our other guests that stay here live in a happy and respectful environment. Some have stayed here long term while others are short stays.
house_rules: Respectful and tidy household. Outside Smoking only
host_about:
Hi, I'm Effie, 

Yes I'm back on airbnb, after a long break :)

I was born in Melbourne and have a Greek background.   My son Paul is also involved with looking after this house (now that he's grown up and driving).  We have friendly personalities, and we like to make sure our guests feel at home.   (we have met a number of great people from all around the world and from interstate). We have even kept in touch with our past guests and they are now our friends.

Rent includes gas, electricity and water. Very short walk to Dandenong Hospital and 2 Min walk to Chisholm Tafe. The bedroom is lockable for your privacy  Shared facilities of kitchen. neighborhood_overview: Residential suburban area. Dandenong centre is 5 minutes by bus (20 minutes walk) - offering very multicultural shopping, cafes and restaurants and entertainment facilities. Swimming pool & gym nearby.  Close to beautiful Dandenong Ranges for weekend hiking.
notes: There is an accessible (disability-friendly) bedroom. Shared bathroom facilities are also accessible / disability friendly.
transit: 6 minutes by bus to train station. Central Melbourne 45 minutes by train. Buses run from 6am to 9pm. Trains run until midnight.
access: Lockable sole occupant bedroom, Bathroom (shared with up to 6 others), Laundry with washer & outdoor  clothesline, shared Kitchen with basic appliances - open 7am to 10pm (each person has storage space & own cutlery/crockery), garden area.
interaction: Owner is present in house on weekends and outside of business hours. House members are independent and there is little social interaction, although the atmosphere is friendly.
house_rules: Guests are to keep common areas clean and tidy at all times. Guests are to respect other guests, keeping a quiet and peaceful space (from 7am to 10pm). No pets, no smoking, no drugs. No overnight guests unless prior arrangements have been made.   Cooking not to be left unattended, for the safety of other guests.
host_about: I love life! Everyday is a new experience! I love to help others and enjoy laughing and watching others have a good time! I am a very honest person who will bust his butt to to achieve goals in life! I am very into nature and will pull over on the side of the road to move a turtle so it doesn't get run over. I like all kinds of weather (except when it is over 80 degrees) I don't like watching people get hurt and I will defend people that can't defend themselves! I don't like people who lie or are high and mighty! People who purposely hurt others are scum and should be put away forever! But for the most part I am a content person who believes that we should all stop and enjoy life when ever we can because we are only here a short time and letting life slip by without enjoying it is a waste! I could go on and on but you get the idea of how I am!

name: Share our BigOldFamilyHome in High St Northcote
summary: Super big room with very comfy bed, in vibrant inner city household. Experience the groove of Melbourne’s trendy inner North.  Northcote is less than 5km from the CBD in the heart of Melbourne's hipster zone with the best cafes, bars, music venues & quirky shopping.
space: Our lovely old classic Edwardian home has high ceilings, big rooms, ornate fire places and provides the ideal base for visitors to Melbourne. The home’s old world charm of open fireplaces and backyard chooks is balanced with modern facilities including wireless internet, home cinema and outdoor spa.   Your room: Large and comfy; fully furnished with central heating.  The queen-sized bed has quality linen and a variety of doona options for your comfort.  Fluffy towels, big screen TV, lounge chair, wardrobe, desk and wifi access are all provided.

Whats included: - breakfast (self-serve) - Wifi - Miki card (for public transport) - bicycle, helmet and maps - use of  laundry facilities, and lounge room - choice of two shared bat
neighborhood_overview: We are in the heart of the Westgarth village, nestled between Northcote and Clifton Hill, and just 5km north of Melbourne city centre.  Our area is famous for its cafe culture, funky music venues, Melbourne's best organic grocer, Melbourne's oldest cinema and of course the High St shopping strip - 8 quirky kilometers of it!  What to do locally:  Explore Northcote’s quirky cafes and bars; funky music scene; vintage, retro and speciality shops; and Melbourne’s oldest cinema - all on the doorstep.  For sunshine and quiet moments walk along the Merri Creek or in Edinburgh gardens. You can even borrow a bicycle and follow the Yarra River path all the way to Southbank.
notes: Tea, coffee and basic self serve breakfast is included.
transit: Tram, train and bus at the doorstep. The entire city of greater Melbourne is easily accessible via trams and buses from the front door, and both northbound train lines (Hurstbridge line and Epping/South Morang line) are within a 3minute walk. The 86 tram stops out front, then runs direct to Etihad stadium and Docklands.  The MCG, Hisense Arena and Melbourne’s sports precinct are just down the road. Getting out of town: Make use of the local car share scheme to get out of town; let us organise a kayaking trip for you on the Mornington Peninsula; or ask for our recommendations on biking, hiking, swimming, yoga...
access: Whats included: - breakfast (self-serve) - Wifi - Miki card (for public transport) - bicycle, helmet and maps - use of  laundry facilities, and lounge room - choice of two shared bathrooms - towels, linen, shampoo, soap - use of kitchen to 'heat and eat' (space in the fridge & pantry available upon request) - need a car? Book ours through ''CarNextDoor'' (its cheap, convenient and fully insured) - pat our Labrador, “Bonus”
interaction: We live here so there are lots of opportuniies to interact if we are all home in the evenings. (Guests often join us for dinner.)  However, we also know that sometimes its nice to have some down time and we respect your privacy if you prefer a quiet night in. Your hosts, Sandra and Andrew, are cheerful and helpful with a wealth of local knowledge. Our young Labrador dog “Bonus” loves a pat.
house_rules: 1. No smoking inside the house. 2. Kitchen - help yourself to tea, coffee, breakfast basics and anything from the fruit bowl. You are welcome to use the microwave to 'heat and eat'  We can't promise to cook every night, however we often have communal meals, sharing our cooking with guests, housemates and friends.  You are very welcome to join us and bring a bottle of wine to the table. 3. Laundry  - the Bosch front loader washing machine is pretty straight forward, detergent etc is provided. There is plenty of space to hang washing outdoors, or use one of the clothes horses in your room. There is a dryer for those emergency clothing requirements. Iron, ironing board etc are all available for your use. 4. Please read the information booklet in your room which details local amenities and how to get around.
host_about:
We love Melbourne and are proud to share our city with visitors.
Sandra works in higher education and Andrew runs a home maintenance service. Our hobbies include bushwalking (multi-day pack carrying trips), snow camping, kayaking, tinkering with electronics (Andrew), reading, the Arts (Sandra), travel and entertaining guests.
We love to cook - but not every night :)

name: Executive Bay Views St Kilda
summary: This sun filled, open plan apartment has truly wonderful panoramic views over Port Phillip Bay. It is stylish as well as functional and caters for both the business executive and today's modern family.
space: The furniture, beds, bedding and linen are of the highest quality. We provide free access to Netflix and high speed unlimited internet. The apartment comes with security parking with lift access and the building has a security entrance.  It is located a stone’s throw from St Kilda Junction. You will find yourself a hop, skip and a jump away from a large variety of the best café and shopping strips Melbourne has to offer, including Chapel St in South Yarra, Acland St in St Kilda, Glen Eira Rd in Ripponlea, Ormond Rd in Elwood and Carlisle St in Balaclava.  Public transport is easily accessible to all of Melbourne from St Kilda Junction. However, you won’t want to leave the apartment in case you miss any of the boating goings on in the Bay.
description: This sun filled, open plan apartment has truly wonderful panoramic views over Port Phillip Bay. It is stylish as well as functional and caters for both the business executive and today's modern family. The furniture, beds, bedding and linen are of the highest quality. We provide free access to Netflix and high speed unlimited internet. The apartment comes with security parking with lift access and the building has a security entrance.  It is located a stone’s throw from St Kilda Junction. You will find yourself a hop, skip and a jump away from a large variety of the best café and shopping strips Melbourne has to offer, including Chapel St in South Yarra, Acland St in St Kilda, Glen Eira Rd in Ripponlea, Ormond Rd in Elwood and Carlisle St in Balaclava.  Public transport is easily accessible to all of Melbourne from St Kilda Junction. However, you won’t want to leave the apartment in case you miss any of the boating goings on in the Bay. You will have exclusive access to the apartment.
neighborhood_overview: St Kilda was named after the Lady of St Kilda, a ship which was moored at the main beach in the early 1840’s. The suburb has a rich history and was always seen as a very popular place to be during victorian and Edwardian times due to its proximity to the bay. St Kilda has continued to be a very popular place to live and holiday destination. It is a hub for the Melbourne music scene and has three very identifiable landmarks close together on the Esplanade. The “Espy” – the Esplanade hotel, the Palais Theatre and of course Luna Park, with its array of rides and sideshows sitting on the edge of the water. Acland Street is renowned as being one of Melbourne’s most popular food destinations and it is famous for its array of superb cake shops. if you love gardens and flowers, be sure to visit St Kilda’s Botanic Gardens, also known as Blessington Gardens in Blessington Street. It has one of the most popular rose collections in Victoria. If you would like to see some excellent examples of Edwa
notes: Please feel free to let us know if there is anything we can do during your stay to help.
transit: Getting around is easy from St Kilda, which is located only approx. 5km South of Melbourne’s CBD. Trams commence in Acland St near Barkly St (St Kilda) and run via Acland St, The Esplanade, FitzroySt, South Melbourne Light Rail (Canterbury Rd, Ferrars St and Whiteman St), Clarendon St, SpencerSt, Bourke St (City), Spring St and Nicholson St to terminate near Blyth St (East Brunswick). Access to Melbourne’s rail network is via the Balaclava train station in St Kilda East.
access: You will have exclusive access to the apartment.
interaction: Our reservations and ground teams will be available from 9am until 10pm every day .
house_rules: If you think you may be arriving after 9pm, please let us know in advance.
host_about: Conscientious and hard working

name: Charming 1930s Flat East St Kilda
summary: A very sunny light-filled charming 1930's flat in East St Kilda. Just 5 minutes walk to the fantastic Balaclava shops (cafes, delis, restaurants & more) + tram stop and train station very close by. In 10 minutes you can be in the city.
space: Old style (1930s) one bedroom flat in East St Kilda / Balaclava area, just metres from busy shopping and cafe strip Carlise St.  Carlise st has great cafes (Batch is very close by) as well as bakeries (famous Jewish bakehouse Glicks around the corner), fresh vegie shops and clothes shops all nearby. The apartment is located very close (5 mins) to tram stop and train stations (10 mins train ride to city) and 10 mins walk to St Kilda beach and Acland st (Luna Park). Downtown St Kilda (Acland st area) is very cosmopolitan and busy especially in the summer.  The flat is light filled with polished wood floors and garden views, and is ideal for a couple but also is fine for 2 friends (with one on the sofa bed in the lounge). The flat is not big enough for more that 2 adults but a couple with a small child would also be comfortable. Located on the first floor, the apartment looks out on a beautiful garden setting. Garden is full of flowers and well maintained. Inclusions * Sheets & Towels * F

neighborhood_overview: Balaclava / East St Kilda is a fantastic neighbourhood, the Carlisle st shops have everything - delis, fruit + veg, great bakeries, supermarkets, banks etc. plus great takeaways (lots of sushi!), cafes & restaurants. St Kilda beach is 10 mins walk away.
notes: WIFI is available throughout the flat 24 hours. There is also no TV!
transit: The nearest tram stop is just 30 metres from the flat and train station (Balaclava) is a 5 minute walk away.
access: Whole flat is for rent including WIFI throughout, full kitchen, bathroom + communal laundry out the back of the building.
interaction: I will not be in Melbourne when guests are staying.
house_rules: Smoking is OK on the back porch (but definitely not inside). There is a compost bin (out in the garden) which you can use for vegie scraps. Washing machine and dryer are communal and located at back of flat.
host_about:
I am a well-travelled multilingual Australian who has now been back in Melbourne for four years after spending ten years in Europe (mostly Spain). I run an online magazine / digital hub about yoga and spirituality (The Global Yogi) which is worldwide so I travel quite a bit for that. I do lots of yoga, am a writer and also a musician.

OK life motto: Lean into your fears and your uncertainties, do it anyway and don't be afraid to fly! :)

Come and stay in my retro (1930s) one bedroom flat in East St Kilda! I look forward to hearing from you soon!

name: Spacious, Charming Home!
space: Our Home Our home is a charming, three-bed-plus-study home with a spacious open-plan living area, back terrace and studio. We live there, but we’re away on holiday so renting it out. The bedrooms The bedrooms are a good size, about 3m by 3m. One has built-in robes and drawers, a queen size bed, and a set of french doors onto the front balcony.  One has a bunk bed, built-in robes and French doors on to the balcony. The third is a separate studio easily accessible in the back yard with a double bed, a desk and its own toilet. Finally, the huge couch in the living room can sleep two if needed. Included in your costs are: * Beds with clean sheets and pillows  * Bath towels  * Hair dryer/straightener available  * Furnished lounge & dining room  * Fully stocked kitchen  * Laundry facilities (including detergents)  * BBQ & outdoor area  * Free unlimited wifi broadband  * Free coffee, tea, hot chocolate, milk  The Features Our living area has sandstone floors and contains the lounge room, plus

neighborhood_overview: The home is located in Yarraville, which is one of the coolest areas of Melbourne. We are literally 200 metres from the village, which has a train station (12 minutes to the city!!), two supermarkets, loads of restaurants and cafes, boutiques, and a brilliant old art deco movie theatre.
transit: Train station is 300m away (only 15 mins into the city!). On-street parking readily available.
access: Guests can access the entire house, with the exception of a small locked room for our personal belongings.
interaction: We have a local host and are available 24/7 on the phone or email, whenever you need.
host_about: I am a professional 37 year old male, living with my lovely wife Rowena. We have a 3 year old girl and a six month old boy (but don't worry, you won't hear them at night as you'll be in a studio out the back). I love living in Yarraville because of the unique upbeat/country town vibe and the friendly locals.

name: Peaceful self-contained studio
summary: A self-contained, mud-brick studio on a peaceful property in renowned artists' precinct. Enjoy beautiful views, colourful markets, local bush walks, art galleries, open studios, cafes and wineries while you relax and unwind!
space: Located in bushland on the northeastern outskirts of Melbourne, this peaceful, self-contained, mud-brick studio comprises a large room with adjoining  bathroom/ laundry - and simple cooking facilities (microwave oven, kettle, toaster, slow cooker, crockery, glassware, cutlery and a few essential food and beverage items). Outdoor bbq facilities available. French doors open to a private garden. Colourful market nearby every Saturday, local bushwalking trails, art galleries, artists' studios, cafes, wineries and many food outlets are only a ten-minute drive away. The studio is self contained and guests are welcome to enjoy all verandahs and the outdoors.  I'm always happy to offer suggestions and tips about local highlights to suit your interests, perhaps even share a bush walk. Equally happy to meet you on arrival and leave you to enjoy the peace and solitude. Enjoy a peaceful location in the bush just 40 km northeast of Melbourne. The mud-brick studio is in a separate, private wing of t

neighborhood_overview: Wake up in a peaceful location in the bush just 40 km northeast of Melbourne. Your mud-brick studio is in a separate, private wing of the house, and located on a private property adjacent to the Dunmoochin Foundation. Dunmoochin is a renowned artists' bushland community established in the early 1950s, which now hosts artist-studio residencies. A visit to the colourful Saturday market at St Andrews and/or the Hurstbridge farmers market (first Sunday of the month) is highly recommended. The biannual Nillumbik Open Studio Program, held over two weekends in November and again on one weekend in May, is a must for anyone interested in art or architecture. For wine lovers, the Open Cellars Event is held in October of each year. The nearest Yarra Valley winery, Wedgetail Estate, participates in this event and is in easy walking distance while several other wineries are only a ten-to-fifteen-minute drive away. There are also plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby; I especially like Heart & Soul
notes: *Extra person: $20. A comfortable  (double) air mattress can be provided on request. *Off-street parking. *Bushfire Safety Policy (usually applies in January and February): either party may cancel the reservation at short notice (less than 24 hours) and guests will receive a full refund less AirBnB's service fee. (In the interests of safety, I will happily refund any forfeited AirBnB service fee via a private bank transfer.) This safety policy will apply if the predicted bushfire risk is ''Severe', 'Extreme' or 'Code Red'. * The property is not suitable for small children.
transit: Cottles Bridge is a one-hour drive northeast of the Melbourne CBD or an easy forty-minute drive from Tullamarine airport.  For the bushwalker or cyclist: the nearest public transport is the train at Hurstbridge Station, and it is a pleasant 4 km walk or ride from the station to the studio. A lift from Hurstbridge Station may sometimes be possible.
access: The studio is self contained with a separate entrance and guests are welcome to enjoy all outdoor areas.
interaction: I'm always happy to offer suggestions and tips about local highlights to suit your interests, perhaps even share a bush walk. Equally, I'm happy to meet you on arrival and leave you to enjoy the peace and solitude. Questions? Just text or phone!
house_rules: Please enjoy the property and adjacent bushland respectfully. Rainwater is the only source of water on the property so please conserve water (short showers please, especially in summer months). The property is in a fire-risk area so smoking and the lighting of fires is prohibited. Your canine companion may be able to accompany you by arrangement (however, please note that kangaroos, native birds and other protected wildlife are just outside the door). If we agree that your dog can accompany you, s/he must be friendly, house trained and under control at all times.
host_about: Hi there! I'm a keen bush walker and birdwatcher and would be happy to offer travel suggestions about the best kept secrets in the local area!
