neighborhood_overview: St Kilda is a complex and interesting neighborhood with a rich history and plenty to see and experience. The local food, art, architecture and all wonderfully diverse and original. And of course the beach is only a stones throw away, as is the historic kiosk and pier and the famous Sea (website hidden) Kilda is home to some of Melbourne's best shopping and favourite restaurants, bars and cafes, including: The George, Cicciolina, Tolarno's, Lau's Family Kitchen, Chinta, Circa @ The Prince, Mirka – Tolarno , Cafe and bar Di Stasio, Newmarket Hotel, Mr Wolf and Dr Jekyll, Phamish, iLforniao, Woodfrog bakery. There are notable boutiques too offering original designs and an array of vintage, recycled clothes, home ware stores and bookshops are also located in St.Kilda. Kite-Surfing on the bay and rollerblading, new skate park, Albert Park Lake and Melbourne Sports and Aquatic Centre are all close-by.
notes: Amazing water and city views of the Melbourne sky line.
transit: The apartment is in the heart of St Kilda so all transport, tram, bus etc is in minutes walking distance.Located just 6km from Melbourne's CBD, St Kilda is a beautiful bay-side suburb with something for everyone. It is a walkers paradise, the public transport is also excellent and for you the tram and light-rail are just a minutes walk. With the beach being across the road, it’s a great to be able to walk along the beautiful promenade to sample the fantastic food and admire the stunning sunsets. The apartment provides a quiet and spacious oasis, for both fun and relaxation. It is truly worth every penny to experience this amazing property in this first class location. Come and see for yourself.
access: Provided upon booking via text or messaged via airbnb
interaction: Only there if need to be contacted.
house_rules: Normal respect for the apartment and neighbours. No smoking in the apartment please and no pets. STRICTLY NO PARTIES or GATHERINGS. Neighbour monitors apartment and you will be immediately evicted. and please leave the apartment in as close to condition as when you arrived.
host_about: Hi, I'm Bill in my new life a musician singer songwriter,  Ive been doing airbnb for a few years now, I have a couple of apartments in St Kilda with amazing water/beach front views! An apartment in Glen Iris and a registered shared house in East Malvern for budget ideally long term stays & relocation. My interests are the Melbourne music scene, lunches by the water and writing music and playing guitar.  Any questions please ask. All the best Bill Tolson

name: 3 Level Apartment with Rooftop!
space: The Apartment This unique 2 bedroom+ study property set over 2 levels is perfectly located in the heart of Brunswick East next to a park. Nestled between Lygon St and Glenlyon Rd, this apartment is perfectly set up for the inner city traveller. Don’t miss the opportunity to take advantage of this beautiful space, relaxing rooftop and excellent location. Location and Transport You are within walking distance to famous Lygon St and Sydney Rd and have ample access to public transport which links you to the CBD within 15 mins by tram. The Rooms and Facilites The apartment has 2 bedrooms with queen beds (on the ground floor), study, 1 bathroom and 2 toilets, open plan lounge and dining areas (on the second level) and fully equipped kitchen. Access to a balcony via second level and spiral staircase to rooftop decking that boasts city views, perfect for summer entertaining. Includes Parking! Apartment also comes with 1 undercover/secure parking space and is pet

name: Art filled, 2 Bedroom Apartment in Melbourne CBD
summary: High Ceilings, clean,  functional, spacious 2 bedroom apartment. Conveniently located to Vic Markets, Flagstaff Gardens and moments away from everything this fabulous city has to offer.
space: A Spacious, art and book filled 2 Bedroom Apartment within a unique, 6th floor heritage-listed building in the heart of Melbourne's Market Precinct. The lounge room has a very efficient Aircon that warms or cools the apartment quickly.  The Bathroom has a lovely Rain Shower Head.   The Kitchen is equiped with a gas stove top and oven. Feel free to use whatever utensils and food in the cupboards you need to make your cooking happen. There's also a microwave for reheating any fabulous take away meals you might bring home.   There's a Gym and pool with heated spa downstairs and across the way. Total floor area is 60 Square Meters (645 Square ft) The standard nightly rate is for a maximum of 2 couples (4 People).

To Access the Apartment you will need to simply retrieve the keys from a lockbox located in a l
neighborhood_overview: You will be staying in the 'Market Precinct' of Melbourne, which is the North West corner of the CBD.  Indulge at the Queen Victoria Market's extensive range of fresh fruit, vegetables, and elaborate deli offerings. Stroll through Flagstaff Gardens or bring a picnic to lounge in the grass on a pleasant day, it's only a block away. A quick walk North East takes you up to Carlton, enjoy al fresco dining, boutiques, and the heritage listed Carlton Gardens. Head West one morning to the Docklands to savour a cup of coffee on the board walk. Explore Federation Square, the NGV, and the extensive Royal Botanical Gardens to the South.
transit: This is an ideal location to get anywhere and everywhere you could possibly need!  You will be staying within Melbourne's free tram zone, making it that much easier to get around. Literally outside your door is a network of buses and across the street is the Flagstaff Station. If you're keen to explore the city on foot, a journey to Federation Square is about 20 minutes away - if you aren't tempted by Melbourne's famous laneways, cafes, and shops along the way.
access: To Access the Apartment you will need to simply retrieve the keys from a lockbox located in a laneway nearby. You will be staying on the 6th floor of a heritage listed boutique building. The entrance to the building has 6 steps leading up to an elevator. Our building is very quiet and ideal for working or just relaxing on the couch and watching an awesome movie projector after a hard day's city exploration.  Included with your stay is access to a lap pool and fully equipped gym, projector to watch an extensive collection of movies and TV series, an office desk and comfy work chair, high speed wireless Internet, fully functional kitchen with everything you need to cook and serve meals (I LOVE to cook), very comfortable Queen size bed and Double bed, and plenty of cupboard space to fold or hang your things. Towels and linen are provided and there is also a self contained laundry with washer and dryer.
interaction: I love the city and will be happy to point you in the direction of the best coffee, food, and  things to do.
house_rules: Absolutely NO SMOKING is allowed within the flat or building Everything to keep the house reasonably clean is provided within the apartment. Please be aware of your neighbours. This is an apartment building with thin floors so loud noises after 10PM will not be tolerated.  Please bear in mind replacing the Grey pool/Gym security swipe key is AU$55 hence the security deposit. Oh and if you use the gym facilities be sure to take your own towel. The gym peeps are pretty particular about it.
host_about:
I've been a professional Musician for over  20 years. Currently based in Melbourne. I love most creative audio and visual forms and have dabbled in quite a few throughout my career.

My wife Elizabeth and I met and married in Hong Kong before moving back to Melbourne in 2014. 

We have a passion for Movies, animation, great art exhibitions, writing, food made with heart and wandering aimlessly around new cities. 

I have travelled a lot through my work and just randomly. My favourite places include The Greek Islands, Istanbul, NYC, Paris, Hong Kong, Tokyo, Italy, Ticino in Switzerland, Peru and Fiji. :)   

I travel as lightly as I can having developed a keen skill for it over the years of touring in my band.

Though I have been a long-time Rock Musician I neither drink (haven't done for years) and have never been a smoker. I like to rebel against the rebels ;)

We have a two year old son called Cassius who keeps us on our toes and up at night. 

When I am a guest in other's houses I always try to be careful and respectful of their space and belongings. I own an apartment in the Melbourne CBD which I have rented out fully furnished to nice people before so I know how important mutual respect is in these situations (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

If I had a motto it would be: Life is a short intermission: Enjoy the popcorn!

host_about:
I love living by the Ocean, Walking, Running, Bike Riding & Snow Skiing . .Beautiful Food, Wine & Music in any shape or form. The Apartments we have I enjoy sharing with others.  I have endeavoured to style and present them in a tasteful, comfortable, professional way. I am a fussy Traveller and like Clean, Uncluttered, Funky, Classy Accommodation.
My favourite Travel Destinations in Australia are Melbourne CBD, Lorne Victoria, Byron Bay & Merimbula NSW, Noosa Qld & Sydney CBD Rocks area, Bunker Bay & all the beaches and wineries in WA. I love the Napa Valley in California and the Drive down Big Sur Highway to LA. Soho in New York
I love to Snow Ski in Japan, Whistler, Snowbird, Revelstoke, & all through California.. 
I am passionate about the 'Pay It Forward' principal of caring about others!
“When I travel I make it a journey
When I go to different places I experience them
When I meet new people I learn
When I taste new flavors I grow
When I follow my intuition I loose myself
When I sense I recall
All these unique experiences are unforgettable
And when I return it’s not my ego that is big
It’s my memory”
'Be Authentic'

summary: Freestanding garden bungalow in a delightful garden setting, complete with your own personal courtyard. Spacious and fully equipped for a comfortable stay.
space: We invite you to stay in this private self contained solid brick one bedroom unit set in a garden setting. name: Old distillery quiet and central
summary: A whole floor in a fascinating old distillery & malting complex - a calm oasis within an old industrial area now home to art galleries, fashion houses and creative startups. Minutes from vibrant Gertrude & Smith Sts and a lovely walk through parks to the CBD.
space: Our apartment is part of a fascinating old red brick brewery complex built in 1862 - when Melbourne was 25 years old! It's an amazing oasis in the middle of an old industrial/brewery area now mainly occupied by architects, art galleries, graphic studios and fashion outlets. Although only minutes from vibrant Smith, Gertrude and Brunswick Sts the area is surprisingly peaceful. Your space has its own private door onto one of Collingwood's funky graffiti covered lanes which features a new cafe, artist run gallery and neon artworks glowing night. It would suit a couple or two single people.
description: A whole floor in a fascinating old distillery & malting complex - a calm oasis within an old industrial area now home to art galleries, fashion houses and creative startups. Minutes from vibrant Gertrude & Smith Sts and a lovely walk through parks to the CBD.    Our apartment is part of a fascinating old red brick brewery complex built in 1862 - when Melbourne was 25 years old! It's an amazing oasis in the middle of an old industrial/brewery area now mainly occupied by architects, art galleries, graphic studios and fashion outlets. Although only minutes from vibrant Smith, Gertrude and Brunswick Sts the area is surprisingly peaceful. Your space has its own private door onto one of Collingwood's funky graffiti covered lanes which features a new cafe, artist run gallery and neon artworks glowing night. It would suit a couple or two single people. You have use of the whole ground floor consisting of gallery, bedroom/study/kitchenette & bathroom. The bedroom contains a super comfortable qu
neighborhood_overview: Vibrant Smith, Gertrude and Brunswick Steets offer funky shopping, art, food and fashion and are just a short walk away. There are also many interesting cafes and shops to explore in the Collingwood industrial back streets, e.g. the Lemon, Middle and Orange cafe just outside your back door. Melbourne CBD is a lovely 10 min tram ride, or a 20 minute stroll through the magnificent Fitzroy and Treasury gardens or along Gertrude St past the Carlton gardens/Exhibition Building/Melbourne Museum. The MCG and Tennis Stadiums are an easy walk and beyond that the Botanical Gardens and National Gallery. There are many hospitals (St Vincents, Freemasons, Epworth, Eye & Ear) and universities (Melbourne Uni, RMIT, ACU) nearby. An interesting walk through beautiful East Melbourne takes you to the Bridge Rd fashion outlets. The Vietnamese quarter is close by along Victoria Pde.  Amazingly, the bushland of Yarra bend national park is less than 20 minutes walk, a  further stroll along the river to the C
notes: We are happy to run a load of washing for you. There's an iron & small ironing board in the room - just ask to borrow a full sized one if required.
transit: It's very easy to get here. Southern Cross Station (and the Airport Express Bus Terminal) are a 20 min direct tram plus 5 min walk. We are easily accessed by car from the Eastern or Monash Freeways. We may be able to provide a visitor's parking permit for 24 hour street parking but please check with us before booking.  Public transport is minutes away with a choice of two trams to the city via Gertrude St or Victoria St, loads of buses and North Richmond train station. Direct trams to St Kilda, St Kilda Beach, Port Melbourne & Docklands. We can lend you Myki cards for your stay. A supermarket, bottle shop and all manner of fascinating shops, pubs, cafes and restaurants are all within easy walking distance.
access: You have use of the whole ground floor consisting of gallery, bedroom/study/kitchenette & bathroom. The bedroom contains a super comfortable queen bed, WiFi, TV and small sitting area overlooking a leafy internal light well. An air conditioner for winter heating/summer cooling as well as fans & electric blanket. A separate office opens off the bedroom with a good work desk, a eclectic collection of books, (old) iPad and (older) iMac you are very welcome to use. This extra room would suit independent guests and would be very useful if you need somewhere to work. There's a single bed on a mezzanine level in the office accessed via a ladder. While there's no door between the rooms the beds are well out of sight. You have a small refrigerator, kettle, microwave, toaster, tea/coffee & breakfast cereals, milk, spreads etc. The bathroom is at the other end of the gallery and is for your use only. You are welcome to use our kitchen upstairs to prepare meals and may like to have breakfast in th
interaction: Mercedes and I are always happy to give local advice and help you make the most of your visit. We often enjoy sharing stories with guests but of course you can come and go just as you please - either by the front door or the door in your room. We won't bother you however if you have a query, or feel in need of a chat, we'd be delighted to oblige. We are generally around.
house_rules: Our living room upstairs is open to the gallery so we ask you to be quiet in this area when we're at home.  Please keep the upstairs kitchen and gallery clean after use as these are shared areas.  No smoking inside the building but you can in the courtyard or back lane.  You a very welcome to explore our rather eclectic book collection - just put books back where you find them. Please let us know beforehand if you intend to bring other people into our home.  Thanks!!!
host_about:
Mercedes has a background in social work/counselling, teaching, farming & fashion and follows passions in art and craft, gardening, home renovation and volunteer activities. Paul had a university career in science, education, software development and information system and is occupied on a range of woodwork, jewellery, home renovation & app development projects. We've both travelled quite widely over the years and have grand plans for the future. 

Airbnb was a revelation to us - discovered through Paul's daughter, an active host in Fairfield and frequent traveller. Now multiple family members have become active and enthusiastic hosts and travellers. We love living in this great part of Melbourne with its history, architecture, galleries, cafés and dynamic cultural mix and feel privileged to be able to share our passion with others. We'll be only too pleased to help you make the most of your stay in Melbourne.

neighborhood_overview: Within walking distance of Bridge Road and Swan Street, where you’ll find great restaurants, bars, cafes, supermarkets, shopping and night life. Walk to 1000 Blessings, a fab little cafe for great coffee and a tasty treat. The Weekend Farmers’ Market, bursting with fresh produce and loads of atmosphere. Richmond Recreation Centre, with gym and 50 metre indoor pool and a large park with BBQ areas, playground and oval, are all just around the corner. Hop on a tram and in minutes you’ll be in the heart of Melbourne city or in trendy Chapel Street South Yarra with its endless fashion stores and cafes. There’s easy access to Melbourne’s major venues – the MCG, Hisense and AAMI Arenas and Rod Laver Arena – home of the Australian Open. This apartment is close to everything Melbourne has to offer. Definitely the place to stay! Also only minutes away from Epworth Hospital and The Melbourne Clinic.
notes: First floor apartment without lift access.  Double storey apartment with internal spiral staircase to upper level. Permissible sized hot water tank that requires time to reheat water between use, especially between showers. THANK YOU! Thanks for taking the time to read our Listing. We really appreciate it! Let us know you have by mentioning 'Read the Listing!' in your first message to us. Cheers, Frank and Vince
transit: Our apartment is located within walking distance of all the major attractions, and for travelling further afield, trams are a short stroll away, so getting around is a breeze!
access: Guests have exclusive and private access to the entire apartment. Check-in details provided once booking is confirmed.
interaction: We don't always get to meet all our guests in person, however we're available if you need us! Simply get in touch and we'll be happy to help out with any questions or assistance you may need before or during your stay.
house_rules: Please take a moment now to read our House Rules. COMMUNICATION All communication is via airbnb messaging only. Ensure you have AIRBNB APP and mobile connectivity, so we can easily communicate. GUEST BOOKING, GUEST NUMBER, GUESTS STAYING AND BEDDING For personal travel, you as guest booking must be one of guests staying for entire stay. Number of guests staying limited to maximum number allowed in property and as confirmed and paid for in airbnb. Where bedding options offered, such as king beds or king single beds, you must request your preference at time of booking. Where extra bedding offered, no extra bedding provided if number of guests staying is property standard occupancy, unless extra bedding is requested and paid for by you in airbnb at time of booking. Bedding preferences / extra bedding can not be guaranteed. SELF CHECK IN FROM 3PM / SELF CHECK-OUT TO 10AM Following information in AIRBNB APP: - DIRECTIONS TO PROPERTY - SELF CHECK-IN/OUT PROCEDURE - WIFI DETAILS - HOUSE MANUA
host_about:
Hi, we’re Frank and Vince.

Thanks for reading our profile.

We love hosting, and when time permits, travelling!

As guests, we understand and appreciate the guest/host relationship, so will always be respectful of both you and your home, and look forward to sharing the experience.

As hosts, we thank you for considering us for your Melbourne stay. You can view all our airbnb apartments and homes here: https://www.airbnb.com.au/users/50121/listings

We've been welcoming guests to our homes since 2009, when we established 'a2c urban stays Melbourne', a collection of unique, hand-selected inner Melbourne properties, specifically designed for welcoming, memorable short stays.

Featuring stylish contemporary interiors, in the best lifestyle locations, our properties are situated in the very heart of Melbourne’s hippest inner-city areas. All our apartments and homes are within a short stroll of cafes, restaurants, shopping, night life and public transport. Cultural and sporting facilities including MCG/Hisense/Etihad Stadiums, Melbourne waterfront, Melbourne City Centre and some of Melbourne’s best beaches are easily accessible.

Our guests enjoy free wifi, superior comfort beds, high quality bed linens and towels, entertainment systems offering large flat screen TVs, sound systems, books, magazines, air-conditioning*, heating, full size fully equipped kitchens with Euro appliances, laundry facilities*, parking*, complimentary starter provisions and housekeeping service for longer stays*.
*Please enquire before booking.

Exceeding guest expectations is what we’re about.

If you’re looking for a truly special and authentic Melbourne experience, in a warm, stylish inviting space that is close to the many wonderful attractions our city is famous for, then we’re the perfect choice. Feel free to contact us and we’ll be happy to assist you plan your perfect stay.

As hosts, we look forward to welcoming you. As guests, we look forward to discovering your home and surrounds.

Warm regards,

Frank and Vince

summary: The Apartment is large, it's an old style building designed for living. Two large bedrooms, two full size bathrooms, two living areas and full of light. Walking distance to the CBD. Melbourne , The worlds most livable city for the 6th year running!

house_rules: Treat the home as your own. This has been a family apartment  used for weekends and holidays. We enjoy it and hope you can as well. No smoking inside, and If you break anything or find something isn't working, please just let me know.  Everything is straight forward. host_about:
I've lived in Malaysia, Singapore, & Brunei, I'm well travelled, and now work as an Architect in Melbourne. I've lived in and renovated, all three of our Airbnb's the ''Bluestone Cottage'' in Fitzroy, "Architect designed  Studio" in Collingwood,  and ''My cup of tea'' in Walkerville. I hope my guests enjoy some of the personality I've put into each property.
I cant live with out my dogs, good coffee, quality food and great company.

name: Snug Seaside Cottage Vic. Aust.
summary: Close to calm and gentle beach, golf course, railway station and with many Melbourne style cafes. At the beginning of the Great Ocean Road . A light, bright double room, comfy queen size bed plus adjacent relaxing seating area within a quaint, calm and peaceful period cottage. Shared kitchen, living/dining room, bathroom and beautiful courtyard. WiFi provided and perfect for couples, solo adventurers and business travelers. All the advantages of seaside living and close to the city.
space: Double room with queen size bed, built in wardrobe, share bathroom and use of rest of the house, breakfast provided. In a beautifully maintained historic 1940's seaside cottage, 3 mins from the beachfront with running and bicycling paths, 3 minutes to golf course,, 6 minute walk to railway station, 15 mins walk to cafes and shops. TV & Wireless internet provided. Car ferry service from local railway station if you have a lot of luggage and directions to all local services and attractions, shops and facilities provided. A supermarket and Melbourne style cafes and restaurants just 15 minutes away. Bikes are provided to guests and see printable Guidebook for all local attractions. Close to booking facility and local pick up point for tours to all the most popular tours in Victoria:  Great Ocean Road, Phillip Island Penguins, Yarra Valley wineries and Grampians.

neighborhood_overview: Altona is a quiet seaside village with a beach that gets very busy if the weather is very, very hot. It is also favorite place for kite boarding and the sight of many colourful kites flying in the air as the boarders skim over the sea surface is beautiful. As well Williamstown, the first port in Melbourne with many colonial and Victorian buildings is just 10 minutes drive away. It is a mecca for fine dining, snazzy shopping and great restaurants as well as many fine yacht clubs.
notes: Altona is a good starting point for trips down the Great Ocean Road and into other areas in the hinterland of Victoria such as the old gold rush towns. As well you can not only go into the city by train you can also catch the ferry from Williamstown to Melbourne. If people want it I provide a tour around the local area so guests can orientate themselves to what is available where plus good places to wander along a beach or sit quietly in a cafe. I also provide bikes to enable guests to ride along the very attractive beachside paths which stretch all the way from Altona to Williamstown. There is a craft brewery in nearby Newport as well as a Science Museum. No stays longer than 1 month. No dogs allowed.
transit: Seaside Cottage is 5 minutes walk from the nearest railway station and there are buses which travel to largest local shopping mall. As well there is a ferry service to Melbourne from Williamstown. Altona is also has easy access to all major highways in Melnbourne so depending on what time of day you are travelling, it is easy to get around.
access: You have your own double room, with it's own sitting area with 2 comfy rocking chairs and tea and coffee facilities. There's plenty of room  for storing luggage and clothing. The rest of the house is shared: a kitchen with all facilities, an area for dining, sitting, TV and interaction between guests. A shared bathroom with all facilities and toiletries supplied. there is also a very attractive outside courtyard with shelter from the sun if needed
interaction: I am available to provide help and assistance with everything needed to make your stay comfortable, relaxed and rewarding. Plenty of information on both local, Melbourne and Victoria wide tourist attractions plus all information on public transport and how to book tours. However some guests really want a quiet rest away from interraction with others as much as possible and I support that in every way I can.
host_about:
I am a committed healthy eater and exerciser, reader, political wonk, love being out near, or living in, nature, delighting in my friends and family, most especially my 3 glorious grandchildren. Travel to see them regularly in New York City.
What I can't do without: my friends, living by the sea, my kindle, my ipad and the comfort of my little cottage.

I not only travel regularly to New York to see my 3 grandchildren I also write a daily blog about New York ( my way of keeping in touch with their lives) and maintain a (Hidden by Airbnb) apge promoting my site and I offer curated individual itineraries for people travelling to New York. It makes such a diference when someone tells where to go to get the best coffee, the best meals and the best shopping.

I like my guests to really feel at home and relaxed in my cottage. I'm more than happy to tell people about the surrounding area and the delights of the broader Melbourne metropolis and also great trips to scenic places outside of Melbourne. I also give people a guided tour of Altona and Williamstown so they can appreciate the pleasure of these 2 seaside villages if that is something they would enjoy. That said, I'm more than happy to keep out of my guests way and let them just relax if that is their need.
